title: Associate Product Manager
description:
About qikfox, Inc.

At Qikfox Inc., We are working diligently to design and define the future of the Trustworthy Internet. We are forging a path to a future where the Internet is synonymous with safety, security, and reliability. Known for our innovative qikfox Smart Browser and Safe Search Engine, we focus on delivering exceptional consumer experiences that bring peace of mind to digital consumers. Join us in our mission to revolutionize the way internet functions, where you will be more than an employee – you'll participate in designing a safer, more secure digital future for consumers and businesses alike.




Position Summary

Ready to design AI Enabled Products?

We are seeking a highly motivated and proactive Associate Product Manager to join our Product Management and Digital Marketing teams. This role is ideal for an engineering graduate with excellent communication skills and an MBA who is eager to learn and contribute to both product management and digital marketing.




Key Responsibilities

 * Participate in product management activities like Product Definition, Design, Development, and Launch.
 * Produce and review product requirements documents (PRD).
 * Work with senior product managers and/or executive team to create product plans and roadmaps.
 * Collect feedback from customers and other stakeholders to shape requirements, features, and end products.
 * Analyze consumer feedback and participate in aligning product features with company strategy and vision.
 * Run product SCRUMs and participate in product design and development.
 * Ensure products and releases are launched correctly and on schedule.
 * Make creative recommendations to expand product base and vision.
 * Suggest ways to track product use and impact on end-users.




Qualifications

 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills (MUST HAVE - Non Negotiable)
 * Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (CS, Electronics, Industrial, Robotics preferred)
 * Strong willingness to learn and grow in Product Management and Digital Marketing.
 * Strong problem-solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills.
 * Ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently.
 * Familiarity with Product Management and Software Engineering tools like Jira.




Preferred Skills

 * Experience in product management or digital marketing is a plus.
 * MBA in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
 * Knowledge of Agile methodologies and product lifecycle management.
 * Familiarity with the latest trends in customer-facing digital trends.




NOTE: This role is for freshers interested in building career in Product Design and Management of digital software products. The role requires a bond of 2 years apart from the training period. Please apply only if you are willing to sign a bond.

title: Product Owner - Process Manager
description:
Description

ValGenesis is looking for passionate and experienced Product Owners to join our rapidly growing team. Your focus will be on the overall success of a ValGenesis product line and strategy. You will work closely with Product Management on our product strategy and focus our development teams on the delivery of high-value capabilities.

Responsibilities


 * Work closely with Product Management to create and maintain a product backlog according to business value
 * Develop and explicitly communicate product goals and vision to the team
 * Represent the voice of the customer, collaborating with prospective users to understand and anticipate their needs and translate them into product requirements
 * Create and communicate product backlog items
 * Work closely with Professional Services, Support, Engineering, and Quality Assurance to ensure the right customer problems are solved
 * Assess value, develop cases, and prioritize stories and epics to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value that are aligned with product strategy
 * Define acceptance criteria, review work done, and make the ultimate decision on when work is ready to ship
 * Monitor and communicate progress within the team and to external stakeholders
 * Provide an active role in mitigating impediments impacting successful team completion of Release/Sprint Goals
 * Participates in prioritization of issue resolution
   
   

Deliverables


 * Product release plan in partnership with Product Management
 * Product Epics, Features and User Stories
 * Prioritized Product and Sprint Backlogs
 * Supporting documents, images, and wireframes for user stories
 * Progress reports such as sprint and backlog burndown charts
 * Success metrics and ROI for product portfolio
   
   

Requirements


 * 3+ years of experience of proven Product Owner experience
 * Experience using a range of metrics to monitor the success and health of products
 * Proven experience working with agile teams to continuously ship customer value
 * Experience applying structured prioritization methods to competing priorities
 * A solid track record of addressing customer needs, with a focus on connecting teams with users (not just being a proxy)
 * Excellent stakeholder management skills and the ability to build meaningful relationships across all levels of the business
 * Experience managing 3rd-party integrations and launching APIs as a product
 * Experience acting as a product manager in agile development and rapid prototyping environment
   
   

Preferred


 * Relevant enterprise software experience within the Life Sciences industry and a solid understanding of GxP requirements
 * Scrum Certifications (Certified Scrum Master, Certified Scrum Product Owner)
   
   

How We Work

Our Chennai and Bangalore offices are onsite, 5 days per week. We believe that in-person interaction and collaboration fosters creativity, and a sense of community, and is critical to our future success as a company.

ValGenesis is an equal-opportunity employer that makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. Our goal is to have the best-qualified people in every job. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics protected by local law.

title: Associate Product Manager
description:
The Luxury Closet is a company born in Dubai, the heart of luxury in the Arabian Peninsula, where we are redefining the world of luxury. We seek to challenge the norms and build a sustainable company that is loved and admired, and inspires the modern-day luxury consumer.

Our aim is to unlock and curate the most valuable and exclusive closets from around the world.

What do we offer?


 * A young, dynamic and forward-thinking environment
 * Fast paced and very short decision times for changes
 * A canvas for you to truly excel
 * 99% of uptime on sunshine
   
   

About The Role

To enrich our product team, we are looking for a passionate Product Manager to improve our seller user experience journey and improve seller retention. The person will be responsible to plan and execute the entire roadmap of seller experience. The person will work with CXOs and Director-Product directly. The person will work with a team of engineers, content specialists and designers to build a top-notch web & mobile product for The Luxury Closet for enriching seller experience.

The person will get -


 * Great Learning Experience & Exposure (working with senior leaders and superb tech, operations and marketing teams)
 * Opportunity to be ambitious and independent (Strong product driven culture)
 * Right Place at the Right Time (Every luxury fashion company is working on Sustainable Fashion)
 * Location (You get to choose where you want to work from)
   
   

Responsibilities:


 * Do user research, competitive environment analysis and industry trends to define a differentiated product vision that delivers unique value
 * Determines user's needs and desires by specifying the research needed to obtain market information (What are our users doing?)
 * Ideating on new features or defining even completely new ways of how to do business
 * Defining features and requirements to create quarterly product roadmap, working with designers, developers and marketing, content teams to deliver results
 * Extensive data analysis on supply forecasting model, product pricing model, supply merchandising analysis, user behavior analysis, discount forecasting, etc
 * Working with CXOs directly to develop product strategy
 * Continuously monitoring the impacts of initiatives released in the past
 * Providing information to the management by preparing short-term and long-term sales forecasts and special reports and analyses; answering questions and requests
 * Improve processes and operations by making the existing processes more efficient
   
   

Requirements


 * MUST HAVE: IT/Engineering Degree, Product experience of 2-3 years minimum (preferably consumer internet background) on both Web & App platforms
 * Good understanding of excel, SQL, Google Analytics, and should have executed data analysis in previous roles
 * A track record of doing well at *each* of level 1 through level 5 or 6 in Dacheng Zhao's PM career ladder (applies to whatever level you have worked till now)
 * High Agency attitude Read here- https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/high-agency-its-importance-how-cultivate-shreyas-doshi/
 * Strong Work Ethic Read here- https://m.signalvnoise.com/work-ethic/
 * High appetite to learn new things
 * Great analytical skills and ability to derive insights out of data
 * Understanding of the technical architecture of complex desktop / mobile applications
 * Intuitiveness and ability to think like an end user
 * Should be conversant with most of the product prioritization frameworks
 * Ability to create mock wireframes (low fidelity at least)

title: Product Manager (Full Time, Remote)
description:
Description

At Hike, we’re building the Rush Gaming Universe 🎮 📲 💰

To know more, check out work.hike.in.

Hike Code 📝( Our core cultural values )

The Hike Code Is Our Cultural Operating System. It Is Our Set Of Values That Guides Us Operationally On a Day-to-day Basis. We Have 9 Core Values


 * Top Talent in Every Role → Both a quest for greatness & shared values are important to us 🦸‍♂️
 * Pro-Sports Team → Strength-based, results-driven with a "team-first" attitude ⚽️
 * Customer Obsession → We exist to delight our customers 😃
 * Innovation & Make Magic → Courage to walk into the unknown and pioneer new fronts 🙀
 * Owner not a Renter → Proactive & radically responsible. Everyone is an owner 🤝
 * Think Deeply → Clear mind, obsession to simplify & data-informed 🙇‍♀️
 * Move Fast → Ruthless prioritization & move fast 🙋‍♂️
 * Be curious & keep learning → Curiosity to acquire new perspectives, quickly 👨‍🏫
 * Dream Big → Courage to climb big mountains 🚀
   
   

Skills & Experience We're Looking For 👨‍💻


 * You have 3+ years of experience in delivering and scaling highly successful and innovative consumer Internet products with stellar design taste, creativity and product instincts, any prior experience of driving growth product strategy for a Gaming company would be a plus | Top Talent in every role
 * Proven ability to build incredible products that not only delight customers but also contribute significantly to revenue I Customer Obsession
 * You are steady under pressure in a fast-paced environment, capable of quickly and clearly prioritizing both your time and that of your organization and finding creative ways to get things done | Top Talent in every role
 * Strong analytical skills, capable of interpreting complex data and utilizing insights for strategic decision-making | Top Talent in every role
 * Strategic mindset with the ability to contribute to the formulation and execution of growth strategies | Think Deeply
 * Excellent communication and collaboration abilities to effectively work with diverse teams, including developers, marketers, and analysts | Pro-Sports Team
 * Self-directing individual who proactively solves problems and anticipates needs, contributing to an environment of continuous learning I Be curious and keep learning
 * You understand and value bringing joy and a sense of creativity to your day-to-day operations | Innovation & Make Magic
   
   

You Will 📲


 * Strategy → Develop and execute a product-led growth strategy for our Real Money Gaming platform
 * Strategy → Focus on Product, Growth & Referrals as key components of the overall strategy
 * Strategy → Responsible for sustainable player growth and retention. Own and optimize acquisition, retention, and reactivation KPIs, and support player lifecycle management leading to the long-term sustainable growth of our player base
 * Planning & Operations → Lead the ideation, design, and implementation of growth-focused features, such as referral programs, reactivation tabs, and other initiatives aimed at organic acquisition and retention improvement
 * Collaboration → Work closely with the User Acquisition (UA) team to ensure alignment between product features and overall growth strategy.
 * Planning & Operations → Optimize user journeys to improve and increase Customer Lifetime Value (LTV).
 * Planning & Operations → Write clear and actionable product specifications, and effectively communicate ideas to the team for implementation
 * Innovation → Establish processes for continuous improvement, encouraging teams to seek and implement innovative solutions
   
   

💰 Benefits → We have tremendous benefits & perks. Check out work.hike.in to know more

title: Product Manager
description:
We are looking for a Product Manager

somebody who is an individual contributor and someone who can lead a team of 2/3 product managers. He/She would be at the cusp of business, design, and engineering and should be able to effectively handle multiple stakeholders.

He/She can be from a SaaS background or an e-commerce background or worked with a D2C startup. Someone good at Analytics – and has worked extensively in-app Analytics, Google Analytics / MixPanel, etc.

Should be adept at helping create product roadmaps, and more importantly, executing them to the T in a flat structure wherein he/she should be able to collaborate effectively with engineers, designers, testers, and stakeholders and drive the desired outcome.

Sound design/wire-framing skills are an advantage. Someone who has been a designer or Frontend engineer in the past helps.

This is for an exciting opportunity with https://www.homesfy.in and for their broker platform - http://mymagnet.io.

Please write to email: pratik.s@homesfy.in.

title: Product Innovation Manager
description:
About the role:

Leading and driving the Crax innovation charter for the new products. The person will drive overall innovation strategy project, manage the entire stage gate process and work closely with R&D teams on product development process. This role will also entail working with consumers on product and concept research and generate actionable insights.




Innovation Strategy, Insights/research

 * Develop the overall innovation strategy for Crax, own the complete charter and stage gate process for innovation and drive their execution with R&D & brand teams.
 * Understanding the consumer data, plan and manage research, and generate actionable insights.
 * Lead all research for innovation process, idea screeners, product testing etc.
 * Identify research needs, make research briefs, and implement actions based on findings.

Product & Packaging Development

 * Work with R&D team for product development as part of overall stage gate process.
 * Understand the consumer requirements and develop a competitive value proposition for the customers through product, packaging, pricing, along with the R&D, Sales & distribution, and finance.

Launch Plan Development & Scale Up

 * Develop integrated sales & marketing launch plans, manage launch and initial scale up (0-6 months)
 * Develop marketing mix & launch plans for new products along with brand managers.
 * Run pre and post launch analysis.
 * Project manage the launch program, oversee key sales and marketing metrics, supply chain readiness and inventory planning and management.

Revenue and Cost Management

Own revenue growth for the brand, value chain / profitability along with finance team and CFO.




Experience and Education Required

 * Full Time MBA with 4 to 6 years of experience in managing end-to-end Innovation process, development and launch of new products and demonstrated growing them to scale.
 * Manage the entire innovation strategy, stage gate process, PMO for new launches.
 * Develop the launch plans with sales & marketing teams and lead a successful launch in market, anchor the scale up for 0-6 months.
 * Experience in driving consumer research and product testing to generate insights.
 * Experience in the food/snack industry is preferable.







About the organization:




Crax is one of India’s beloved brands, with a 25 years long heritage in salty snacks. The brand is owned by DFM Foods ltd, which was acquired by the Private Equity - Advent International in 2019. The entire organization has been transformed with superior systems and processes and is seeing significant investment in brands, sales infrastructure to fulfil the ambition of being a top notch salty snacks player across India.

Our Products:

Corn Rings and Wheat Puffs are marketed under the CRAX and NATKHAT brand names respectively. Both these have become extremely popular snacks, especially among children.

In the namkeens segment, we offer a complete range of products consisting of 12 distinct product variants that include Bhujiyas, Daals, Mixtures and Nut-Mixes. These are sold in several pack sizes to cater to both casual/impulse consumption as well as consumption at home.

Distribution:

Our products are sold through an extensive distribution network spanning the states of Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Uttarakhand, Himachal, J&K, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra and Gujarat. Serviced by our distributors, and overseen by our own Sales Team, retailers receive regular and ready delivery of fresh stocks, ensuring customer satisfaction at every outlet.

Website: https://crax.in/
sector: Food and Beverage Services and Food and Beverage Manufacturing

title: Senior Manager - Product Management
description:
Company Description

About Freshworks

Freshworks makes it fast and easy for businesses to delight their customers and employees. We do this by taking a fresh approach to building and delivering software that is affordable, quick to implement, and designed for the end user. Headquartered in San Mateo, California, Freshworks has a global team operating from 13 global locations to serve more than 65,000 companies -- from startups to public companies – that rely on Freshworks software-as-a-service to enable a better customer experience (CRM, CX) and employee experience (ITSM).

Freshworks’ cloud-based software suite includes Freshdesk (omni-channel customer support), Freshsales (sales automation), Freshmarketer (marketing automation), Freshservice (IT service desk), Freshchat (AI-powered bots), supported by Neo, our underlying platform of shared services.

Freshworks is featured in global national press including CNBC, Forbes, Fortune, Bloomberg and has been a BuiltIn Best Place to work in San Francisco and Denver for the last 3 years. Our customer ratings have earned Freshworks products TrustRadius Top Rated Software ratings and G2 Best of Awards for Best Feature Set, Best Value for the Price and Best Relationship.

Job Description

About the role:

Take Ownership: Own and build modules for sustained differentiation and growth. Develop deep domain expertise and understand trends in the market. The role requires you to plan, build, release, and measure success for an end to end modules.

Be a Customer Champion: Develop a sense of empathy with our customer base to build an understanding of various problems. The role is also a bridge between the customer and the engineering teams to ensure focus on solving customer needs & delivering continuous value.

Practice Craftsmanship: Learn and Practice product craft. Create solutions with delightful user experiences and find the balance between solving the customer problem and shipping the right product solution. We take pride in releasing the smallest of features while iterating and shipping regularly.

Play as One Team: The role needs you to communicate clearly to various stakeholders of Product development, Engineering, Marketing, Sales & Leadership teams and work together to bring your vision to life.

Act with Urgency: Breakdown complex problems to phases to help the team make incremental progress while still keeping the bigger picture intact. You’d evangelize the vision and ensure maximum customer value is achieved with the appropriate amount of work.

Pre-requisites: 10+ years of working in global/cross-functional software teams in a software product company. SaaS experience is preferred as you’d settle right in.


 * 7+ years of core product management experience in building features for internet software products.
 * Being empathetic and having a strong listening ability to understand the other person - may it be a customer or a stakeholder.
 * Ability to arrive at Intuitive & simplistic solutions. You need to have a strong sense of UI and usability.
 * Ability to communicate complex concepts/customer problems in a simple way to internal & external stakeholders.
 * A track record of making day-to-day data-driven decisions in a fast-evolving environment while keeping an eye on the overall vision.
 * Having worked in a mode of structured experimentation - measuring and iterating on problems from time to time to achieve product goals.
 * Ability to drive customer adoption and engagement; leverage analytical tools and customer feedback for insight driven initiatives
 * Self-starter with a passion for independent, creative problem-solving, strong ownership, high commitment and a strong business judgment.
   
   

Additional Information

At Freshworks, we are creating a global workplace that enables everyone to find their true potential, purpose, and passion irrespective of their background, gender, race, sexual orientation, religion and ethnicity. We are committed to providing equal opportunity for all and believe that diversity in the workplace creates a more vibrant, richer work environment that advances the goals of our employees, communities and the business.

title: Product Manager
description:
About Us

Kodo is a corporate card and spend management platform for some of the fastest growing

Indian startups and enterprises. Our product is loved by companies such as Groww, Zepto,

Mobikwik, Fampay, Epigamia, Blue Tokai, Mahindra Logistics & any more. We have raised

$14M from investors such as YC Continuity, Brex, Goat Capital and other Silicon Valley

investors. We believe in creating exceptional products for our customers, an enriching

environment for our team, and a solid business that grows profitably.

Job Responsibilities

A product manager is responsible for the development and success of a company's

products or product lines. The job of a product manager is a combination of technical

and business skills, and often requires a strong understanding of the industry and

customer needs

Define and prioritize product features: The Senior Product Manager is

responsible for defining and prioritizing the features and functionality of

financial products and services. This may involve conducting market research

to understand customer needs and preferences, as well as working with

cross-functional teams to define the product roadmap and ensure that product

development is aligned with the company's overall strategy.

Conduct market research: The Senior Product Manager is responsible for

staying up-to-date on industry trends and customer needs, and using this

knowledge to inform product development and go-to-market strategies. This

may involve conducting market research, gathering customer feedback, and

staying abreast of industry news and developments.

Develop and maintain a product roadmap: The Senior Product Manager is

responsible for developing and maintaining a product roadmap that outlines

the key features and functionality of the company's financial products and

services. This roadmap should be aligned with the company's overall strategy

and should be regularly updated to reflect changing market conditions and

customer needs.

Analyze data to inform decision-making: The Senior Product Manager is

responsible for analyzing data from a variety of sources, including customer

feedback, market research, and product performance data, to inform product

development and decision-making. This may involve using data to identify

market trends, optimize product features, and measure the success of product

launches.

Manage the product development lifecycle: The Senior Product Manager is

responsible for managing the product development lifecycle, including

gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, defining the

product vision, and working closely with engineering, design, and operations

teams to deliver high-quality products on schedule.

Collaborate with sales and marketing teams: The Senior Product Manager is

responsible for collaborating with sales and marketing teams to develop and

execute go-to-market strategies for financial products and services. This may

involve developing marketing materials, setting pricing strategies, and

identifying target markets.

Manage budgets and resources: The Senior Product Manager is responsible

for managing budgets and resources for product development, including

allocating funds and staff to support the development of financial products and

services.

Develop relationships with key stakeholders: The Senior Product Manager is

responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with key

stakeholders, including customers, partners, and industry experts. This may

involve attending industry events, engaging with customers and partners, and

collaborating with external experts to inform product strategy and

decision-making.

A product manager should possess a mix of technical, business and leadership

skills, and must have the ability to think strategically and understand the big picture.

Strong analytical skills, excellent communication and presentation skills, a

customer-focused mindset, and the ability to work well under pressure are also

important for success in this role.

It can be fun and exciting position as it allows you to see the whole picture and be

involved in a lot of different aspects of a product's life cycle, from inception to launch

and beyond.

It can be also rewarding to have the opportunity to have a big impact in the

company's revenue, customer satisfaction and company growth.

Skills: technical skills,budget management,identifying target markets,customer needs,product development lifecycle,managing the product development lifecycle,leadership skills,analytical skills,industry knowledge,communication skills,product performance data,data analysis,product management,measure the success of product launches,product roadmap,optimize product features,documents – prd, urs & frs,market research,product development,business skills,collaboration,relationship building

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
Company Description

The Company

Freshworks makes it fast and easy for businesses to delight their customers and employees. We do this by taking a fresh approach to building and delivering software that is affordable, quick to implement, and designed for the end user. More than 50,000 companies -- from startups to public companies -- around the world use Freshworks software-as-a-service to enable a better customer experience ]CRM) and employee experience (ITSM, HRSM).

Headquartered in San Mateo, California, Freshworks has a dedicated team operating from 13 global locations to serve 50,000+ customers including Bridgestone, Chargebee, DeliveryHero, ITV, Klarna, Multichoice, OfficeMax, TaylorMade and Vice Media.

Freshworks transforms the way world-class organizations collaborate with customers and co-workers. The suite includes Freshdesk (omni-channel customer support), Freshsales (sales automation), Freshmarketer (marketing automation), Freshservice (IT service desk), Freshteam (HR management system).

Job Description

Pre-requisites:


 * 10+ years of working in global/cross-functional software teams in a software product company. SaaS experience is preferred as you’d settle right in.
 * 7+ years of core product management experience in building features for internet software products.
 * Being empathetic and having a strong listening ability to understand the other person - may it be a customer or a stakeholder.
 * Ability to arrive at Intuitive & simplistic solutions. You need to have a strong sense of UI and usability.
 * Ability to communicate complex concepts/customer problems in a simple way to internal & external stakeholders.
 * A track record of making day-to-day data-driven decisions in a fast-evolving environment while keeping an eye on the overall vision.
 * Having worked in a mode of structured experimentation - measuring and iterating on problems from time to time to achieve product goals.
 * Ability to drive customer adoption and engagement; leverage analytical tools and customer feedback for insight driven initiatives
 * Self-starter with a passion for independent, creative problem-solving, strong ownership, high commitment and a strong business judgement.
   
   

Additional Information

About the Freshdesk Design Team

We are a forty-member team of designers interested in research, product design, visual design, and motiondesign. We love spending time with each other: from in-office lunches to remote water cooler conversations; from insightful discussions on the latest update to an app to what's been bothering us recently; from a music track that we loved to making plans for team lunches whenever we get back to the office.

We craft delightful and empathetic products for our customers. We are always on the lookout for new methods, approaches, and processes. We've comprehensive design systems and always appreciate a data-informed mindset. We enjoy collaboration and creative solutions that are in line with our principles.

At Freshworks, we are creating a global workplace that enables everyone to find their true potential, purpose, and passion irrespective of their background, gender, race, sexual orientation, religion and ethnicity. We are committed to providing equal opportunity for all and believe that diversity in the workplace creates a more vibrant, richer work environment that advances the goals of our employees, communities and the business.

title: Product Manager
description:
Job Description

Product Manager

Exp- 3 to 5.5 yrs

Strategy, Ideation and roadmap

• White Space analysis & keeping product in line with market trends

• Gather and prioritize product and customer requirements

• Anticipate customer needs and create need-driven solutions

• Maintain and prioritize roadmap

Product Definition

• Globalize features to fit across markets/deployments

Product Marketing

• Define pricing approach for market segments

Collaboration

• Go Getter Attitude persona with strong stakeholder management ability

title: Product Manager
description:
Key Responsibilities:

We are looking for an individual who can contribute individually in addition to working with the team to deliver excellent product in terms of well thought user experience, design and business need. Your responsibilities will include:

Market Aligned Product Planning: Understanding user feedback and market alignment to plan the product roadmap. Create clear and detailed user stories, acceptance criteria, and mockups to guide the development team.

Design Thinking: Work with design team to create clean, intuitive user experiences which make the product easy-to-use, efficient and easy to configure. Have hands-on experience on creating designs & mockups that help the design team to think clearly.

Product Vision and Strategy: Define and communicate the product vision and strategy, ensuring alignment with Radius's overall goals and business focus.

Ownership: Have complete ownership of product both in terms of performance and business. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to prioritize development based on customer feedback, market trends, and business impact.

Cross-Functional Engagement: Work closely with design, engineering and marketing teams to drive product success and adoption.

Release Management: Plan and oversee product releases, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality features and updates.

Market Research and Analysis: Stay informed about industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging technologies to inform product decisions.

Performance Monitoring: Continuously monitor product performance, gather user feedback, and implement improvements to enhance user experience.

Qualifications:


 * Bachelors/Masters degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Business, Engineering)
 * Proven experience as a Product Owner or in a similar role, preferably in the SaaS industry / start up
 * Strong understanding of messaging platforms, chatbots, and customer engagement technologies
 * Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills
 * Familiarity with Agile methodologies and product development lifecycle

title: Product Manager
description:
The Product Manager will report to the VP of Games, working closely with design, art, and engineering teams to ensure that the product vision is followed and executed to specification.




What you’ll be doing:




 * Own the full game product lifecycle from conception to launch and beyond.
 * Be hands-on, own the roadmaps, write specifications, develop, and extend the game economy model at the feature or product level.
 * Collaborate efficiently with different teams such as design, analytics, LiveOps, UX, art, and engineering teams.
 * Analyse and interpret data, including A/B test data, to provide insights, meaningful suggestions, and recommendations for action items.
 * Help define the strategic direction for the game, define the product roadmap, and execute on it.




What you’ll bring:




 * Bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, or design, or an MBA degree (with a focus on data science or design is preferred).
 * 7+ years of experience in product management for mobile games.
 * Ability to think creatively and develop detailed design specifications, wireframes, and flowcharts.
 * Strong understanding of data analysis, KPIs, and game economy models.
 * Experience in game live ops.
 * Passion for games and a desire to create enjoyable player journeys.
 * Excellent communication skills, attention to detail, and perseverance.
 * Strong leadership and management skills to work effectively with multidisciplinary teams.

title: Associate Product Manager
description:
Company Description

Experian unlocks the power of data to create opportunities for consumers, businesses and society. We gather, analyze and process data in ways others can’t. We help individuals take financial control and access financial services, businesses make smarter decision and thrive, lenders lend more responsibly, and organizations prevent identity fraud and crime. For more than 125 years, we’ve helped consumers and clients prosper, and economies and communities flourish – and we’re not done. Our 17,800 people in 45 countries believe the possibilities for you, and our world, are growing. We’re investing in new technologies, talented people and innovation so we can help create a better tomorrow.

Job Description

Associate Product Manager will own the delivery of the Product roadmap for Experian Consumer Services Business Vertical. The role will be a blend of B2B2C and D2C channels. He/She/They will work with cross functional teams to support and drive delivery of key products and programs defined in the product roadmap. This role will require understanding of business requirement, translate to product requirements to focus on building automated solutions.

Key responsibilities include but are not limited to gathering product requirements, prioritizing feature implementations, managing, and measuring adoption and support for execution, successful launch, and support post go-live.

There is a strong focus on innovation, developing and launching new propositions for different target segments by integrating Experian’s unique assets across data, analytics, and software. They will act as ambassador, champion, and evangelist for the products they manage and have the ability to operate at a range of levels across the business.

Qualifications


 * the bridge between business users and the development team to define and develop the product features that will meet the needs / opportunities of the business users.
 * Work with key business stakeholders to identify business issues / opportunities
 * Identification and development of the product or capability features that will impact the user experience in a positive way
 * Share channel insights with the data science / data engineering team to address the problem areas
 * Optimize UX/UI based on traffic, search. Continuous storytelling detailing initiatives, strategy updates, campaigns and creative
 * Create and Drive marketing strategies while collaborating with marketing team - social media, SEM/SEO& PR
 * Develop customer acquisition strategies and implement to drive awareness, traffic, conversion, and revenue growth
 * Build and handle DTC calendars to ensure maximum efficiency driving revenue and consumer engagement
 * Partner with creative team to develop or demonstrate content for product development, engagement, and promotions
 * Analyze industry trends and competitor’s behavior
 * Be an advocate to drive Data Curiosity
   
   

Additional Information


 * Management / Bachelor's degree in computer science, business management, marketing, or a related field.
 * 3 to 4 years of experience in a similar role would be advantageous.
 * Prior experience in managing D2C product & experience in performance management
 * Familiarity with BRD creation, wireframe creation, user journey creation and working knowledge of APIs
 * Experience in gathering and interpreting qualitative product data and consumer feedback
 * Ability to work with teams and manage stakeholder’s expectations
 * Competency in training internal departments on new product features.
 * Good communication skills
   
   

Additional Information


 * We’re a high-performance and driven team but we don’t forget to celebrate success
 * We offer strong career and international opportunities for high performers
 * We invest heavily in our products and our people
 * We offer training and support from experienced subject matter experts and managers plus dedicated learning & development time.
   
   

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
Company Description

About Freshworks

Freshworks makes it fast and easy for businesses to delight their customers and employees. We do this by taking a fresh approach to building and delivering software that is affordable, quick to implement, and designed for the end user. Headquartered in San Mateo, California, Freshworks has a global team operating from 13 global locations to serve more than 65,000 companies -- from startups to public companies – that rely on Freshworks software-as-a-service to enable a better customer experience (CRM, CX) and employee experience (ITSM).

Freshworks’ cloud-based software suite includes Freshdesk (omni-channel customer support), Freshsales (sales automation), Freshmarketer (marketing automation), Freshservice (IT service desk), Freshchat (AI-powered bots), supported by Neo, our underlying platform of shared services.

Freshworks is featured in global national press including CNBC, Forbes, Fortune, Bloomberg and has been a BuiltIn Best Place to work in San Francisco and Denver for the last 3 years. Our customer ratings have earned Freshworks products TrustRadius Top Rated Software ratings and G2 Best of Awards for Best Feature Set, Best Value for the Price and Best Relationship.

Job Description

About the role:

Take Ownership: Own and build modules for sustained differentiation and growth. Develop deep domain expertise and understand trends in the market. The role requires you to plan, build, release, and measure success for an end to end modules.

Be a Customer Champion: Develop a sense of empathy with our customer base to build an understanding of various problems. The role is also a bridge between the customer and the engineering teams to ensure focus on solving customer needs & delivering continuous value. Practice

Craftsmanship: Learn and Practice product craft. Create solutions with delightful user experiences and find the balance between solving the customer problem and shipping the right product solution. We take pride in releasing the smallest of features while iterating and shipping regularly.

Play as One Team: The role needs you to communicate clearly to various stakeholders of Product development, Engineering, Marketing, Sales & Leadership teams and work together to bring your vision to life.

Act with Urgency: Breakdown complex problems to phases to help the team make incremental progress while still keeping the bigger picture intact. You’d evangelize the vision and ensure maximum customer value is achieved with the appropriate amount of work.

Pre-requisites: 7+ years of working in global/cross-functional software teams in a software product company. SaaS experience is preferred as you’d settle right in.

Qualifications


 * 7+ years of core product management experience in building features for internet software products.
 * Being empathetic and having a strong listening ability to understand the other person - may it be a customer or a stakeholder.
 * Ability to arrive at Intuitive & simplistic solutions. You need to have a strong sense of UI and usability.
 * Ability to communicate complex concepts/customer problems in a simple way to internal & external stakeholders.
 * A track record of making day-to-day data-driven decisions in a fast-evolving environment while keeping an eye on the overall vision.
 * Having worked in a mode of structured experimentation - measuring and iterating on problems from time to time to achieve product goals.
 * Ability to drive customer adoption and engagement; leverage analytical tools and customer feedback for insight driven initiatives
 * Self-starter with a passion for independent, creative problem-solving, strong ownership, high commitment and a strong business judgment.
   
   

Additional Information

Additional Information

At Freshworks, we are creating a global workplace that enables everyone to find their true potential, purpose, and passion irrespective of their background, gender, race, sexual orientation, religion and ethnicity. We are committed to providing equal opportunity for all and believe that diversity in the workplace creates a more vibrant, richer work environment that advances the goals of our employees, communities and the business.

title: Product Manager
description:
Responsibilities:




 * Responsible for the full product lifecycle, from writing specifications, and working across multi-disciplinary teams: design, art, and engineering to launch core features
 * Exhibit sound product judgment, ability to formulate product strategy, and present clear measurable objectives that will lead to achieving our business goals.
 * Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes.
 * Scope and prioritize activities based on business and customer impact.
 * Expected to provide valuable input into business cases based on in-depth data analysis and demonstrate how that analysis impacts key product metrics.
 * Work collaboratively with the team and stakeholders to develop a roadmap and a coherent product backlog that supports it.
 * Clearly communicate product plans, benefits, and results to a wide range of audiences
 * Self-starter who thinks creatively and laterally to create a product that is central to the success of the business
 * Experience with developing mobile products, technologies, and platforms is strongly desired




Requirements:




 * 2-4 years of work experience in a scaled consumer product
 * Focus on outcomes with shown experience making product teams successful
 * Ability to communicate across diverse cultures, languages, work styles, and personalities
 * Strong project management skills
 * Proven ability to develop and scale a product
 * Extraordinary data analysis skills
 * Experience with multivariate testing and experimentation
 * Strong passion for creating fun, compelling, and addictive user experiences
 * Outstanding written/oral, organizational, analytical abilities, and attention to detail
 * Previous start-up, social networking, and/or consulting experience is a strong plus.
 * The FRND team operates six days a week, with every second and fourth Saturday designated as a day off




About FRND




FRND, an innovative audio dating and friend discovery ecosystem for Bharat, is trying to transform the dating landscape. Focusing on the next billion non-English speaking internet users, it's changing how people connect in India, particularly addressing challenges faced by individuals, especially women, in tier 2 cities.




We're committed to resolving growth and user activation issues and developing revenue-generating features like Virtual Gifting. If you're passionate about high growth and have a first-principles mindset, we invite you to join our core user acquisition team as we strive to connect with the next billion internet users.




Why FRND?




 * Because we place a strong emphasis on a product-oriented mindset and the resolution of unique challenges. We are actively engaged in the vast market of the next billion users, spanning across India, Latin America, and the Middle East.
 * Here, you can enjoy competitive Compensation Packages, Equity opportunities, and the prospect of personal growth in parallel with FRND's journey.
 * You'll have the privilege of collaborating directly with our Founders on stimulating projects, and relish the flexibility of an Unlimited Leave Policy while taking complete ownership of your tasks.
 * Experience accelerated learning, supported by renowned investors like Krafton, India Quotient, and Elevation Capital.

title: Manager Product - Denim
companyName: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd.
description:
Base Location: Bangalore

Preferred Experience: 4 - 7 Years

Minimum Qualification: NIFT Graduate & above

Preferred Industry: Retail, Textile & Apparel




Key Result Areas

Merchandise grid management for all product categories

 * Conduct trend analysis from the available sales data.
 * Obtain feedback of past performance of offerings from key channel partners
 * Manage product price and maintain product cost to MRP ratio as per the budgets.
 * Indenting / quantity finalization at stock keeping unit level for all product categories
 * Develop a merchandise grid for the season.
 * Provide the brand brief to Design studio for the season.



Co-ordinating with various interfaces to ensure production of right merchandise mix as per time schedules.

 * Ensuring planned grids are implemented in production and pure profit margin numbers are achieved.
 * Ensuring continuous transaction monitoring are planned and executed as per requirement.
 * Ensuring freshness on E-com channels after evert 15 days through special markup’s.
 * Finalize gold seal / material requirement plan.
 * Work closely with retail and other channels and understand their requirements and manage product range to fulfil the same.



Inventory Management

 * Conducting Sell through analysis
 * Managing leftover raw material, repackaging, re offering and dormancy control




Day to day operation management

 * Monthly buying commercial design and supply chain
 * Bill of materials update
 * Wearer trial and product quality assurance
 * Sales, inventory, product pipeline management

title: Product Manager
description:
Greetings!!

Hope you're doing good!!

We are hiring Product Manager at Gurgaon location.

Position- Product Manager

Location- Gurgaon

Website- http://www.zypp.app

At Zypp Electric, we're on a Mission Zero Emission by accelerating the EV adoption in Last Mile and building a Sustainable Future while creating the Largest Electric Shared Mobility EV-as-a-Service Platform. Zypp is operating a fleet of 10k EVs and is planning to expand to 50k EVs this year. Zypp is a series B funded startup and is expanding rapidly.

Company: Largest 2w EV-AS-A-SERVICE platform - Zypp Electric

Job Description


 * Product Strategy and Roadmap:
 * Develop and communicate a clear product vision and strategy aligned with the company's overall goals and objectives
 * Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and customer feedback analysis to identify market trends, user needs, and opportunities.
 * Define and prioritize product features and enhancements based on customer and business requirements
 * Create and maintain a product roadmap that outlines the product's future direction and aligns with the company's strategic plans
 * Product Development and Execution:
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, and quality assurance, to ensure successful product development and timely delivery
 * Work closely with the engineering team to translate product requirements into technical specifications
 * Conduct regular product reviews and monitor project progress to ensure adherence to timelines and quality standards
 * Make data-driven decisions and iterate on the product based on user feedback, market dynamics, and performance metrics
 * Product Launch and Go-to-Market:
 * Plan and execute product launches, including coordinating with marketing, sales, and customer support teams to ensure successful market entry
 * Develop go-to-market strategies and collaborate with marketing to create compelling product messaging, positioning, and sales collateral- Conduct product training sessions for internal teams, sales representatives, and partners to ensure they have a deep understanding of the product's value proposition
 * Product Performance Analysis and Optimization:
 * Define key performance indicators (KPIs) and establish metrics to evaluate the success and adoption of the product
 * Analyze user feedback, market data, and performance metrics to identify areas for improvement and optimization
 * Collaborate with design and engineering teams to implement product enhancements and updates based on user needs and market trends
 * Stakeholder Management:
 * Engage with internal stakeholders, including executives, to communicate product strategy, updates, and performance metrics
 * Collaborate with sales teams to gather customer feedback and insights to inform product improvements and future development- Build and maintain relationships with external partners, vendors, and customers to gather insights, negotiate partnerships, and drive product success
   
   

Qualifications And Requirements


 * Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Engineering, Computer Science) is required. A master's degree is a plus
 * Proven experience as a Product Manager or in a similar role, preferably in the technology or software industry
 * Strong understanding of product management principles, methodologies, and best practices
 * Solid knowledge of software development lifecycle (SDLC) and Agile/Scrum methodologies
 * Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to make data-driven decisions
 * Strong project management and organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously
 * Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate and influence cross-functional teams
 * Experience in market research, competitive analysis, and customer insights is highly desirable- Familiarity with product management tools and software, such as JIRA, Asana, or Trello, isa plus
sector: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

title: Associate Product Manager
description:
What is Jar?

The Jar app is a habit-building micro-savings platform that helps users save fixed amounts from as little as ₹10, and our revolutionary round-off method effortlessly accumulates spare change from digital transactions and invests it in digital gold.

Founded by Nishchay AG, former director and founding member at mobility start-up Bounce, and Misbah Ashraf, founder of community-focused e-commerce platform Marsplay, Jar's unwavering mission is to shatter psychological barriers to saving and investing, thus spearheading the Financial Fitness revolution for Bharat.

What does Jar do?

With seamless ease of use, we provide users the ability to withdraw their savings directly to their bank accounts as cash or receive physical gold, which is delivered right to their doorstep.

Furthermore, Jar empowers individuals with a flexible line of credit, starting at ₹1000, offering instant access to funds when needed. Amidst this transformative journey, Jar also offers contextual health insurance options, helping users safeguard their' savings from crippling financial emergencies.

Responsibilities


 * Drive product strategy and execute the prioritized roadmap for your stream
 * Change it to Execute on the product roadmap for your stream
 * Lead a cross-functional team, partnering with engineering, data, design, and other teams to ship major features and product improvements driving efficiency
 * Change it to Work instead of lead
 * Define, track, and report on the key product, business, and customer metrics
 * Experience in building consumer-facing platforms
 * Change platforms to products
 * Ability to work with engineers and designers to deliver products and metrics
 * Ability to work with engineers and designers to deliver products and move metrics
 * Experience working in a metrics and experimentation-driven organization
 * Experience in a Data, OKR and Experimentation driven organization
 * Must be able to author PRDs and Use Case Documentation to facilitate product development
 * Must be able to communicate in a clear, structured way. Author BRDs, PRDs, Test Cases, Reports, Scope Documents etc
 * Proven record of building consumer or supplier (B2C) facing products
 * Proven record of building consumer facing products/features
   
   
   

What are we looking for?


 * 1+ years of relevant experience working as a Product Manager, ideally working on consumer-facing, large-scale products
 * Independent and curious, you set your targets, ask for help when you need it, and are always looking to learn something new
 * You are a self-starter, you love to understand systems inside out and make it your mission to deliver quality products
 * You’re entrepreneurial and are comfortable working in a complex and face-paced environment
 * Analytical and data-driven, you love digging into the data to understand what’s happening and define & measure success on every project
 * You’re passionate about your customers and always bring questions back to what will serve them best
 * You’re fluent in English and are a confident communicator. Bonus: Past co-founder or fintech experience at scale
   
   
   

Why join Jar, you ask?

Jar is a diverse and inclusive workplace which embraces ideas and perspectives of all employees, and recognises their efforts and contributions regardless of gender or ethnicity. Our workspace also boasts a great blend of youth and experience, which helps us maintain a transparent culture with no micromanagement. We also have flexible working hours, and provide medical insurance to all employees.

title: Staff Product Manager
description:
Company Description

About Freshworks

Freshworks makes it fast and easy for businesses to delight their customers and employees. We do this by taking a fresh approach to building and delivering software that is affordable, quick to implement, and designed for the end user. Headquartered in San Mateo, California, Freshworks has a global team operating from 13 global locations to serve more than 65,000 companies -- from startups to public companies – that rely on Freshworks software-as-a-service to enable a better customer experience (CRM, CX) and employee experience (ITSM).

Freshworks’ cloud-based software suite includes Freshdesk (omni-channel customer support), Freshsales (sales automation), Freshmarketer (marketing automation), Freshservice (IT service desk), Freshchat (AI-powered bots), supported by Neo, our underlying platform of shared services.

Freshworks is featured in global national press including CNBC, Forbes, Fortune, Bloomberg and has been a BuiltIn Best Place to work in San Francisco and Denver for the last 3 years. Our customer ratings have earned Freshworks products TrustRadius Top Rated Software ratings and G2 Best of Awards for Best Feature Set, Best Value for the Price and Best Relationship.

Job Description

About the role:

Take Ownership: Own and build modules for sustained differentiation and growth. Develop deep domain expertise and understand trends in the market. The role requires you to plan, build, release, and measure success for an end to end modules.

Be a Customer Champion: Develop a sense of empathy with our customer base to build an understanding of various problems. The role is also a bridge between the customer and the engineering teams to ensure focus on solving customer needs & delivering continuous value. Practice

Craftsmanship: Learn and Practice product craft. Create solutions with delightful user experiences and find the balance between solving the customer problem and shipping the right product solution. We take pride in releasing the smallest of features while iterating and shipping regularly.

Play as One Team: The role needs you to communicate clearly to various stakeholders of Product development, Engineering, Marketing, Sales & Leadership teams and work together to bring your vision to life.

Act with Urgency: Breakdown complex problems to phases to help the team make incremental progress while still keeping the bigger picture intact. You’d evangelize the vision and ensure maximum customer value is achieved with the appropriate amount of work.

Pre-requisites: 6+ years of working in global/cross-functional software teams in a software product company. SaaS experience is preferred as you’d settle right in.

Qualifications


 * 8+ years of core product management experience in building features for internet software products.
 * Being empathetic and having a strong listening ability to understand the other person - may it be a customer or a stakeholder.
 * Ability to arrive at Intuitive & simplistic solutions. You need to have a strong sense of UI and usability.
 * Ability to communicate complex concepts/customer problems in a simple way to internal & external stakeholders.
 * A track record of making day-to-day data-driven decisions in a fast-evolving environment while keeping an eye on the overall vision.
 * Having worked in a mode of structured experimentation - measuring and iterating on problems from time to time to achieve product goals.
 * Ability to drive customer adoption and engagement; leverage analytical tools and customer feedback for insight driven initiatives
 * Self-starter with a passion for independent, creative problem-solving, strong ownership, high commitment and a strong business judgment.
   
   

Additional Information

Additional Information

At Freshworks, we are creating a global workplace that enables everyone to find their true potential, purpose, and passion irrespective of their background, gender, race, sexual orientation, religion and ethnicity. We are committed to providing equal opportunity for all and believe that diversity in the workplace creates a more vibrant, richer work environment that advances the goals of our employees, communities and the business.

At Freshworks, we are creating a global workplace that enables everyone to find their true potential, purpose, and passion irrespective of their background, gender, race, sexual orientation, religion and ethnicity. We are committed to providing equal opportunity for all and believe that diversity in the workplace creates a more vibrant, richer work environment that advances the goals of our employees, communities and the business.

title: Product Manager
description:
About Us:

OneBanc is a neo-bank, building the economic infrastructure for the workforce of India. The idea of OneBanc started when a young girl asked Vibhore, a serial entrepreneur, why the money in her piggybank never grew. Adopting this philosophy of #DemandMore, OneBanc connects enterprises, banks, and HR Tech platforms to enhance value for all stakeholders. The core team has proven their vision and executive prowess in CoCubes – a complete assessment solution for students and institutes, which was acquired by Aon. They are now building the squad to enable FinTech revolution of the future. 




Must Have's

 * Prior software engineering and product delivery experience is mandatory
 * Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
 * Build an effective Product team and partnership with Stakeholders
 * Must be innovative and open to continuously improving existing products

 

Your Day

 * Develop key products by conducting market research; generating product requirements; specifications, production timetables, pricing, and time-integrated plans for product introduction; developing marketing strategies
 * Ensure teams (Developers, Designers) have a full context and understanding of customers and business environment to create valuable solutions

title: Product Manager
description:
Job Title: Product Manager

Company Name: Supertails

Job Type: Technical

No Of Openings: 1

CTC: 22-25 LPA

Location: Bangalore

Experience: 3-6 Years

About Company

Supertails is building a digital pet care platform which offers expert led healthcare services and products. We offer online vet consultations and products across the categories of food, accessories, grooming essentials, and toys for dogs and cats.

Supertails - India's Best Online Pet Shop for Food and Accessories

Job Description

Our ideal candidate


 * Is enthusiastic to understand user behavior and has demonstrated it in their past roles/experience.
 * Can analyze data, postulate theories, conduct experiments, measure performance, and reiterate.
 * Proficiency in SQL is good to have.
 * Has a high sense of ownership:
 * Constantly looks to improve the product by analyzing and benchmarking.
 * Quantify & communicate the gap as well as the gains to relevant stakeholders.
 * Resilient to design, develop & deploy, and undeterred by operational challenges.
 * Carries a vision for the launch and a drive to nurture the product henceforth.
   
   

Has 3-4 years of experience in the development of user-facing products

Must Have Skills


 * SQL
 * Product Management
 * Critical Thinking and Analytical Skills
 * Communication skills
 * Leadership
 * Product company experience
   
   

What We Offer


 * Fast-paced environment with multiple opportunities for growth
 * Ownership: Individually lead important charters with high-impact potential
 * Employee-first culture: Putting employees above everything else. Be surrounded by positivity and furry friends.
 * Perks & benefits: Salary matching market compensation.
   
   

Location: Bangalore, Indiranagar (6 days of working In-office)

Special Remarks From Company

Must Possess SQL, Product Management

Candidate Must Be From Product Based Company
