title: Investment Analyst
description:
Company Description

At Hyperbola, we're committed to democratizing access to top-notch industry knowledge, empowering you to excel in your career. Our experienced professionals offer coaching to both students and professionals, guiding you towards success in your desired field. 'Job Sabko Milega' – Hyperbola is here to assist you every step of the way, ensuring you land your dream job.




Role Description

This is a hybrid internship role for an Investment Analyst. The Investment Analyst will support the Investment Team in researching and analyzing potential investment opportunities. The Investment Analyst will be responsible for developing, building, and maintaining financial models, assisting with portfolio management, and monitoring market trends and competitor activity. This role is located in Siliguri but some remote work is acceptable.




Qualifications

 * Investments and Financial Modeling skills
 * Analytical Skills and Finance coursework
 * Portfolio Management experience or coursework
 * Ability to research and analyze potential investment opportunities
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills
 * Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other financial analysis tools
 * Experience in the financial services industry or related field is a plus




Perks and Benefits

 * Competitive slab pay structure
 * Performance-based incentives
 * Travel allowance (TA) and Daily allowance (DA)
 * Annual compensation ranging from 3 to 4 LPA

title: Finance Analyst - Global RTR Process
description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO (INTERNAL)




Join us as we embark on a journey to transform BCG’s Finance organization. “Future Finance” is a multi-year journey to prepare the Finance function for the BCG of the future: a BCG that continues to grow, and one that has become more complex, more diverse and more interdependent. By rethinking structures and standardizing processes across geographies and business entities, we will make it simpler and more efficient to work together and flex to meet the needs of BCG.

As a part of the Global Finance Operations Services team, you will support and deliver on day-to-day activities in the Record-to-Report (RTR) function including finance & accounting management process of collecting, processing, consolidating, closing and reporting on relevant, timely and accurate information used to provide financial, strategic and operational feedback which aids in decision making process. You should have experience in financial accounting and reporting, revenue accounting. fixed assets and lease accounting, intercompany accounting, accrual/prepaid accounting and reconciliations, month end/year end close, accounting systems and procedures, consolidation of financials, audit controls and governance etc. Your key stakeholders will include various internal BCG functions and the local finance teams located in multiple geographies.




Roles and responsibilities:




 * Understanding of accounting concepts in conjunction with knowledge of financial systems, data flow, chart of accounts, consolidation, system hierarchies & mappings
 * Perform monthly accounting transactions, including accurate recording and review of revenue and expenses, general ledger and sub-ledger management, month-end accruals and journal entries for costs, and other financial activities in compliance with local, BCG and other accounting practices
 * Review, reconcile and analyze aspects of the monthly financial statements, inclusive of consolidation, reconciliations, allocations, accruals & pre-payments and variance analysis
 * Ensure that all assigned balance sheet and expense accounts are reconciled, balanced, and maintained in accordance with company procedures
 * Develop baseline knowledge of accounting processes to help provide back up support to team
 * Utilize system reports and queries to obtain required data to address questions and/or research on issues
 * Work with IT/finance system’s team to investigate and resolve month end related system issues and reconciling difference while performing system reconciliations
 * Ensure strong internal controls by maintaining backups/schedules supporting accounting transactions. Adhere to the internal compliance policy and guideline established by the management on their daily operational activities
 * Partner with Finance Managers and Leads to conduct holistic review of accounting operations, identify opportunities for improvement and implement recommendations
 * Support the team in developing appropriate accounting procedures and process documentation to ensure smooth monthly/quarterly/annual close process
 * Ability to solve practical problems and assist with documentation alization of procedures
 * Identify and report any deviation from pre-set guidelines/procedures for timely advice/solution from line manager
 * Independently perform transactional tasks which support the compliance, planning, and execution of assigned processes
 * Complete ad hoc requests and perform other duties as needed with minimal oversight
 * Active participation in the organization-wide projects and initiatives




YOU'RE GOOD AT




 * Strong accounting background that supports analytical skills
 * Sound analytical skills, ability to navigate details and a willingness to look at data in different ways. Ability to synthesize data and consistent attention to detail
 * Experience with Excel—ability to design, enhance, and maintain spreadsheets and databases
 * Comfort with ambiguity and cross validating results through indirect means
 * Demonstrates sound judgment, high level of initiative and resourcefulness
 * Comfort with multi-tasking and prioritizing within a fast-paced, demanding environment
 * Flexibility, comfort and desire to dig in and work through the details
 * Understands value of an iterative process
 * Ability to work effectively in team environment and independently
 * A track record for successfully interacting at all levels
 * Good judgment, strong interpersonal skills and a collaborative style
 * Ability to perform effectively under pressure and changing situations with tact, poise & patience
 * Excellent oral and written communication skills
 * Flexibility to multi-task on different projects in a fast-paced organization
 * Proven ability to plan work effectively and prioritize work even in stressful situations
 * Demonstrates responsiveness, initiative, orientation towards service & broader business needs
 * Experience working successfully within a complex matrix structured organization is essential.
 * Proven ability to drive continuous improvement agenda in the financial and transactional processes, and monthly closing and reporting processes




YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)




 * Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance, with experience and strong interest in accounting concepts.
 * 4-6 years of relevant experience in financial accounting and reporting, fixed assets and lease accounting, accrual/prepaid accounting and reconciliations, month end/year end close, accounting systems and procedures, consolidation of financials, audit controls and governance etc.
 * Must be able to perform successfully in a fast-paced, intellectually intense, service-oriented environment and to interpret rules and guidelines flexibly to enhance the business and in keeping with BCG’s values and culture.
 * Willingness to provide a wide range of financial services from routine tasks to intricate financial management data
 * Oracle experience a plus (GL, Fixed Assets and AP), Hyperion, SAP Business Objects, MS Access and other comparable ERP systems experience preferred
 * MS Excel, PowerPoint, Word proficiency and adaptable to different software applications
 * Advanced Excel skills an
 * d/or experience with other analytical tools (such as Tableau, Alteryx, etc.) will be added advantage




YOU'LL WORK WITH

We pride ourselves on a collaborative working environment and utilize digital tools to foster that collaborative environment across a global company. The Global Finance Operations Centre aims at providing best in-class operational excellence and execution through partnership, building trust and credibility. It provides a foundation to ensuring smooth finance operations, coordinating change and ensuring performance of individual processes with high service levels.
sector: Financial Services and Business Consulting and Services

title: Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A)
description:
Job Description: Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A)







Position Overview: We are seeking a skilled and experienced professional to join our team as a Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) specialist. In this role, you will play a crucial part in analyzing financial data, developing budgets, and providing insights to support strategic decision-making. The ideal candidate should possess strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a comprehensive understanding of financial planning and analysis processes.

Key Responsibilities:

 1. Conduct thorough financial analysis to support the organization's planning and decision-making processes.
 2. Collaborate with various departments to gather relevant financial data and insights for budgeting and forecasting purposes.
 3. Prepare and present financial reports to management, highlighting key performance indicators and areas for improvement.
 4. Assist in the development and monitoring of annual budgets, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and objectives.
 5. Evaluate financial performance against key metrics, identifying trends and recommending actions for improvement.
 6. Participate in the strategic planning process by providing financial insights and recommendations.
 7. Contribute to the development of financial models to assess potential scenarios and outcomes.
 8. Stay updated on industry trends, regulations, and best practices in financial planning and analysis.

Qualifications and Skills:

 * Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field; Master's degree or professional certification (e.g., CFA, CPA) is a plus.
 * Proven experience in financial planning and analysis roles, preferably in a corporate setting.
 * Strong proficiency in financial modeling and analysis tools.
 * Excellent communication and presentation skills.
 * Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
 * Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and data integrity.
 * Proficient in Microsoft Excel and other relevant software applications.

If you are a dedicated and analytical finance professional looking to contribute to the success of our organization, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity in Financial Planning and Analysis.




Salary Pkg – upto 12LPA




Apply - ruchi@kingsmenindia.com

title: Senior Manager - Human Resources
description:
Overview

Main Purpose:


 * Partner with Business to define and implement the overall business strategy for the respective unit
 * Assist business/ line managers in making balanced business decisions while advocating for appropriate employee interventions
 * Lead & anchor employee engagement at the location
 * Provide local grievance handling through strong employee relationships
 * Serve as a trusted employee advisor at all levels
 * Responsible for linking, translating and integrating HR work and priorities with business/ line managers
 * Deliver recurring HR services and processes in partnership with COE teams
   
   

Responsibilities

Key Accountability:


 * Effectively partner with Business to anticipate and provide appropriate solutions to deliver desired business results
 * Feed local pulse to HRBP and Business Leader
 * Ensure policy consistency/compliance
 * Provide career coaching for local talent, with emphasis on developing new manager talent
 * Help line managers solve business problems (turnover, absenteeism, etc )
 * Key point of contact for grievance handling for the respective population
 * Assist TA to identify local sources of
 * The role will also cater to admin related accountabilities catering to the unit
   
   

Partner with COE to:


 * Execute tools/ programs to drive employee engagement
 * Execute communications
 * Develop local succession plans
 * Play an active role in PepsiCo values/ culture/ engagement work (leveraging COE work for local activation)
 * Localize and activate global HR solutions, core processes and policies
   
   

Qualifications

Key Skills and Experience Required:

Skills and Behavioural Attributes:

Functional Competencies


 * Able to build trust and sustainable interpersonal relationships
 * Coaching skills
 * Business Partnering & Consulting skills
 * Able to gain strong Local Business Knowledge, Insights and Cultural nuances
 * Leverage understanding of key business drivers in own area to get results
 * Matrix Management
 * Strong HR execution skills
   
   

Leadership and Individual Effectiveness/HROM Behaviours


 * Balances competing priorities without losing momentum behind execution
 * Quickly analyses complex problems to find actionable, pragmatic solutions
 * Translates strategies into plans that can be effectively executed
 * Influences others through reasoning and relationships
 * Leverages understanding of key business drivers in own area to get results
 * Anticipates issues and questions and provides effective solutions
 * Succeeding in virtual communities
 * Internal consultancy skills
   
   

Qualification:


 * MBA in HR from top institute with at least 5 years of experience
 * Experience in Handling frontline employees is preferred
 * HRBP experience preferred
sector: Food and Beverage Services and Manufacturing

title: Deputy Manager, Business HR
description:
Requisition ID: 59595

About Whirlpool Corporation

Whirlpool Corporation (NYSE: WHR) is committed to being the best global kitchen and laundry company, in constant pursuit of improving life at home. In an increasingly digital world, the company is driving purposeful innovation to meet the evolving needs of consumers through its iconic brand portfolio, including Whirlpool, KitchenAid, Maytag, Consul, Brastemp, Amana, Bauknecht, JennAir, Indesit, Yummly and InSinkErator. In 2022, the company reported approximately $20 billion in annual sales, 61,000 employees and 56 manufacturing and technology research centers. Additional information about the company can be found at WhirlpoolCorp.com.

The team you will be a part of

WHIRLPOOL CORPORATION


 * #1 Fortune 500 Company in Consumer Durable category o No 1 in North America(NAR), Latin America(LAR) & Europe Middle East, Africa(EMEA) o No 1 western company in Asia
 * Annual sales turnover of $21 billion
 * 70 manufacturing & Technology centers around the Globe o 3 Manufacturing Locations in India BEST EMPLOYER AWARD We believe that our people make us a great place to work, reflected in the awards we have received consistently over the years
   
   

This Role In Summary

The purpose of this job is to drive the People Excellence strategy and agenda in line with the business strategy and needs.

Your Responsibilities Will Include

KEY ACTIVITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES :


 * Work closely with the business leadership to define and fine tune the People Excellence strategy
 * Partner with business leadership on all the core Organization and People processes such as Organizational Effectiveness, Talent strategy, Performance Management, Talent Assessment, Compensation planning, Learning & Development plans, employee engagement, I&D, Rewards & Recognition
 * Develop or internally leverage frameworks, processes and policies towards strengthening talent pipeline, retention and engagement and compliance, aligned to the overall Business strategy in a challenging and evolving work environment
 * Lead from front organizational initiatives in the areas of culture alignment, I&D, employee communications.
 * Regular employees connect and lead employee engagement activities.
 * Key support to Site Champion and continuous improvement on site improvement activities on people, culture, processes.
 * Ensure employee health, wellness & safety.
 * Lead and execute Rewards & Recognition process.
 * Focus on continuous improvement of culture and people leader effectiveness
 * Lead and support on leave management system.
 * Partner with regional and global HR organizations to share and leverage best policies and practices, report progress and metrics and enhance the center’s representation in regional and global HR forums
 * Ensure consistency and compliance of HR practices and policies - in compliance with central, state, and local laws
 * HR Business partnering experience
 * Work experience on success factors tool for Recruitment and onboarding process
   
   

Preferred Skills And Experiences


 * Demonstrated ability to work independently, manage successfully business and functional priorities as HRBP
 * Strong interpersonal skills and abilities to effectively communicate with employees, partners and global stakeholders at all necessary levels
 * Change Management and conflict resolution skills
 * Business acumen, process facilitation and problem-solving skills
 * Ability to drive HR processes and practices in a highly matrix global organization
 * Strong reporting, analytical and data interpretation skills Good working knowledge of labor laws, HR policies and practices including talent development, compensation & benefits, university relations and contract talent management
   
   

EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATIONS & CERTIFICATIONS Master’s Degree/MBA in Human Resources / PGDBM/ Industrial / Labor Relations EXPERIENCE/ PREFERRED INDUSTRY Minimum of 3 years of relevant HR experience

title: Manager - Human Resources
description:
Job Location

Bhopal

Job Description

Job Description

P&G was founded over 180 years ago as a simple soap and candle company. Today, we're the world’s largest consumer goods company and home to iconic, trusted brands that make life a little bit easier in small but significant ways. We've spanned three centuries thanks to three simple ideas: leadership, innovation, and citizenship. The insight, innovation and passion of hardworking teams has helped us grow into a global company that is governed responsibly and ethically, that is open and transparent, and that supports good causes and protects the environment. This is a place where you can be proud to work and do something that matters.

Dedication From Us

You are at the core of breakthrough innovations, be given exciting assignments, lead initiatives, and take ownership and responsibility, in creative workspaces where new insights thrive. All the while, you'll receive outstanding training to help you become a leader in your field.

What We Offer

Continuous mentorship – work with peers and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager dynamic and encouraging work environment– employees are at the centre, we value every individual and support initiatives, promoting agility and work/life balance.

Overview Of The Job

As HR Managers, you will own providing comprehensive HR solutions for businesses. For the delivery of core people processes, you will collaborate both internally and externally. You will add value by coming up with and putting into creative practices, agile solutions that improve employee experiences and other people processes.

Overview Of The Function

P&G Human Resource's mission is to create and maintain further business growth and competitive advantage by building human resources, organizations, systems, and a culture together with business leaders. This team oversees the full scope of our HR policies wherever they are in the world. That means employee and labor relations, employee engagement, diversity, and inclusion, learning and development, and so much more.

As a business-integrated partner, the P&G HR team works closely with influential business leaders and explores new ways to drive performance and business results. They champion the needs, successes, and progress of our 95,000+ employees in 70+ countries.

What Success Looks Like


 * You are putting plans into action that directly support the organization's goals and objectives, enhancing its ability to grow and contend.
 * Creation of a work environment where employees feel empowered to offer suggestions and feel engaged putting in effort. Develop a productive and welcoming workplace environment that promotes teamwork, innovation, and excellence.
 * HR expertise to address issues that the business and line leaders are facing. Design and implement strategies in collaboration with cross-functional departments that are in line with the strategic goals of the organization and the needs of various partners.
 * Check to see if P&G's pay policies, guidelines adhere to necessary legal requirements. To find trends, patterns, and areas for improvement, use data analytics. Deliver HR insights and data-driven suggestions that help the business achieve its goals and produce favorable results.
 * Make sure that up-to-date information is readily available so that decisions about employee compensation can be made with confidence. A fair and equitable outcome for employees is achieved through the efficient execution of the performance review.
 * Make use of data analytics to identify the opportunities, patterns, and trends for improvement.
   
   

Responsibilities Of The Role


 * Align HR initiatives strategically to business needs, such as team efficiency, organization assessment, and design, people issues, line leader challenges, and trends that support the expansion and competitiveness of the company.
 * Foster a culture that values leadership efficiency, employee engagement, innovation, and workforce productivity.
 * Provide organizational insights to help decision-makers make the best choices, coach and develops leaders to deliver people management capabilities, and reduce operational risk while boosting business and HR/ER compliance.
 * Collaborate with HR services and solutions and practices to ensure the execution of solutions that are business specific and meet the specific challenges of line leaders including the business.
 * Create and deliver total rewards strategy process and policy guidelines.
 * Have a thorough understanding of all legal requirements for pay policies and regulations.
 * Leading and driving annual compensation review process across the organization ensuring accurate and updated data availability.
 * Lead all aspects of the normalization and moderation process, as well as the analysis of internal and external data to produce insightful findings that contribute to achieving business goals.
   
   

Job Qualifications


 * MBA in Human Resources from a Tier 1 Campus
 * 0 to 3 years of proven experience
 * Should have employee engagement skills
 * Should indulge in culture building
 * Should have the know-how in HR analytics
 * Display strong interpersonal and work process improvement skills.
   
   

We produce globally recognized brands, and we grow the best business leaders in the industry. With a portfolio of trusted brands as diverse as ours, it is paramount our leaders can lead with courage the vast array of brands, categories, and functions. We serve consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always®, Ariel®, Gillette®, Head & Shoulders®, Herbal Essences®, Oral-B®, Pampers®, Pantene®, Tampax® and more. Our community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide.

Visit http://www.pg.com to know more.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate against individuals based on race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000098110

Job Segmentation

Recent Grads/Entry Level (Job Segmentation)

title: Assistant Manager Human Resources
description:
About Organization

We are Nation Builders, Larsen & Toubro Ltd, commonly known as L&T, is an Indian multinational conglomerate company, with business interests in engineering, construction, manufacturing, technology, information technology and financial services, headquartered in Mumbai. The company is counted among world's top five construction companies.




The L&T Group comprises of 93 subsidiaries, 5 associate companies, 27 joint ventures and 35 jointly held operations, operating across basic and heavy engineering, construction, realty, manufacturing of capital goods, information technology, and financial services.




Objectives of this role

Assist in updating and executing people policies, HR automation aspects, Special Projects and extend HR operations services to the business.

Assist in organising customised and continuous capability building programs and administration of performance appraisals followed by compensation & benefits aspects.

Track latest trends and suggest new agile policies for improving employee experience as well as the efficiency of HR team in supporting business effectively.




Job Responsibilities




 * Understand business drivers and people matters to collaborate with all stakeholders ensuring achievement of organizational goals.
 * Assist in the ongoing HR Automation to ensure adoption and targeted benefits.
 * Implement the approved short term and long-term HR strategies that support business plans and drive organizational success.
 * Assist in identification of training and development needs followed by organising customised capability building initiatives using traditional and new age interventions, L&D MIS, and stakeholder management.
 * Assist in development and communication of organizational guidelines.
 * Assist in Employee Engagement initiatives and coordinate employee development plans.
 * Take care of induction and orientation of new staff.
 * Manage the organization’s employee database and provide various HR reports for business reviews.
 * Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices to continuously improve HR processes. Prepare detailed proposal on adoption of relevant ones.
 * Assist in budgeting and forecasting/control of expenses.
 * Liaise with external vendors and agencies as needed.
 * Utilize HR analytics and metrics to assess the effectiveness of HR programs.
 * Provide insights and recommendations based on data to drive informed decision-making.




Educational background and preferred skills



 * Bachelor’s degree and full time MBA in Human Resources from Premier Management Colleges.
 * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, ethics, and cultural awareness
 * Learning agility, adaptability, and aptitude for problem-solving and thorough knowledge of HR procedures and policies
 * Advanced knowledge of HRIS and ability to learn new technical systems, when necessary




Experience Required

2 to 4 years of progressive HR experience post qualification

title: Area Human Resources Manager
companyName: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd.
description:
Role : Area HR, Karnataka

*Base Location : Bangalore

*Experience Required : 2-7 years, MBA in HR. Experience in HR business partnering for Retail/ Sales teams

*Qualification : MBA - HR

*The role involves travel within the portfolio region




Key Result Areas




1.Controlling manpower cost




Maintaining percentage of salary to NSV

· Plan & Budget the Manpower cost & staff count for the financial year

· Ensure rationalization of the planned manpower cost through effective staff management & other strategies




2.Attrition Management




· Attrition analysis to arrive at the store wise diagnosis for improvement

· Ideate & partner with the operations team to execute on the store specific action plans for attrition control




3.Internal Processes




 * Quarterly Appraisal System and feedbacks
 * Ensuring Confirmation/ Transfer/ F&F processes are completed as per defined TAT




4. Employee Lifecycle Management




· To drive & supervise all the events of an employee’s life-cycle are correctly captured and continuously uploaded in HRIS for future access and use

· Train & support employees to drive new and existing systems and processes



5. Talent & Engagement



 * Identifying potential employees and training them for larger roles in the organization. Proper adherence to training calendar
 * Employee Satisfaction survey on various parameters (Retail Vibes). Form action plan based on areas of improvement.

title: Dy.Manager/Manager HR
description:
The Position:

Human Resources role at HINCOL is a diverse responsibility. As member of HR Team., you will work on a number of cross-disciplinary subjects including talent acquisition & management, staff planning, defining and delivering training & development programmes, performance management, competency mapping, career planning, employee engagement, change management, etc. In this role, you will be liaising with Sr. Managers & Executive Committee besides several other internal and external stakeholders. You will develop and introduce various HR initiatives & solutions aligned to the Company’s Business objectives. The core HR work includes efficient hiring, maximizing people capability, managing end-to-end employee lifecycle, supporting day-to-day operations as well as proactively engaging in process improvements and policy formulation.




Education Qualification: Two-year full time, Post graduate Degree in HR/Personnel Management or MBA in HR/Personnel Management from any reputed Institute.

Min.Exp.: Min. 6- 10 years’ work experience in a mid-size organization in the areas of talent acquisition & management, competency mapping, training & development, employee relations or HR Policies/initiatives & implementation. Prior experience in SAP HRM, pay roll Module is desirable but not mandatory.




Role Description (including and not limited to)

 1.  Work with cross functional teams to facilitate end-to-end HR solutions in areas specified in the JD.
 2.  Help build one of the most skilled and committed workforces in similar Industry/Business lines.
 3.  Assess manpower requirements and work closely with concerned teams for completing the hiring process within agreed timelines.
 4.  Manage Employee life cycle including onboarding, confirmation, performance appraisals, employee relations and separation.
 5.  Understand Business objectives (both strategic & operational) and implement KPIs and Performance appraisal cycles across all levels.
 6.  Develop and implement a comprehensive competency framework across the organization for all employees.
 7.  Identify skill sets required for each role/job and develop appropriate training & development modules to enhance employee capability.
 8.  Work with line managers to identify bottom quartile employees and coach them to focus on improving performance.
 9.  Analyze data to identify trends and recommend solutions to improve performance, retention, and employee experience/engagement.
 10. Create robust communication forums and facilitate interactions between the employees and management on a regular basis.
 11. Review employee compensation & benefits framework periodically and give recommendations for effecting suitable policy changes.
 12. Use analytical skills to bring new/innovative insights and make recommendations that will positively impact Business.
 13. Should have handled compensation and benefits/performance pay implementation/ monthly payroll on ERP/SAP software for min 200-300 employees.
 14. Knowledge of all compliances including Labour Law compliance, statutory compliances like PF /ESIC/LWF/PT/ Contract labor management as per statute.
 15. OD initiatives (leadership development and employee wellness)
 16. Employee engagement activities.
 17. T&D: Training Calendar /Rolling out training programmes/ mapping the training needs with the annual training calendar. worked on Competency mapping & competency development.

title: Manager - Human Resources
description:
Job Location

Bhopal

Job Description

Job Description

P&G was founded over 180 years ago as a simple soap and candle company. Today, we're the world’s largest consumer goods company and home to iconic, trusted brands that make life a little bit easier in small but significant ways. We've spanned three centuries thanks to three simple ideas: leadership, innovation, and citizenship. The insight, innovation and passion of hardworking teams has helped us grow into a global company that is governed responsibly and ethically, that is open and transparent, and that supports good causes and protects the environment. This is a place where you can be proud to work and do something that matters.

Dedication From Us

You are at the core of breakthrough innovations, be given exciting assignments, lead initiatives, and take ownership and responsibility, in creative workspaces where new insights thrive. All the while, you'll receive outstanding training to help you become a leader in your field.

What We Offer

Continuous mentorship – work with peers and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager dynamic and encouraging work environment– employees are at the centre, we value every individual and support initiatives, promoting agility and work/life balance.

Overview Of The Job

As HR Managers, you will own providing comprehensive HR solutions for businesses. For the delivery of core people processes, you will collaborate both internally and externally. You will add value by coming up with and putting into creative practices, agile solutions that improve employee experiences and other people processes.

Overview Of The Function

P&G Human Resource's mission is to create and maintain further business growth and competitive advantage by building human resources, organizations, systems, and a culture together with business leaders. This team oversees the full scope of our HR policies wherever they are in the world. That means employee and labor relations, employee engagement, diversity, and inclusion, learning and development, and so much more.

As a business-integrated partner, the P&G HR team works closely with influential business leaders and explores new ways to drive performance and business results. They champion the needs, successes, and progress of our 95,000+ employees in 70+ countries.

What Success Looks Like


 * You are putting plans into action that directly support the organization's goals and objectives, enhancing its ability to grow and contend.
 * Creation of a work environment where employees feel empowered to offer suggestions and feel engaged putting in effort. Develop a productive and welcoming workplace environment that promotes teamwork, innovation, and excellence.
 * HR expertise to address issues that the business and line leaders are facing. Design and implement strategies in collaboration with cross-functional departments that are in line with the strategic goals of the organization and the needs of various partners.
 * Check to see if P&G's pay policies, guidelines adhere to necessary legal requirements. To find trends, patterns, and areas for improvement, use data analytics. Deliver HR insights and data-driven suggestions that help the business achieve its goals and produce favorable results.
 * Make sure that up-to-date information is readily available so that decisions about employee compensation can be made with confidence. A fair and equitable outcome for employees is achieved through the efficient execution of the performance review.
 * Make use of data analytics to identify the opportunities, patterns, and trends for improvement.
   
   

Responsibilities Of The Role


 * Align HR initiatives strategically to business needs, such as team efficiency, organization assessment, and design, people issues, line leader challenges, and trends that support the expansion and competitiveness of the company.
 * Foster a culture that values leadership efficiency, employee engagement, innovation, and workforce productivity.
 * Provide organizational insights to help decision-makers make the best choices, coach and develops leaders to deliver people management capabilities, and reduce operational risk while boosting business and HR/ER compliance.
 * Collaborate with HR services and solutions and practices to ensure the execution of solutions that are business specific and meet the specific challenges of line leaders including the business.
 * Create and deliver total rewards strategy process and policy guidelines.
 * Have a thorough understanding of all legal requirements for pay policies and regulations.
 * Leading and driving annual compensation review process across the organization ensuring accurate and updated data availability.
 * Lead all aspects of the normalization and moderation process, as well as the analysis of internal and external data to produce insightful findings that contribute to achieving business goals.
   
   

Job Qualifications


 * MBA in Human Resources from a Tier 1 Campus
 * 0 to 3 years of proven experience
 * Should have employee engagement skills
 * Should indulge in culture building
 * Should have the know-how in HR analytics
 * Display strong interpersonal and work process improvement skills.
   
   

We produce globally recognized brands, and we grow the best business leaders in the industry. With a portfolio of trusted brands as diverse as ours, it is paramount our leaders can lead with courage the vast array of brands, categories, and functions. We serve consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always®, Ariel®, Gillette®, Head & Shoulders®, Herbal Essences®, Oral-B®, Pampers®, Pantene®, Tampax® and more. Our community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide.

Visit http://www.pg.com to know more.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate against individuals based on race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000098110

title: Human Resources Executive/ HR Generalist
description:
About the Agency:

We are the world’s largest independent global B2B marketing agency, where curious minds create the future. This is where you will find thought provoking, ego-quashing, mistake learning, all including, convention breaking, and always growing marketers with a passion for what they do.




Recent accolades include Large Agency of the Year 2022, Global ACE Awards Gold winner 2022, and being on the Sunday Times Fast Track 100 list.




We’re curious—about change, about that next opportunity, and about you. And we’re building a place for people with the creativity and camaraderie to enjoy life at Transmission and help write our future.




The Role

A great opportunity for you to gain exposure to the APAC region.




You'll be responsible for a wide range of HR tasks and projects, including general HR administration, support logistics around all stages of the employee lifecycle from onboarding to offboarding, and serve as the first point-of-contact for employee questions.




You will exhibit a high level of integrity, be outcome-focused with the ability to proactively take the initiative, use good judgment to prioritize requests.




What You’ll Do:

 * Act as the first point of contact for all HR-related inquiries; this includes providing intake of benefits, leaves, retirement savings questions.
 * Own our employee onboarding and offboarding programs and processes. You will serve as the face of new hire onboarding at Transmission.
 * Maintain employee records in line with the state, and local regulations and guidelines in APAC.
 * Ensure data integrity across our HR systems and data repositories.
 * In collaboration with regional HR leadership, update our HR policies and stay current with relevant HR and employment law legislation.
 * Maintain and update our HR Systems and Tools suite, manage HR Data Analytics, and be responsible for running ad hoc reports, ensuring accuracy and timely delivery to stakeholders. Assist with compliance for various state, and local ordinances and reporting requirements in APAC.
 * Provide support on relocation cases.
 * Prepare HR-related employees documents such as offers of employment.
 * Conduct exit interviews.
 * Coordinate employee social committee meetings and proposals.
 * Drive employee engagement and project manage social events.
 * Participate in process improvement strategies that leverage current systems, data structures, and other technologies.
 * Support regional HR leadership on key HR projects.




What You’ll Bring:

 * Bachelor's degree in related field
 * At least 2-4 years of experience in an HR function, experience with advertising and media agency is a plus
 * Knowledge of HRIS system
 * Ability to take action and work autonomously
 * Proven organizational skills with great attention to detail and the ability to prioritize
 * Proactive and go-getter attitude
 * Strong MS Office skills
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills
 * Confidence in communicating with internal stakeholders
 * Thrives in a dynamic, growth-oriented environment
 * Ability to work flexibly switch between tasks, taking ownership of your work




Benefits & Perks

 * 20 days annual leave, which increases by 1 day for every year with us (up to 25 days)
 * Flexi benefits
 * Agile working arrangement
 * Birthday celebration and day off
 * Medical and vaccine/booster leave
 * Dedicated learning and development program for every member of staff
 * Company Culture Committee covering wellness, D&I, CSR and social – lots of initiatives.
 * Working with a young, vibrant team in a globally renowned co-working environment







We’re smart.

And have a constant urge to learn more. We encourage questions and innovative mindsets. At the same time, we value empathy and collaboration over ego. The most rewarding outcomes are achieved together.




We’re fearless.

We celebrate the diversity of thought and experiences. We push boundaries. We’re not afraid of failure. We welcome it because learning from mistakes is how we grow as people and as a company.




We’re transparent.

We earn trust by showing respect and being honest. We value the breadth and depth of each person and their story. We form a happier, healthier, more confident team because we’re open with each other and have unique ways of thinking.




This is how we drive your now and define your next. Come join us.




Transmission is an Equal Opportunities Employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace and your race, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability have no influence on our hiring decision.

title: Sr HR Generalist
description:
The future is what we make it..

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries..

Are you ready to help us make the future?

Provide HR support for the HON Global COE organization while partnering with cross-functional teams and leaders to broker HR services and support ~300 employee strength.

As An HR Generalist You Will Actively Engage In

Business and Strategic Partnering -Contribute to the accomplishment of organization-wide business plan and objectives. Build and leverage business knowledge to design, deploy HR strategies in managing the people aspects of the business. Own initiatives to support growth and optimization of the business.

Talent Development - Own Talent development and execution, drive key talent development, critical roles identification & career pathing initiatives to ensure talent agenda aligns with the business agenda. Identify and lead initiatives to support the capability building agenda of the function, with respect to behavioral and leadership skills. Partner and influence business leaders to drive a performance-oriented work culture.

Coaching -Build an ability to provide coaching/ counseling to both employees and business leaders in areas of people management.

Compensation Consultation -Drive consistent practices with managers including annual Compensation revision consultation, benchmarking all offers and promotions.

Staffing -Assist in staffing delivery and drive success of shared staffing solutions, assist manager in talent selection and follow process and practice as defined by staffing COE

Ensure effective and timely delivery of all HR services and processes, in line with the HR calendar of the organization.

Qualifications

An MBA from a reputed institute, majoring in HR.

At least 7-8 years of experience in the HR domain with appropriate experience in the HR generalist function as a strategic business partner in good MNC organizations.

Prior experience working in a global matrix environment..

Excellent analytical skills with the ability to make meaning out of numbers and to integrate the same into driving business performance and implement frameworks that are relevant.

Interpersonal skills, collaborative working style with the ability to work closely with line managers and pole. Strong influencing and & presentation skills.

Strong process thinking and the ability to deliver results on the ground..

Additional Information


 * JOB ID: req431969
 * Category: Human Resources
 * Location: Devarabisanahalli Village, KR Varturhobli,,East Taluk - Phase I,Bangalore,KARNATAKA,560103,India
 * Exempt

title: Human Resources Generalist
description:
Aditya Birla Group is looking for a HR-Generalist.

This is an entry level / junior position.

VH Consulting has been retained to search appropriate talent to staff this role.

This is on-site, on-contract position. Work-ex – around 1+ years in HR would be ideal. Strong communication skills and Microsoft Excel (Pivot Tables, VLookup, Ranking, Sorting, Filtering)

Qualification: MBA (HR) or PGDM (HR) with 1 to 2 Years experience

JD:

1) Talent Aquisition & management - Data management support and coordination with stakeholders for a variety of current and upcoming talent initiatives

2) L & D - Co-ordinating with the stakeholders, Documentation, Data recording, creation of learning dashboard

3) Employee Engagement- Support the initiatives around diversity & Cuture, , Drive the Employee Engagement.
sector: Professional Training and Coaching and Human Resources Services

title: Deputy Manager - HR
description:
What You’ll Do

If you desire to be part of something special, to be part of a winning team, to be part of a fun team – winning is fun. We are looking forward to a Deputy Manager HR based in, Mumbai / Bangalore / Delhi India. In Eaton, making our work exciting, engaging, meaningful; ensuring safety, health, wellness; and being a model of inclusion & diversity are already embedded in who we are - it’s in our values, part of our vision, and our clearly defined aspirational goals. This exciting role offers opportunity to:

The primary function of the role is to act as an HR business partner to support the Sales & Services team of Electrical sector - India, spread all across India. The successful incumbent will provide HR support to commercial teams while balancing the needs of the business and employees in accordance with Eaton’s values and ethics.

"1. Manage and support the employee life cycle processes including hiring upto SB05 , HR operations, development & engagement of sales & services teams spread across India


 * Drive engagement calendar execution for commercial teams across locations, fun@work events,festival celebrations, employee connects etc
 * Support Commercial HR lead in conducting Training need Survey & identification of training needs thru the same including but not limited to TalentReviews, Perf appraisals etc.
 * Support HR Lead in the execution of the training programs including, product training, digital training, behavioural training etc
 * Overall supervise payroll, & monitor nos hired within budget for contingent workforce, Cost etc.
 * Maintain data integrity of HRMS & support in getting the monthly MIS ready with accuracy

title: Senior Human Resources Business Partner
description:
Job Summary: The Senior Manager of Human Resources plays a critical role in overseeing and managing the overall human resources functions within the organization. This position involves providing strategic direction, leadership, and expertise in various HR areas to support the achievement of organizational goals and objectives.

The Senior Manager will be responsible for implementing effective HR policies, programs, and initiatives, while ensuring compliance with applicable employment laws and regulations. Additionally, they will lead a team of HR professionals, fostering a positive work environment and promoting a culture of employee engagement, development, and retention.




Qualifications: Master degree/ PG diploma in Human Resources




Experience: 12-18 years




Location: Greater Noida




Key Responsibilities:

1. Strategic HR Leadership:

• Develop and implement HR strategies, policies, and initiatives aligned with the organization's goals and objectives.

• Provide guidance and counsel to senior leadership on HR matters, contributing to the development of business strategies and decision-making processes.




2. Employee Relations and Engagement:

• Address employee concerns, conflicts, and grievances, ensuring prompt resolution and fair treatment.

• Implement initiatives to enhance employee satisfaction, productivity, and retention.




3. Performance Management:

• Administer performance management programs and processes, including goal setting, performance evaluations, and development plans.

• Support managers in providing timely and constructive feedback to employees.

• Identify and address performance issues and provide guidance on corrective actions and disciplinary measures when necessary.




4. Training and Development:

• Support career development and succession planning initiatives to build a strong talent pipeline.




5. Compliance and Policy Development:

• Develop and update HR policies, procedures, and employee handbooks to reflect current legal requirements and best practices.




Skills:

• Extensive experience in HR management roles

• Strong knowledge of employment laws, regulations, and HR best practices.

• Excellent leadership and people management skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a team.

• Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to influence and build relationships at all levels of the organization.

• Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

• Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities and work in a fast-paced environment.

title: Human Resources Business Partner
description:
Here's what you can look forward to

The HR Partner at Saviant will serve as a trusted advisor, taking charge of a diverse range of People Practices and initiatives aimed at creating an outstanding employee experience. Your role will encompass providing strategic HR support, offering expert guidance, and working closely with Business Leaders to cultivate a highly engaged, positive workforce that aligns with and drives the achievement of Saviant’s business objectives.

 

This role delves into the following crucial aspects of HR at Saviant –

 

Delivering People Practices

Working with Business Leaders to conceptualize and implement various people practices and frameworks to ensure Saviant members are guided by well-structured policies and procedures,

 

Data-Driven Decision-Making

Monitoring HR metrics and trends to facilitate decision making to proactively address issues and refine people strategies. You will leverage organizational dashboards and various surveys to gain insights into employee performance, satisfaction levels, and other crucial indicators.

 

Driving Employee Engagement

Being readily accessible to all Saviant members and facilitates open communication so that they feel valued and heard. Additionally, Implementing innovative programs such as onboarding,  job assistance, career planning, and training and development to enhance team motivation, productivity and job satisfaction.

 

Defining Career Development

Ensuring that individuals are in roles that align with their skills and aspirations and have a clear career roadmaps. You will work with line Managers to ensure that each individual's potential is harnessed to the fullest.

 

Internal Communication Strategy

Being responsible for developing and implementing a comprehensive internal communication strategy to ensure that information flows seamlessly across all levels of the organization, fostering a culture of transparency and sense of shared purpose.

 

Employer Branding

Actively contributing to  promote Saviant’s values, culture, work environment, and overall employee experience to enhance its position as an employer of choice.

 

Effective HR Process Execution

Ensuring HR processes are carried out seamlessly and timely, contributing to the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the organization.

 

Here is what we would like you to bring

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (Master’s degree or HR certification is a plus).

8 to 12 years of experience in HR management, with a focus on designing and implementing HR programs.

Strong knowledge of HR best practices, employment laws, and regulations.

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build strong relationships at all levels.

Demonstrated problem-solving and decision-making abilities.

Ability to perform tasks independently without much supervision.

What we consider a right fit for this role

You have been a part of defining and implementing various HR strategies and processes for the last 3 years in IT industry

You are currently responsible for tracking people performance and KPIs to support business growth

You have implemented technology, tools and solutions for data driven decision making.

You are responsible to improve people satisfaction and retention.

title: Human Resources Business Partner
description:
Why Join 7-Eleven Global Solution Center?

When you join us, you will Take Ownership – Within a product area, the teams will own end-to-end delivery of solutions. The teams will be entrusted with responsibility and ownership for the delivery of products. They will also support the local teams in each country in integrating new digital assets with existing systems Challenge Yourself – Products built in Bangalore will be deployed across our network of convenience stores, supporting over a billion transactions per year. If you are up for a challenge like never before, step forward. Build Solutions for Scale – We have over 80,000 stores in over 18 countries dealing in a diverse range of products. The product team will build digital solutions to be deployed at scale, supporting our business operations spread across the globe. Move Around and Grow - Cross-functional learning is not just allowed at 7-Eleven; it’s applauded. We’ve got the size, stability, and resources that make it possible for employees to find rewarding careers Lead and Serve - 7-Eleven has always been about serving the needs of our customers and community.




Why We Exist, Our Purpose and Our Transformation

7-Eleven exists to be a customer-obsessed, digitally enabled organization, seamlessly linking our physical stores with digital products and services. Our purpose is to redefine convenience by continually delivering best-in-class customer experiences and solutions in an environment where consumer demands are rapidly changing. By anticipating customer needs, we develop and deploy platforms that allow customers to shop, pay and receive products and services how they choose. For our success, we are executing a cultural change underscored by leadership principles and supported by realigning organizational resources and processes.




ROLE: Human Resource Business Partner - Contract to hire role




Summary:

HR Business Partner (HRBP) position is responsible for aligning business objectives with employees and management in designated business units. The position formulates partnerships across the HR function to deliver value-added service to management and employees that reflects the business objectives of the organization. The HRBP maintains an effective level of business literacy about the business unit's financial position, its midrange plans, its culture and its competition.




Responsibilities:

· Conducts weekly meetings with respective business units.

· Consults with line management, providing HR guidance when appropriate.

· Analyzes trends and metrics in partnership with the HR group to develop solutions, programs and policies.

· Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues. Conducts effective, thorough and objective investigations.

· Maintains in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks and ensuring regulatory compliance. Partners with the legal department as needed/required.

· Provides day-to-day performance management guidance to line management (e.g., coaching,

· counseling, career development, disciplinary actions).

· Works closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention.

· Provides HR policy guidance and interpretation.

· Provides guidance and input on business unit restructures, workforce planning and succession planning.

· Identifies training needs for business units and individual executive coaching needs.

· Performs other related duties as assigned.




Required Skills:

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

· Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.

· Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

· Ability to acquire a thorough understanding of the organization's hierarchy, jobs, qualifications, compensation practices, and the administrative practices related to those factors.

· Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

· Proficiency in MS-Excel and had good Data Management skills




Qualifications:

· Minimum of 3 years of experience resolving complex employee relations issues.

· Working knowledge of multiple human resource disciplines, including compensation practices, organizational diagnosis, employee and union relations, diversity, performance management, and employment laws.

· Bachelor's degree

· Proficiency in MS-Excel reporting




7-Eleven is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.

title: Human Resources Business Partner - Bangalore, India
description:
Databases are the beating heart of every business in the world.

Cockroach Labs is the creator of CockroachDB, the most highly evolved cloud-native, distributed SQL database on the planet that scales fast, survives anything, and thrives anywhere. We created CockroachDB to unshackle teams from the constraints of their database. Join us on our mission to enable every developer to build world-changing applications!

About The Role

We are looking for an HR Business Partner to join our People team at Cockroach Labs. This role is the first of its kind in our India office and will require someone who is willing to wear multiple hats. As an HRBP, you will support all personnel in India with employee relations, performance, and talent development matters. You will also serve as an HR Generalist to support a wide range of activities across workplace logistics, employee onboarding, and employee engagements on the ground in India. This role is a critical link across our Bengaluru regional hub and our headquarters in NYC.

You Will


 * Collaborate with our India site lead, management team, and People team to ensure we are offering a competitive and locally relevant experience.
 * Facilitate HR programs and processes (performance management, annual reviews, etc.) and provide HR expertise to ensure desired objectives and outcomes are attained.
 * Align HR support in India with global HRBP counterparts by supporting key initiatives for relevant groups across GTM and R&D.
 * Support India-related benefits and payroll activities, including new hire orientations, offering locally relevant input on benefits programs, marketing internal benefit programs, and enhancing employee understanding of leave processes and policies.
 * Work cross-functionally with Workplace Experience and Corporate Engineering to support with administrative tasks, streamline office operations, and provide additional resourcing, as needed.
 * Collaborate with the People team to champion and accelerate a culture of excellence in which people feel engaged and inspired to deliver top business results.
 * Drive continuous improvement in HR processes and procedures across India and the Asia Pacific region, ensuring compliance with local laws and continuity across our global employee base.
   
   

The Expectations

In your first 30 days, you will learn about our current processes, programs, and systems. You will meet with colleagues in the region and across the company and start building relationships that will help you better understand Cockroach Labs. It is imperative that you take this time to connect with fellow Roachers, so that you have an understanding of how we work and what we value.

In your first 60 days, you will gain familiarity with our India regional colleagues and existing programs. You’ll start to think of plans that will play to our strengths, mitigate our weaknesses, and build upon the foundation of processes and programs we offer.

After 3 months, you will be integrated into the team. You will be the primary HR point of contact working directly with our India Roachers. You will leverage strong relationships across our People Team for support and share feedback that can be deployed to improve people processes and programs company-wide.

You Have


 * At least 6 years of experience required; preferred experience working in a fast-moving, high-growth organization especially in an independent office environment
 * 4+ years of experience working with managers and leaders in an HRBP capacity
 * Relevant experience building company culture and increasing employee engagement
 * Experience demonstrating judgment and integrity in sensitive situations
 * Superb communication skills, including effective facilitation, listening and writing
 * Knowledge of HR programs and practices, including applicable regional employment laws and regulations
   
   

The Team

Reporting to Lauren Weber, Director, People Operations

Lauren is a culture vulture. Whether you’re talking about organizations, foods, or places... she likes to keep up with what's delicious, fun, and interesting. Born and raised in Kentucky, her career has spanned industries (government, nonprofit, education, tech) and locations (Berlin, District of Columbia, San Francisco, New York). Cringeworthy old-school HR stories are what make Lauren passionate about ensuring Roachers are supported and engaged by our people processes and programs.

Our Benefits


 * Competitive Health Insurance Coverage (for you & your dependents!)
 * Paid Parental Leave (with baby bucks)
 * Flexible PTO & Flexible Hours
   
   

Cockroach Labs is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you need additional accommodations to feel comfortable during your interview process, please email us at accessibility@cockroachlabs.com.

title: Chief Human Resources Officer
companyName: Intellectual Capital HR Consulting Pvt. Ltd.
description:
CHRO – ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITY

JOB DESCRIPTION

Key Responsibilities:

1. Strategic HR Leadership: Provide strategic leadership and direction for the HR

department, ensuring that HR initiatives support the organization's mission, vision, and

objectives.

2. HR Strategy Development: Develop and execute HR strategies, policies, and

programs that align with the organization's business strategy and drive employee

engagement, retention, and performance.

3. Talent Acquisition: Oversee the recruitment and onboarding processes to attract

and retain top talent. Develop recruitment strategies, manage talent pipelines,

and collaborate with hiring managers.

4. Employee Relations: Foster positive employee relations by handling employee

grievances, disputes, and disciplinary actions professionally and in compliance

with labour laws and regulations.

5. Performance Management: Implement performance management systems,

including goal setting, performance appraisals, and feedback mechanisms to drive

employee growth and development.

6. Training and Development: Develop and oversee training and development

programs to enhance employee skills, competencies, and career growth

opportunities.

7. Compensation and Benefits: Manage compensation and benefits programs,

ensuring competitiveness and alignment with market standards. Analyse

compensation data to make informed decisions.

8. HR Compliance: Ensure compliance with labour laws, regulations, and HR best

practices. Develop and maintain HR policies and procedures.

9. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI): Promote a diverse and inclusive workplace

by implementing DEI initiatives and programs that support fairness, equity, and

respect for all employees.

10. Employee Engagement: Develop strategies to enhance employee engagement,

satisfaction, and retention. Conduct employee surveys and take actions based on

feedback.

11. Succession Planning: Create and execute succession planning processes to identify

and develop future leaders within the organization.

12. HR Technology: Evaluate and implement HR technology solutions, such as HRIS

(Human Resources Information System) or HRMS (Human Resources

Management System), to streamline HR processes and data management.



13. Labour Relations: If applicable, manage relationships with labour unions,

negotiate labour contracts, and ensure compliance with union agreements.

14. Budget Management: Develop and manage the HR budget, including monitoring

and controlling expenses.

15. Data Analytics: Utilize HR analytics to track key HR metrics, generate insights, and

make data-driven decisions to improve HR processes and employee outcomes.

Qualifications and Requirements:

• Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field;

Master's degree and HR certification (e.g., SHRM-SCP, SPHR) may be preferred.

• Extensive experience in HR leadership roles, including prior experience as a Head

of HR or equivalent.

• Total Minimum Experience of 15+ Years.

• Thorough knowledge of HR best practices.

• Strong strategic thinking and the ability to align HR initiatives with business goals.

• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

• Leadership and team management skills.

• Proficiency in HR software and technology.

• Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

• Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.

• Commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion principles.

title: Asst. Manager HR
description:
Overview

Main Purpose: -


 * Ensuring welfare worker’s by continuous communication with the Factory Management & Workers
 * Ensure accurate timely processing and maintenance of salaries, records, claims and employee related documents
 * To promote harmonious relations and to do liaison work between the workers and the management.
 * Supporting the Manager in ensuring compliance related to applicable labor law related & statutory obligations
 * Assisting the Manager in maintaining a positive IR environment in the company
   
   

Responsibilities

Accountabilities –


 * Ensure fulfilment of obligations of statutory or otherwise, in the application of the provisions of the Factories Act, 1948, and the rules made thereunder.
 * Ensuring the functioning of Time Office & keeping track leave , attendance management.
 * Ensure timely payment of wages and statutory dues on monthly and yearly basis.
 * Ensuring provident fund pension and superannuation fund, gratuity payments, maternity benefits, workmen's compensation, Employee State Insurance and other welfare and social benefit measures.
 * Ensure submission of all notices, periodically and yearly returns to all statutory authorities.
 * Ensure provision or amenities such as first-aid, ambulance rooms, canteens, crech, shelters for rest etc.
 * Monitor the grant of leave with wages, explain to the workers the provisions relating to leave with wages and other leave privileges, and to guide the workers in the matter of submission of application for grant of leave for regularizing authorized absence
 * Supervise and control the notice board and information bulletins to facilitate further education of workers and to encourage their attendance at technical institutes.
 * Supervision of contractual workforce and the applicable acts and rules
 * Grievance handling in line with Salary or other benefits.
   
   

Scope - what is the scope of the role - volume, net revenue, budget, geography, number of customers, number of sites etc for THIS role?


 * Budget: Operate within budgets as per AOP
 * Geography: Entire Plant Staff, Operatives & Contractual
 * No of sites: One Plant (Kosi Plant)
   
   

Qualifications


 * At least 3-6 years of plant experience managing frontline and staff through progressive HR interventions
 * Desirable, Proven, experience of at least 3-6 years in the HR function in a manufacturing industry
 * Handling tough Industrial relations scenarios
 * Education : Mater of Social Workers (MSW), Master’s degree in HRM, HRD , HR, PM/PG Diploma in Personnel Management / Industrial Relations
 * Fluency in English & Hindi

title: Sr HR Generalist
description:
Your Role at Cabot

Delivers HR generalist services to a broad client base at a particular location. Aspects of the work include recruitment, development, performance management, employee relations, compensation and benefits. This is an experienced level performing in various areas of HR service delivery

How You Will Make An Impact


 * Works with local managers to plan and identify current and longer-term staffing needs. Screens and interviews applicants, both internally and externally at all levels. Leads recruitment initiatives, including special in-house events or external recruiting
 * Provides counsel and advice to line management regarding a wide variety of employee relations issues. Facilitates discussions between employees and managers. Actively involved in the implementation and continuous improvement of an effective Performance Based Management (PBM) system to enhance employee performance and development
 * Promotes open communications between employees and managers. Works with managers to develop and execute communication plans
 * Assists with the implementation of training and developmental needs of the organization. Participates in the development and delivery of training programs
 * Ensures integrity of data entered in the HR Information System; works closely with HRMIS Center as needed. Enters new and updates changes to employee data
 * Where required, administers employee benefits and keeps abreast of changing issues both within and outside of Cabot to assure competitiveness of benefit offerings. Respond to employee issues and concerns
 * Assists in the succession and organizational planning processes to assure employee career development and full utilization of resources
 * Administers HR policies and processes fairly and uniformly. Promotes Cabot culture and an environment of open communication between management and employees
 * Ensures compliance with all applicable laws and regulations
   
   

What You Will Bring To Cabot


 * Throughout knowledge of HR specialties (Benefits, Compensation, Employment, Employee Relations, HRMIS, data protection techniques. administration, Organization Development)
 * PC Skills (MS Office, Lotus Notes, MS Project, etc). Ability to generate/develop reports
 * Ability to manage areas such as coaching, career counseling, PBM, etc. Strong communications skills in order to interface with employees and managers and handle sensitive issues
 * Ability to facilitate meetings; deliver training
 * Ability to work effectively in teams

title: Regional HR Manager
description:
The world leader in cosmetics, L’Oréal is present in 150 countries on five continents. Our 35 international brands have allowed us to devote ourselves solely to one business: beauty, with a mission to provide the best in cosmetics innovation to all women and men globally. Our ambition is to win over another one billion consumers around the world by inventing the cosmetic products that meet the infinite diversity of their needs and desires through continued digital innovation. L’Oréal supports diversity and sustainable, ethical sourcing for all our products, and we have reduced our emissions by approx. 78% since 2005.

The DNA of L’Oréal is Innovation and we are driven by a real passion for the future. Our Research and Innovation Centres in India are the sixth innovation hub for L’Oréal worldwide to fuel local market innovations.

The distance between beauty and tech is closing rapidly, and we are determined to be pioneers in this new beauty tech world. New digital technologies and services are making the world of beauty move faster than ever before. Data and artificial intelligence are opening new horizons for personalization and customization. By incorporating digital into everything that we do, we are creating a better relationship with our consumers.

When beauty and tech collide, the impossible can happen!

In our journey, we are looking for talented individuals who can lead us on this mission.

Would you like to be a part of the adventure?

Key Deliverables

We have a suitable opening in the function of Human Resources for the position of Regional HR. In this individual contributor role, the person will be completely responsible for the people management, acting as an adviser and providing professional support for all HR related activities. The candidate should have 2 - 4 years of relevant HRBP experience. Candidates with strong recruitment background will be given preference. The details of the same are given below:

Talent Acquisition


 * Plan and execute the region's hiring plans including entry-level recruitment for the Sales & Education teams.
 * Responsible for Onboarding and orientation of all the new joiners in partnership with the Sales team.
   
   

Talent Engagement


 * Drive employee engagement programs through proactive and structured interventions
 * Handle grievances and concerns with empathy and bring them to closure.
 * Keeps a proactive check on the general employee well-being engagement levels and intervene actively when necessary.
   
   

Learning & Development


 * Plan and execute the training development programs as per Corporate LD Calendar
 * Actively build a culture of learning by sharing best practices and knowledge-sharing across the region.
   
   

Performance Management


 * Partner with the line managers to address performance gaps and facilitate discussions/processes to assess appropriate action
 * Guideline Managers on all aspects of performance management including feedback and performance coaching
   
   

Process Compliance


 * Partner with HR COE teams to drive HR agendas in the region.
 * Provide timely feedback/inputs to the COE teams on the policies and processes.
 * Participate in key HR projects in the areas of Rewards, Learning & Development, Engagement etc.
   
   

Professional Competencies


 * Ability to manage diverse stakeholders.
 * Ability to coach and mentor sales employees, having a strong sales acumen himself/herself
 * Strong Business Communication skills with the ability to influence and convince stakeholders by objectively presenting challenging views
 * Proficient in handling employee issues with sensitivity, objectivity and empathy
 * Proficient in data analytics, process orientations exception handling
 * Team Player with the ability to network collaborate with diverse teams across locations.
   
   

Qualification


 * MBA from a Tier 1 or Tier 2 institute.
   
   

Interactions


 * Internal – Regional Sales Heads, Regional Sales & Education teams, HR COEs.
 * External – Recruitment Consultants, Candidates.
   
   

L’Oréal is committed to building a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. L’Oréal closely prohibits discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of the individual’s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.
