title: Human Resource Manager
description:
Love working with influencers and using social media?




Join our team! We're currently seeking a skilled Human Resource Manager to lead strategic HR initiatives, foster a positive workplace culture, and drive organizational excellence. If you have a proven track record in HR management and are ready to contribute to our dynamic team, we invite you to apply and be a key player in our continued success.




Roles and Responsibilities:

 1. Oversee the full HR lifecycle, from recruitment to employee offboarding, ensuring seamless processes and compliance with company policies and regulations.
 2. Develop and implement strategic HR initiatives that align with organizational goals, fostering a positive and inclusive workplace culture.
 3. Lead employee relations efforts, addressing concerns, facilitating communication, and promoting a collaborative and respectful work environment.
 4. Manage performance appraisal systems, providing guidance to supervisors and supporting employee development through training and coaching.
 5. Conduct regular audits of HR processes to maintain data accuracy, confidentiality, and adherence to compliance standards.
 6. Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices, continuously improving HR policies and practices to enhance organizational effectiveness.




Qualifications:

 1. Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field; advanced degree or HR certifications are a plus.
 2. Proven experience as an HR Manager with a track record in developing and implementing successful HR strategies.
 3. In-depth knowledge of employment laws, regulations, and industry trends, with the ability to ensure compliance and mitigate risks.
 4. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build strong relationships at all organizational levels.
 5. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to address complex HR issues and drive effective solutions.
 6. Demonstrated leadership skills, with the ability to inspire and lead HR teams to achieve departmental and organizational objectives.
 7. Ethical conduct and the ability to handle sensitive information with discretion, maintaining confidentiality and trust within the organization.




If you are a team player who displays a positive, professional attitude at all times and who is interested in the influencer world, then you are the person we are looking for.




About Barcode Entertainment and what we do-




We’re a global influencer marketing agency, powered by influencers. We pride ourselves in bringing together data-led performance, real human relationships, expert creative strategy, authentic engaging content, and laser-sharp paid media targeting.




Simply put, we understand how to get business results from social media. Our content-first offering is completely bespoke for each of our clients, with different industries, brands, objectives, audiences and influencers, there is no plug ‘n’ play option or corner-cutting platform. With that in mind, we delve into our years of performance data and the latest cultural trends and insights to develop the most effective social creative strategies and campaigns that deliver industry-leading results for our clients.

title: Senior Manager Corporate Human Resources
description:
As a HR Business Partner (HRBP) in a manufacturing company, your primary responsibility is to serve as a strategic partner and trusted advisor to the business leaders and managers in all aspects of human resources. You will be responsible for aligning HR initiatives with business objectives, driving organizational effectiveness, and ensuring the overall well-being of employees within the manufacturing environment.




Position Overview:

As a HR Business Partner (HRBP) in a manufacturing company, your primary responsibility is to serve as a strategic partner and trusted advisor to the business leaders and managers in all aspects of human resources. You will be responsible for aligning HR initiatives with business objectives, driving organizational effectiveness, and ensuring the overall well-being of employees within the manufacturing environment.




Key Responsibilities:




1. Strategic HR Planning and Execution:

· Partner with business leaders to understand their strategic objectives and identify HR initiatives to support their goals.

· Develop and implement HR strategies, policies, and programs that align with the company's overall business strategy and promote a positive work culture.

· Provide guidance and support to managers in areas such as talent acquisition, employee engagement, performance management, and succession planning.

· Collaborate with leaders to develop workforce plans, including forecasting talent needs, identifying skill gaps, and implementing recruitment and retention strategies.




2. Employee Relations and Engagement:

· Serve as a trusted advisor to managers and employees, providing guidance and support on employee relations matters, conflict resolution, and disciplinary actions.

· Promote employee engagement initiatives, such as recognition programs, employee surveys, and employee development opportunities.

· Proactively address employee concerns, foster a positive work environment, and champion employee well-being and work-life balance initiatives.

· Conduct investigations and address employee complaints or grievances in accordance with company policies and applicable laws.




3. Talent Management and Development:

· Partner with managers to identify high-potential employees and develop succession plans for key positions.

· Support the implementation of performance management processes, including goal setting, performance reviews, and career development plans.

· Facilitate training and development programs to enhance employee skills and competencies, including leadership development, technical training, and compliance training.

· Collaborate with the learning and development team to identify training needs and recommend appropriate interventions.




4. Compensation and Benefits:

· Provide guidance to managers on compensation strategies, salary reviews, and incentive programs to attract, motivate, and retain talent.

· Assist in the development and implementation of competitive and fair compensation structures and benefit programs.

· Conduct market research and benchmarking to ensure the company's compensation and benefits offerings are competitive within the industry.

· Support managers in addressing employee questions related to compensation, benefits, and payroll.




5. HR Analytics and Reporting:

· Utilize HR data and analytics to provide insights and recommendations on workforce trends, turnover rates, and other key HR metrics.

· Prepare HR reports and presentations for senior management, highlighting key findings and making data-driven recommendations for improvement.

· Collaborate with HRIS team to ensure accurate and timely data management and reporting.
sector: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, Computers and Electronics Manufacturing, and Manufacturing

title: Human Resources Director
description:
Position: HR Director

Location: Hyderabad, India (Remote, Full-Time)

Experience: 6+ years




THE CHALLENGE:




Eventbrite is dedicated to its people-first philosophy, building a global platform for live experiences. We are seeking an HR Director to lead the Regional HR function in India, collaborating with global partners to design and deliver an exceptional Briteling experience.




THE TEAM:




Our Briteling Experience (BX) team focuses on attracting, engaging, and retaining top talent globally, fostering an environment for Britelings to thrive.




THE ROLE:




 * You will be the regional HR Leader. Be the trusted advisor and partner for leaders in India on HR and employment matters.
 * Provide full-cycle HR support, including mobility, relocations, onboarding, and employee relations.
 * Collaborate with the site Managing Director to establish and grow a new site in India.
 * Champion engagement, diversity, and inclusion, aligning with company values and fostering community.
 * Offer consultative advice to address India-specific people and employment issues.
 * Implement global people programs, ensuring alignment with local needs and market trends.
 * Collaborate with global and functional leaders to design and implement effective HR solutions.
 * Ensure policies are compliant, competitive, and aligned with global philosophy.
 * Drive the implementation of global people programs, enhancing the Briteling experience.
 * Provide coaching and resolution for local employee relations issues.




THE SKILLSET:




 * 6+ years of HR experience, including 3+ years leading a Regional HR function.
 * Strong business acumen and HR expertise with a consultative approach.
 * Experience in a fast-paced, global environment, balancing strategic projects and hands-on work.
 * Excellent communication skills and cultural awareness.
 * Knowledge of India talent environments and local employment laws.
 * Familiarity with Workday and other HR tools.




BONUS POINTS:




 * Experience in a global tech organization with a US or EMEA presence.
 * Active Eventbrite user with a passion for live events.




WHAT WE OFFER:




 * Competitive and meaningful benefits for our Britelings.
 * A diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture.
 * Comprehensive benefits and wellness packages.
 * Support for remote/hybrid work and various wellness programs.




ABOUT EVENTBRITE:




Eventbrite is a global self-service ticketing, marketing, and experience technology platform that serves consumers and event creators in nearly 180 countries. Since inception, Eventbrite has been at the center of the experience economy, transforming the way people organize and attend events. With over 280 million tickets distributed for over 5 million total events in 2022, Eventbrite is where people all over the world discover new things to do or new ways to do more of what they love. Learn more at

www.eventbrite.com.




Is This Role Not an Exact Fit?




Sign up to stay in touch, and we'll notify you about new positions on our team.




Eventbrite is committed to equality of opportunity for all staff, and applications from all suitably qualified individuals are encouraged, regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships.

What Will You Do

 * Identify practices and rituals to increase the adoption of cultural values in the organization
 * Stay abreast of best practices in the industry around people and culture and leverage the same

title: Human Resources Business Partner
description:
The Human Resources Business Partner will be responsible for implementing globally/regionally defined initiatives, initiate local action based on global guidelines and policies and provide feedback to Centers of Expertises and Regional Business Partners. The holder of this position will ensure proximity to regional business and labor market and that Line Managers live up to their leadership role (i.e. performance mgmt., talent mgmt., workforce planning,...). The Human Resources Business Partner will also ensure compliance to Labor Law.

The Human Resources Business Partner will be responsible for implementing globally/regionally defined initiatives, initiate local action based on global guidelines and policies and provide feedback to Centers of Expertises and Regional Business Partners. The holder of this position will ensure proximity to regional business and labor market and that Line Managers live up to their leadership role (i.e. performance mgmt., talent mgmt., workforce planning,...). The Human Resources Business Partner will also ensure compliance to Labor Law.

Main Responsibilities & Tasks


 * Prior experience of working in a fast-paced, and changing environment workplace or a startup – preferably from the technology industry and organizations
 * Ability to drive and amplify a great culture in our people practices.
 * Ability to independently implement HR initiatives.
 * Experience in delivering projects, like talent development and/or recognition programs.
 * Serve as a trusted advisor and subject matter expert for employee relations and performance matters.
 * Support managers in HR-related topics within structures of global HR org. and in compliance with global HR policies and guidelines
 * People Development: Support, guide, and coach managers in the country in performance management., training needs definition, identification and fostering of high-potentials, succession, and career path planning; conduct local talent conversations.
 * Organizational Development: Execute local roll-out of diversity, corporate culture, change management and initiatives.
 * Retention/Exit Management: Support exit management (e.g. negotiation of exit agreements, exit interviews), design and implement retention programs according to local needs in line with global Centers of Expertise guidance.
 * Employee Engagement: Execute employee engagement initiatives considering local specifics to support, foster and emphasize company culture.
 * Recruiting: Support business in local workforce planning, anticipate/evaluate and coordinate local recruiting needs, double check offer (proposal) and employment contract prepared by TA Team
 * Compensation and Benefits: Pay strategy discussion, conduct job evaluation with functional heads with newly created roles with support from Shared Service Center / Centers of Expertise and analyze data from salary survey, provide insights to line managers for decision making.
   
   

Qualification & Skills


 * Academic degree in MBA / MSW
 * 8-10 years' experience as Human Resources Business Partner in technology and/or in a commercial or manufacturing industry.
 * Business sense, open-minded, strategic, and critical thinking, logical mindset, self-motivated, energetic, result oriented, skillful to handle multi-tasks and quick learner.
 * Good MS Office skills, Word, Excel, PPT, HR system experience is must
 * Prior experience in Organizational Development and Talent Management is a plus
 * Clear and effective communication skills across all levels and functions
 * Good MS Office skills and HR system experience is required

title: Senior Manager - HR Business Partner
description:
Flex, a Fortune global 500 company, is the diversified manufacturing partner of choice that helps market-leading brands design, build and deliver innovative products that improve the world. We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion and cultivate a workplace culture of belonging that views uniqueness as a competitive edge and builds a community that enables our people to push the limits of innovation to make great products that create value and improve people’s lives. A career at Flex offers the opportunity to make a difference and invest in your growth in a respectful, inclusive, and collaborative environment. If you are excited about a role but don’t meet every bullet point, we encourage you to apply and join us to create the extraordinary.

To support our extraordinary teams who build great products and contribute to our growth, we’re looking to add a Senior Manager - Human Resources at Chennai. This role will be providing essential back-office Human Resources support on a global scale. This position will be based in our GBS HR center located in Chennai, India but will work closely with peers in GBS HR regional centers throughout the world.

What a Typical day looks like:


 * Develop and implement a strategy for the center that aligns with the vision and long-term business objectives for GBS HR.
 * Consult with business Leaders and HR colleagues to develop and deliver a HR strategy to meet the business needs.
 * Implement and facilitate HR initiatives (such as Flex Voice Survey, Attrition Management, Compliance, Sustainability, Diversity & Inclusion, Employee Relations, Communication, Manager Engagement, Employee Value Proposition, On-boarding to Exit Processes, wage base planning and review).
 * Partner with Regional and Site HRBPs to standardize processes across sites.
 * Lead the Site Human Resources Business Partners to establish employee communications & engagement cadence and to resolve employee relations issues. If need be, conduct effective, thorough and objective investigations.
 * Assist with HR communications and training of managers on new programs, systems and processes as required
 * Ensure the consistent treatment of employees and the consistent application of Flex policies and procedures
 * Collaborate on new employee / manager orientation to enable a seamless onboarding experience allowing insight to the Flex goals and culture.
 * Foster and maintain positive working relationships within all employee levels.
 * Consult and support Site Leaders on Site HR matters, with focus on Flex Culture, Manager Enablement & Employee Value Proposition, Automation of HR processes and HR Program / Policies.
 * Collaborate with TA and TD on staffing and development needs.
   
   

The experience we’re looking to add to our team:


 * Requires a degree in Human Resources Management or related areas.
 * Minimum 12 years experience as an operational HR professional or HR Generalist.
 * Minimum 8 years’ experience in a leadership position;
 * Self-starter who demonstrates accountability for results.
 * Sound knowledge of Organization Development, Change Management and HR practices.
 * Excellent business acumen and demonstrated competency in business partnership.
 * Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to build rapport quickly with senior management and communicate effectively with all levels of the organization.
 * Strong project management, process management, analytical and consulting skills.
 * Judgement, initiative, and tenacity demonstrated in an environment of rapid change.
   
   

What you’ll receive for the great work you provide:


 * Health Insurance
 * PTO
   
   

AG05


 * Site
   
   

Flex is an Equal Opportunity Employer and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate based on: age, race, religion, color, sex, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, pregnancy status, or any other status protected by law. We're happy to provide reasonable accommodations to those with a disability for assistance in the application process. This is only for disability assistance. To be considered for a position at Flex, you must complete the application process first).

title: Human Resources Business Partner
description:
HRBP Role Overview

A Human Resources Business Partner, often referred to as an HRBP, is a strategic HR role that focuses on aligning HR functions with the overall business goals and objectives of an organization. HRBPs work closely with business leaders and managers to provide HR solutions that support the company's growth, culture, and performance.




Key Responsibilities of an HRBP:

* Strategic HR Planning: Collaborating with senior management to develop and implement HR strategies that align with the company's goals.

Talent Acquisition: Overseeing recruitment efforts, workforce planning, and talent management.




* Employee Relations: Managing employee relations issues, conflict resolution, and ensuring a positive workplace culture.

* Performance Management: Implementing performance appraisal systems, coaching managers, and facilitating talent development.

* Compensation and Benefits: Managing compensation structures, benefit programs, and ensuring competitive pay practices.

* HR Compliance: Ensuring compliance with labor laws and regulations.

* Data Analysis: Utilizing HR analytics to make data-driven decisions and identify trends in workforce data.

* Change Management: Assisting in organizational change initiatives and ensuring smooth transitions.

* Employee Engagement: Fostering employee engagement and satisfaction through various HR programs and initiatives.

Requirements for an HRBP role:

* A bachelor’s degree in human resources, business, or a related field (some positions may require a master's degree or relevant certifications).

* Extensive experience in HR, often including previous roles in recruitment, employee relations, or HR generalist positions.

* Analytical and problem-solving abilities to address complex HR issues.

* Knowledge of employment laws and regulations.

* Business acumen and the ability to align HR strategies with organizational goals.




About us: PhysicsWallah Private Limited (commonly known as PhysicsWallah or simply PW) is an Indian multinational educational technology company headquartered in Noida, Uttar Pradesh. It was founded by Alakh Pandey and Prateek Maheshwari in 2020. It became a unicorn in June 2022 after raising $100 million at a valuation of $1.1 billion. PhysicsWallah is an EdTech startup founded in 2014 by Alakh Pandey. It is an e-learning platform that offers quality learning experiences at an affordable cost. This startup provides lectures and solutions on various subjects for students between classes 6 and 12, including JEE, NEET, and various other entrance exams. PhysicsWallah presents both live and scheduled lectures, along with doubt-solving sessions and structured materials, and helps students evaluate themselves through tests. Started as a YouTube channel, PhysicsWallah, as of today, has mentored over 6 million students and has over 13,700 video lectures on its platform. Offering both free and paid batches, PhysicsWallah has gained the reputation of lakhs of students through experienced and quality coaching

title: Senior Manager - HR Business Partner
description:
Site Name: Bengaluru Luxor North Tower

Posted Date: Feb 2 2024

Are you looking for a Human Resources management role that leverages your business partnering expertise and allows you to shape cultural change? If so, this General Multi-Disciplinary HR Manager role could be an ideal opportunity to explore.

As a General Multi-Disciplinary HR Manager, you will work with GSK leaders and teams in executing the US Inclusion & Diversity (I&D) strategy across GSK’s US Businesses.

This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career. These responsibilities include some of the following:



 * Engage with stakeholders and customers across the U.S. businesses to build relationships, increase visibility of Inclusion and Diversity (I&D) initiatives ensuring full business ownership of I&D change
 * Work with counterparts in Recruitment and Employment Practices to gather and analyze employment data relevant to addressing I&D challenges and opportunities
 * Ensure appropriate metrics to measure return on investment of the programs and recommend areas for improvement
 * Support and lead in executing I&D initiatives to enable learning, education, communication and engagement
 * Assist with developing publicity, communications and events to promote I&D programs across GSK-US and externally
 * Liaise with I&D Leads, Liaisons and Councils to develop and share best practice
 * Collaborate on ideas to embed I&D in the US and globally, working with vendors to design programs and resources
 * Work with US I&D Business Lead to develop strategy, execute tactics and design material to enable I&D capability building
 * Coordinate US external engagement approach, building long term relationships with targeted US universities to enhance GSK’s brand & our diverse R&D pipeline
 * Partner on Employee Resource Group pull-through initiatives to advance I&D learning, engagement and community outreach
 * Maintain and develop strategic partnerships with key US academic facilities to enhance pipeline of talent to GSK early talent programs, providing support to other early talent programs as needed
   
   
   

Why you?

Basic Qualifications:

We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:



 * Bachelor’s degree
 * Experience leading cultural change initiatives
 * Experience communicating to diverse audiences
 * Experience leading indirectly and working on project teams
   
   
   

Preferred Qualifications:

If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:



 * High learning agility necessary for problem solving of cultural challenges
 * Effective presentation and communication skills
 * Ability to build robust relationships with stakeholders
 * Ability to influence in a complex, matrix organization
   
   
   

Why GSK?

Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture.

These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork. As GSK focuses on our values and expectations and a culture of innovation, performance, and trust, the successful candidate will demonstrate the following capabilities:



 * Operating at pace and agile decision-making – using evidence and applying judgement to balance pace, rigour and risk.
 * Committed to delivering high quality results, overcoming challenges, focusing on what matters, execution.
 * Continuously looking for opportunities to learn, build skills and share learning.
 * Sustaining energy and well-being
 * Building strong relationships and collaboration, honest and open conversations.
 * Budgeting and cost-consciousness
   
   
   

Why Us?

GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose – to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together – so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns – as an organization where people can thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of 2030.

Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it’s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a workplace where everyone can feel a sense of belonging and thrive as set out in our Equal and Inclusive Treatment of Employees policy. We’re committed to being more proactive at all levels so that our workforce reflects the communities we work and hire in, and our GSK leadership reflects our GSK workforce.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

It has come to our attention that the names of GlaxoSmithKline or GSK or our group companies are being used in connection with bogus job advertisements or through unsolicited emails asking candidates to make some payments for recruitment opportunities and interview. Please be advised that such advertisements and emails are not connected with the GlaxoSmithKline group in any way.

GlaxoSmithKline does not charge any fee whatsoever for recruitment process. Please do not make payments to any individuals / entities in connection with recruitment with any GlaxoSmithKline (or GSK) group company at any worldwide location. Even if they claim that the money is refundable.

If you come across unsolicited email from email addresses not ending in gsk.com or job advertisements which state that you should contact an email address that does not end in “gsk.com”, you should disregard the same and inform us by emailing askus@gsk.com, so that we can confirm to you if the job is genuine.

www.sohosquaresolutions.com



Position: HR Manager

Location: Permanent Work from Home/ Remote

Job Type: Full-time

Required skills:

 1. Recruitment and Staffing:

 * Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract top talent.
 * Conduct thorough interviews and assessments to ensure the selection of qualified candidates.
 * Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffing needs and address recruitment challenges.
 * Manage the onboarding process for new hires, ensuring a smooth transition into the organization.

 1. Payroll Administration:

 * Oversee the payroll process, ensuring accurate and timely processing of employee salaries.
 * Stay updated on relevant labor laws and regulations to ensure compliance in payroll practices.
 * Address payroll-related queries from employees and resolve any discrepancies.
 * Collaborate with the finance department to reconcile payroll data and maintain accurate records.

 1. HR Policies and Compliance:

 * Develop, update, and enforce HR policies to ensure compliance with local labor laws and industry standards.
 * Conduct regular audits to monitor adherence to company policies and identify areas for improvement.
 * Keep abreast of changes in employment legislation and update policies accordingly.

 1. Employee Relations:

 * Foster positive employee relations by addressing concerns, conflicts, and grievances promptly.
 * Provide guidance and support to employees on HR-related matters.
 * Conduct employee satisfaction surveys and implement initiatives to enhance workplace morale.

 1. Training and Development:

 * Identify training needs within the organization and coordinate training programs.
 * Develop and implement career development plans for employees.
 * Encourage a culture of continuous learning and professional growth.

 1. Report Preparation and Analysis:

 * Prepare and analyze HR metrics and reports to provide insights into workforce trends.
 * Present findings to senior management and make recommendations for improvements.
 * Utilize data-driven insights to enhance HR strategies and decision-making.

Qualifications:

 * Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
 * Proven experience as an HR Manager in a staffing and consulting environment.
 * In-depth knowledge of recruitment, payroll administration, and HR best practices.
 * Strong understanding of local labor laws and regulations.
 * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
 * Demonstrated ability to handle confidential information with discretion.
 * Proficient in HRIS and MS Office applications.

title: Senior Manager - Talent Acquisition
description:
Overview

MAIN PURPOSE

The Talent Acquisition Manager (TAM) India Business Unit(BU) is responsible for executing against the talent acquisition strategy with core focus on the management of full life cycle recruiting for professional-level openings, Campus hiring and EVP/ employer branding by leveraging the expertise of GBS shared services team.

Responsibilities

KEY ACCOUNTABILITY

Strategic Talent Acquisition:


 * Conceptualise and execute strategic piple building programs and partners with HBS team to execute End to end hiring for professional & HRBPs for frontline as per global KPIs around Turnaround Time, Diversity, Hiring Manager and Candidate Experience.
 * Implement proactive talent attraction programs to explore newer talent pools and be ahead of the curve given the competitive landscape and talent shortages.
 * Support GBS stabilization through coaching, capability building, performance review and timely recognition
   
   

Campus Recruitment:


 * Deliver the BU campus agenda – Pipeline hiring, Summer Internship, on-going relationship management on campus
 * Lead year-round engagement initiatives including but not limited to Leadership Talks, Live projects, case studies and guest lectures to drive campus regular & timely engagement to ensure PepsiCo as an employer of choice on campuses
 * Administer and manage the Management Trainee Programme, Summer Intern program and Flagship engagement programs (like LTGT, Dare to Do More) for India BU.
 * Partner with HRBP and Business Heads to ensure appropriate projects and stints for all round development
 * Collaborate with Service delivery teams for implementing campus tools and technologies eg. PepHire, ICIMS campus workflow, Digital interviews, etc
   
   

Talent Attraction and Engagement:


 * Execute the year long EVP calendar for India BU in partnership with AMESA Attraction & Engagement COE
 * Develop consistent messaging addressing EVP drivers with branding in line with global guidance. Leverage existing PepsiCo social and digital platform
 * Develop consistent messaging addressing EVP drivers with branding in line with global guidance Content curation for Always On Content as well as planned Campaigns
 * Assess talent landscape and explore new age methodologies for driving Talent Attraction & Engagement agenda to stand out as an employer of choice
   
   

Qualifications

KEY SKILLS & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

Experience And Qualification


 * 4-6 years of professional experience post MBA. Previous HR experience with exposure to TA will be considered.
 * Campus and Employer Branding experience preferred.
 * Prior work experience within another FMCG or manufacturing organization and/or within another large, global, matrix environment
 * Must be a collaborative team player Strong oral and written communication skills
   
   

Skills And Behavioural Attributes

Overall


 * Ability to partner, collaborate and coach the HBS sourcing & admin team

title: Manager / Senior Manager - Human Resources
description:

Essential Qualification: MBA / MSW in HRM or PG Diploma in HRM and LLB.




**IMPORTANT** :- Candidates will be preferred in north especially from Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana , Chandigarh surrounding of Himachal Pradesh.







JOB DESCRIPTION :-




Payroll Compliances:-




 * Tax calculation for staff & workmen as per IT Rules and checking of saving proofs.
 * Timely maintain the Loan Registers and ensure timely deduction of the same.
 * Provisions of monthly salary and wages to Accounts teams
 * Sharing of TDS and professional tax report to UKSC Team by 06th of every month.
 * Sharing addition deletion of PF for O&S and WB to PF Trust by 05th of every month.
 * To share the PF report of WB Workers to PF trust by 05th of every month.




Salary and Wage administration:-




 * Preparing perquisites for electricity and furniture.
 * Preparation of deduction sheet, arrears, advances for O&S and WB and uploading the same as per payroll calendar.
 * Cross checking the salary and wages registers and ensuring error free operations.
 * To share the bank list to UKSC Pune for timely payments.
 * Preparing of JV’s and submitting the same to UKSC.
 * To generate JV of Car Operating Expenses on 15th and 30th of every month and sending the same to UKSC for payment.
 * Supporting employees (O&S and WB) for various payroll activities like deductions, LTA, Income Tax Proofs, Deductions etc.

Loan & advances, Full and Final & MIS preparation:-

 * Supporting Wage Board employees for loan applications and uploading the same on PF Trust site.
 * Preparing presentations and various data as and when required by Management.



Statutory Compliance - Coordinating and Monitoring all the activities required for fulfilling the statutory compliance, timely: -



 * Timely compliance of statutory payments & returns and submission like PF, Gratuity, Superannuation & Bonus.
 * Providing details for filing of Factory Act returns like salary, bonus, gratuity payments.
 * Timely submission of Form L (Payment of Gratuity Act) to government authorities.
 * Ensuring deduction of PF & Income Tax and ensure timely remittance.
 * Timely submission for settlement of the various claims of PF like Death/ Retirement/ Advance/ Transfer etc.
 * Timely renewal of EDLI policy.
 * Supporting PF ER in updation of compliance manager tool
 * Submission of quarterly return of Income Tax for O&S and Wage Board workmen to UKSC.
 * Time and accurate payment of Bonus to O&S and Wage Board workmen.
 * Keeping all updated data ready for various assessment and Audit and clear the same without any major NC
 * Should have the experience in various statutory and Legal Compliances

title: Human Resources Business Partner
description:
ABOUT FLUENCE

Fluence, a Siemens and AES company, is the global market leader in energy storage products, services, and digital applications. The Fluence Trading Platform helps energy storage and renewable asset owners maximize revenue in wholesale electricity markets through AI-enabled optimized bidding software. Through our products and services, Fluence is helping customers around the world drive more resilient electric grids and a more sustainable future.




ABOUT THE POSITION:

Key Accountabilities / How You Will Spend Your Days

 * Influence & drive talent strategies to impact business outcomes.
 * Lead key talent transformation/change initiatives that have the highest business impact. Partner with key business stakeholders to drive the highest organizational effectiveness.
 * Successfully execute talent strategies across Workforce Planning, Learning & Development, and Leadership roles for the future (e.g. workforce strategy, best cost site, competencies).
 * Own, drive, advise, and coach business through the annual talent processes around performance, total rewards, promotions, bonus, annual pay, talent assessment & development, succession planning, engagement, etc.
 * Leverage HR analytics to advise business leaders on key people metrics such as retention, total rewards, engagement, and diversity-related outcomes.
 * Collaborate with HR peers to innovate and design solutions for functional challenges.
 * Drive people-related initiatives with your communication, coaching, and influencing skills, and offer thought-leadership regarding organizational/people-related strategy and execution.
 * Implement performance and reporting measures, regularly synchronizing with internal stakeholders to identify gaps and opportunities.
 * Serve as a single point of accountability for escalations ensuring better employee experience.
 * Partner closely with CoEs and HR ops teams to deliver high-value service, address and manage employee relations matters, and work to resolve them through a systematic approach, adhering to company policies, local employment laws, and best practices.
 * Proactively develop relationships across the organization that can be leveraged to drive HR’s agenda and deliverables.

Key Performance Indicators :

 * Improved Business performance with a focus on impact especially productivity, cost, and growth.
 * Organizational effectiveness (structure, role clarity, capability mix, cost).
 * Leadership effectiveness (quality of hires, succession plans, development plans, 3-year roadmap progress, leadership index).
 * Drive talent programs focused on impact.
 * Efficient workforce planning keeping time, cost, and quality targets into consideration
 * Functional Talent assessment and development for key roles.

Key Year One Deliverables:

 * Design, Develop, and Standardization of policies, process, and programs
 * Establish strong governance on talent management.
 * Drive interventions to engage talent
 * Develop key strategies for talent retention

Technical Knowledge and Skills :

 * Bachelor’s / Master’s degree in management
 * 10 – 12 years of relevant experience in HRBP
 * Experience in supporting an organization that is experiencing global growth.
 * Experience in organizational design, succession planning, workforce planning, performance management, talent acquisition, learning and development, talent management, data analysis, and diversity and inclusion.
 * High levels of business acumen and insight (including knowledge of various strategic, financial, and operational business models).
 * End to end HR core processes knowledge

Key Leadership Behaviors :

 * Agility and delivery excellence
 * Business acumen
 * Critical thinking
 * Status quo challenger
 * Stakeholder management

Reporting Structure:

 * Position will report to Human Resources Director - India

title: NxtWave - Senior HR Business Partner
description:
NxtWave is one of India's fastest-growing Ed-Tech startups. NxtWave is revolutionizing the 21st-century job market by transforming youth into highly skilled tech professionals irrespective of their educational background with its CCBP 4.0 programs.

NxtWave is founded by Rahul Attuluri (Ex Amazon, IIIT Hyderabad), Sashank Reddy (IIT Bombay) and Anupam Pedarla (IIT Kharagpur). In February 2023, NxtWave raised - 275 crore led by Greater Pacific Capital, a leading international private equity firm. The startup is also backed by Orios Ventures, Better Capital and marquee angels, including founders of some of India's unicorns.

NxtWave is an official partner for NSDC, under the Ministry of Skill Development & Entrepreneurship, Govt. of India, and recognized by NASSCOM, Ministry of Commerce and Industry, Govt. of India, and Startup India. The startup has received accolades as 'The Greatest Brand in Education' in a research-based listing by URS Media, a leading international media house.

By offering vernacular content and interactive learning, NxtWave is breaking the entry barrier for learning tech skills. Learning in their mother tongue helps learners achieve higher comprehension, deeper attention, longer retention, and greater outcomes.

NxtWave now has paid subscribers from 450+ districts across India. In just 2 years, CCBP 4.0 learners have been hired by 1500+ companies including Google, Amazon, Nvidia, Goldman Sachs, Oracle, Deloitte, and more.

Scale at which we operate on tech level (as on February 2023)

370 Cr+ learning minutes spent

69 Cr+ Code Runs

4.2 Bn. + API Requests Handled by our servers

Know more about NxtWave: https://www.ccbp.in

Read more about us in the news - Economic Times | CNBC | Yourstory | VCCircle

Job Overview

We are looking for a qualified HR business partner to oversee all human resources operations and ensure they're aligned with our business goals.

Our ideal candidates should have solid experience with HR practices and employee management. You will communicate with the senior managers to express new ideas and suggest solutions, considering team dynamics and our company culture.

Ultimately, you should be able to act as a consultant on human resources management and organizational changes for your department

Roles And Responsibilities


 * Collaborate with Talent Acquisition team to fulfill all BU manpower requirements
 * Actively engage with the Manager and Sr Managers and teams in understanding the business objectives, challenges, opportunities and facilitate solutions and people strategies to address those challenges.
 * Provide executive coaching to leaders on leadership strategies, organizational effectiveness, and collaboration for achieving business goals.
 * Be a Talent Advocate - gaining a deep understanding of succession benches, development needs and career opportunities. Connect talent & leadership across the BU
 * Drive and manage organizational change management and culture development initiatives that support the business in its innovation and growth objectives.
 * Partner with senior leadership to embed a continuous focus on a high-performance culture to enhance organizational capabilities and build a robust talent pipeline.
 * Collaborate with Centers of Excellence (COE's) in driving and effectively supporting business initiatives & priorities.
 * Partner with the assigned COE's to identify trends & solutions in talent acquisition, compensation, employee growth plans, employee development, and employee relations issues.
 * Manage Employee Relations and grievance redressal process
 * Partner and support organizational design, organizational development including succession strategy, talent development, employee engagement, and change management processes.
 * Partner with senior management to develop and implement HR plans and solutions.
 * Partner with leaders to identify and address critical organizational and people issues.
 * Partner with leaders to develop and track key talent and ensure experience-based development and retention.
 * Deliver Employee Experience programs to the business, including mNPS Survey, eNPS Engagement Survey, Leadership Developments Programs, Annual Rewards, Workforce Planning
 * Harvest robust influential associations across the senior management teams in order to deliver a value-added, commercial HR solution in line with the overall people & business strategy.
 * Work in partnership with the leadership teams in the development and improvement of colleague, team and function performance in line with the HR priorities and the business change agenda
 * Drive business engagement and implementation across all areas of the HR agenda, spearhead all HR initiatives & change projects ensuring key stakeholder management locally & globally.
 * Contribute to the development and delivery of HR Strategy and give productive feedback to the HR Head on business expectations and impact of HR interventions and policies.
   
   

Requirements And Skills


 * Proven work experience as an HR business partner
 * Excellent people management skills
 * Analytical and goal-oriented
 * Demonstrable experience with HR metrics
 * Thorough knowledge of labor legislation
 * Full understanding of all HR functions and best practices
 * Masters degree in Human Resources or related field
 * Proactive nature
   
   

Work Location: NxtWave Office (Hyderabad)

Working Days: 6 Days a week

title: Associate Director Human Resources
description:
Hello, Truecaller is calling you from Bangalore, India! Ready to pick up?




Truecaller transformed how we communicate when we launched in 2009 in Stockholm, Sweden.




Our mission is to build trust everywhere by making tomorrow’s communication smarter, safer and more efficient. We focus on bringing smart services with big social impacts, like protecting people from fraud, harassment, and scam calls or messages. We identify new numbers from anywhere in the world and build a space for trustworthy conversations, for those that matter. Truecaller is loved by over 350 million people around the world and is growing very rapidly across regions.




Who we are:




 * The world’s #1 caller ID and spam blocking service for Android and iOS.
 * A team of 400+ people from ~35 different nationalities, spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, Tel Aviv, Nairobi and Cairo
 * Listed On Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap




As an Associate Director, HR at Truecaller you will be instrumental in ensuring our ability to consistently attract, nurture, and retain a pool of highly skilled individuals. Ensuring the employee experience with us is great.




The scope of this role lies with HR Operations, HR Business Partnership and Talent Acquisition for India where we have team members in Bangalore, Gurgaon and Mumbai. You will manage the People India Team and work closely with your peers in Sweden. You will report to the CHRO based in Stockholm, Sweden and be a member of the People Leadership Team as well as the Operating Committée led by the CPO & Managing Director India.




What will you work on




 * Responsible for all HR operations including payroll & audits for India.
 * Be an excellent leader and role model that engages, empowers and develops your team.
 * Contribute to the development of our People strategy and roadmap with quarterly metrics and goals.
 * Shape Organizational capability to drive efficiency and drive reorganization projects when needed.
 * Accountable for HR compliance and updates of any policies and support management with labor law advice and support.
 * Develop our leaders by coaching formal and informal leaders to improve their leadership skills .
 * Be part of developing Truecaller Culture & Values through workshops and other activities
 * Manage and support the TA team with strategic questions around Talent Acquisition and Employer Branding .
 * Collaborate with the L&D Team to develop Truecaller’s employee life cycle including Performance Management, Learning & Development, Onboarding & Offboarding, constantly reviewing and improving the processes to be adapted to the business and market requirements.
 * Collaborate with C&B to make sure we are competitive to attract and retain great people
 * Collaborate with the Workplace Experience Team to organize employee events such as Summer event, End Year Party, Truecaller awards and other activities to strengthen the Truecaller culture.
 * Collaborate with the Global ESG Director on the Human capital development aspect of ESG - sustainability.




What do we expect from you ?




 * 8+ years’ experience with HR in Senior HR Management roles.
 * 4+ years of experience in directly managing a team.
 * Experience working with entrepreneurial and growing global organizations with HR functions in several geographic locations.
 * Excellent people relation skills, adapting behavior to people and situations.
 * Demonstrate a solution focused approach to problem solving, and look for pragmatic outcomes.
 * Ability to prioritize and be flexible in a fast paced environment with changing demands.
 * Proven record to demonstrate a commercial approach to managing HR issues.
 * Result-oriented, focusing on fulfilling management expectations.
 * Great communicator, able to present information and reports in a clear and trustworthy manner.
 * Your specific area of expertise can vary. However, experience from HRBP and TA are of high relevance. In addition, experience from C&B will be valued.
 * Google environment, Slack, Excel and analysis.
 * Presentation skills.




We also want you to be :




 * Passionate about HR.
 * Polite and respectful.
 * Honest and trustworthy.
 * Proactive and creative.
 * Results oriented.
 * Team player and active contributor.
 * Prestige less with a good sense of humor!




Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: instagram.com/truecaller/




Sounds like your dream job?




We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. We are excited to hear from you, don’t hesitate to apply!




This position is based in Bangalore, India.




We only accept applications in English




What we offer:




 * A smart, talented and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing and fun environment.
 * A great compensation package: Competitive salary, excellent medical, accident and life-term insurance, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and flexible working hours.
 * Office life: Enjoy your days with a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. As well, exciting company parties and team activities such as Football, Lab days, Running team, Art initiatives ,Office riddles, Geek lunch and more!




Come as you are:




Truecaller is diverse, equal and inclusive. We need a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs and experiences in order to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

title: Sr. Manager Unit HR IR - Nanded
description:
Roles & Responsibilities:




1. Strategic HR Business Partnering for the region

 * Work closely with Head - Delivery Organization and Functional Heads to

transform & align people agenda and strategies to Business objectives with a

focus on capability building and performance enablement

 * Understand the region priorities and field (supply and demand) goals to identify

field level HR levers enabling performance; Draw out the HR Supply Priorities and

plans aligned to

 * Contribute towards co-creation of HR Policies & Process in line with

organizational culture, business needs and talent management

 * Partner key Stakeholders and Business Leaders to deliver high efficiency in HR

services on day-to-day basis.




2. Change Management & New Initiatives




 * Work with functional heads to design OD and Change Management strategies for the region. Extend up to Implementation and Monitoring level.
 * Drive business leadership to influence the team in adopting and implementation change / HR initiatives such as P4Gs, FRCs etc.
 * Utilize effective engagement activities in communicating change through events and regular training
 * Connect with all levels of management at regional and HO level to facilitate change
 * Use inputs from various organizational forums, to identify HR interventions that

can enhance organizational effectiveness and drive such initiatives

 * Drive & own Value survey Actionables across Demand and Supply Field functions




3. IR and Compliance




 * Guide and co-ordinate with the plant HR team on systems and policies; Anchor LTS and other workforce management milestones in partnership with IR Specialist
 * Mentor the plant HR team in line with IR strategy and transform agenda in manufacturing
 * Guide resolution of issues and create an environment where risk is avoided
 * Champion the embedding of a compliance culture within USL




4. Talent Acquisition




 * Ensure that the right people with the right capabilities are in place; Work closely with Talent COE to ensure right external-internal talent mapping
 * Monitor manpower utilization through productivity analysis and other MIS at both clusters and plants (full time, FTEs, contractual, casual)
 * Participate in the Selection Process based on the Selection norms




5. Talent Management and Employee Engagement




 * Participate in Regional Leadership Team meetings to address people priorities, action plans and key updates. Support business decisions with a view on Talent
 * Provide HO with learning requirements for region for both functional and leadership capability development
 * Anchor capability development for employees in partnership with Talent CoE
 * Devise strategy for local engagement activities or roll out of Pan India / region engagement initiatives
 * Lead Talent Reviews, career management and succession planning
 * Lead Value Survey action planning for the region and roll out of Pan India VS Actions. Have joint ownership for VS results & culture building




6. Performance & Rewards




 * Support in implementation of employee reward programs like increments, variable pay plans, performance-linked plans etc.
 * Oversee implementation of the Performance Management process incl. P4Gs upholding principles
 * Roll out monetary and non-monetary rewards and recognition initiatives for employees to drive high productivity and morale
 * Embed High performance culture and drive transparency, fairness of practices




7. HR Operations




 * Partner with regional leadership team to deliver high efficiency in HR processes on a day-to-day basis
 * Guide and Co-ordinate with Field HR Supply for roll-out and implementation of systems and policies.
 * Resolve any grievances of employees in order to maintain smooth and effective implementation of day to day HR operations
 * Conduct periodic process audit at the units to ensure consistent implementation and take corrective action as required
 * Take end-accountability on maintenance of key documents and database of region



Diversity statement

Celebrating our inclusive and diverse culture is core to Diageos purpose of “celebrating life every day everywhere”. This purpose is, in itself, inclusive in nature, as it values everybody irrespective of background, disability, religion, gender identity, sexuality or ethnicity.

We know that for our business to thrive and for Diageo to realize its ambition, we depend on having diverse talent with a range of backgrounds, skills, and capabilities in each of the 180 countries in which we operate and to reflect our broad consumer base. We view diversity as one of the key enablers that helps our business to grow and our values, purpose and standards set the conditions for us to respect the unique contribution each person brings.




Preferred candidate profile




Qualification:

 * Post Graduate in HR/ER/Social Sciences
 * Preferably from a reputed institute




Experience:

 * 8 - 12 years experience in HRBP
 * 2-3 years experience in leadership roles




Knowledge & skills:

 * Knowledge in Indian Labour Laws with operational experience in IR for manufacturing units.
 * Strong Learning & Development / OD exposure to Support leadership
 * Sound HR exposure in areas of talent management and development




Best Suited for someone:

 * Can influence and manage perceptions at regional management levels
 * Is politically savvy
 * Advises the team on how best to mitigate high pressure situations with minimal risk
 * Likes taking on roles which are operationally intensive
 * Can build a strong team

title: Senior Manager - Human Resources
description:
About Ascendion:




Ascendion is an ally for enterprise digital innovation.

We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. By embracing the future of work, we bring creativity and execution excellence together to make the digital journey valuable (and even fun)! Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation for Global 2000 clients.

Headquartered in New Jersey, our hybrid workforce delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is committed to building technology that elevates life with an inclusive workforce, service to our communities, and a vibrant culture.




Website: www.ascendion.com




Job Description:




Job Designation: Senior Manager – Human Resources

Job Location: Bangalore, Chennai

Job Time: 11 AM to 8 PM IST




The incumbent will be responsible for spearheading and driving people strategy in synergy with business for Engineering Business. Reporting to the Senior Director – People and Culture , this position acts as a Strategic Business Partner who facilitates, supports and challenges business leaders along with anticipating the much-needed focus and change in the people management metrics with the ever-evolving business landscape. The role requires the incumbent to have extremely strong execution skills along with a sound conceptual base.




 * Lead, oversee and supervise the Corporate (Generalist) HR & HRBP Team.
 * Formulate, communicate, periodically review and make recommendations to executive management for improvement of the organization's policies, procedures and practices on personnel matters.
 * Oversee all HR initiatives, systems and tactics and leverage data and analytics to extract insights for continuous improvement.
 * Work as a strategic partner to functional leaders in overseeing the functioning of Human Resource Business Partners (HRBPs) across locations and provide core HR insights regarding the same.
 * Serve as the point of contact for employment relations, and deal with grievances and violations invoking disciplinary action when required.
 * Develop engagement programs for a highly engaged, motivated and productive workforce.
 * Work directly with senior managers to assist them in carrying out their responsibilities on personnel matters and ensure attrition levels are within targets.
 * Assist executive management in the annual review, preparation and administration of the organization's compensation and benefits program.
 * Recommend, evaluate and participate in the development of organization’s human resource.
 * Develop and maintain a human resource information system that meets the organization's personnel information needs.
 * Continuously monitor and review the Organization Structure and ensure it scales in the right manner.
 * Maintain knowledge of industry trends, best practices and employment legislation and ensure organization's compliance.
 * Establish key metrics to accurately define the competencies and skills required for each role/ department within the organization along with individual performance mapping to set-up the KPI framework.
 * Participate on committees and special projects and seek additional responsibilities.




Required Competencies:




 * A full-time master’s degree in human resource management from a premier B-school is a must.
 * Proven experience of around 12 plus years in a mid-sized ITES organization of working on a role as elucidated in the responsibilities. Experience at startups or fast-growing ventures is a plus.
 * Ability to work in a dynamic fast paced environment with a high degree of ownership.
 * Excellent knowledge of employment legislation, regulations, human resource management principles and best practices. Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, conflict resolution, communication (oral as well as written), research, planning, and leadership skills.
 * A business acumen partnered with attention to the human element.
 * Knowledge of data analysis and reporting.
 * Prior experience in Strategic Human Resource Management is desirable.
 * Excellent organizational and leadership skills.
 * Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.
 * Diligent and firm with high ethical standards.

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
Company Description

ControlZ is a smartphone industry disruptor founded in 2019, located in Gurugram. Our expertise lies in renewing pre-owned devices at the component level, delivering a high-quality experience that's good as new. Sustainability is at the core of everything we do. We reduce the carbon footprint of smartphone manufacturing by extending the life cycle of the device. Our ultimate goal is to establish new sustainability benchmarks and reshape the way the world thinks about smartphone consumption.




Role Description

This is a full-time on-site role for a Human Resources Manager. The Human Resources Manager will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of the HR function, including recruitment and hiring, employee relations, training and development, performance management, and benefits administration. The Human Resources Manager will also be responsible for ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.




Qualifications

 * Experience in HR management, recruitment and hiring, employee relations, training and development, performance management, and benefits administration
 * Knowledge of legal and regulatory requirements related to HR functions
 * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
 * Strong organizational and problem-solving skills
 * Demonstrated ability to function well under pressure and manage multiple priorities
 * Experience in a start-up environment is a plus

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
TeOra is a pioneering biotechnology company with a mission to transform the food production

industry by avoiding losses due to diseases and eradicating the use of harmful chemicals and

pesticides. They focus on leveraging cutting-edge biotechnology to develop safe, natural, and

sustainable biologics for use in agriculture and aquaculture. Their technology and solutions aim to

address disease management, enhance crop and livestock health, and promote environmentally

friendly and sustainable farming practices. By reducing the reliance on harmful chemicals and

improving disease prevention, TeOra aims to contribute to healthier, more sustainable food

production system.




TeOra is seeking an experienced and dynamic HR & Admin Manager to join our team. The HR &

Admin Manager will be responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of human resources

and administrative functions within the company. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in

driving the HR strategy, implementing policies, and ensuring compliance with employment laws

and regulations. This role requires strong leadership skills, excellent organizational abilities, and a

deep understanding of HR best practices.

 

Responsibilities

 * Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the company's overall objectives and culture.
 * Manage the entire employee lifecycle, including recruitment, onboarding, performance management, and offboarding processes.
 * Oversee the payroll and benefits administration processes, ensuring accuracy and compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
 * Develop and maintain HR policies, procedures, and employee handbooks, keeping them up to date with current employment legislation.
 * Provide guidance and support to managers and employees on HR-related matters, including employee relations, performance issues, and disciplinary actions.
 * Conduct regular training sessions for employees and managers to promote a positive work environment and enhance professional development.
 * Manage the company's talent acquisition process, including job postings, candidate screening, interviewing, and selection.
 * Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records, including personnel files, contracts, and other relevant documentation.
 * Ensure compliance with labor laws, health and safety regulations, and other applicable legal requirements.
 * Handle employee grievances and mediate conflict resolution, fostering a positive work environment.
 * Manage office administration tasks, including facilities management, vendor coordination, and inventory management.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement employee engagement initiatives, wellness programs, and employee recognition strategies.
 * Support in digital marketing & PR initiatives.




Qualifications

 * Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
 * Minimum of 3 years of experience in HR management, with a focus on employee relations, recruitment, and policy development and overall experience of 7-9 years
 * Strong knowledge of employment laws, regulations, and best practices.
 * Proven experience in managing payroll, benefits administration, and HRIS systems.
 * Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build rapport and collaborate effectively with employees at all levels.
 * Strong leadership abilities, with a track record of managing and developing a team.
 * Demonstrated problem-solving skills and the ability to make sound decisions in a fast-paced environment.

description:

investment community across Asia. AVPN’s mission is to catalyse the movement toward a

more strategic, collaborative, and outcome-focused approach to social investing, ensuring

smooth HR operations and be engaged in a diverse range of HR activities from recruitment

of interns & junior levels, HRMS, training & engagement. We are looking for candidates

based in the Mumbai.

(interns- junior positions), onboarding, HR operations, employee engagement, etc.

activities.

engagement.

Equal Employment Opportunity

title: Talent Acquisition Manager
description:
About NxtWave




NxtWave is one of India’s fastest-growing Ed-Tech startups. NxtWave is revolutionizing the 21st-century job market by transforming youth into highly skilled tech professionals irrespective of their educational background with its CCBP 4.0 programs.




NxtWave was founded by Rahul Attuluri (Ex Amazon, IIIT Hyderabad), Sashank Reddy (IIT Bombay), and Anupam Pedarla (IIT Kharagpur). In February 2023, NxtWave raised ₹275 crore led by Greater Pacific Capital, a leading international private equity firm. The startup is also backed by Orios Ventures, Better Capital, and marquee angels, including founders of some of India’s unicorns.




NxtWave is an official partner for NSDC, under the Ministry of Skill Development & Entrepreneurship, Govt. of India, and recognized by NASSCOM, Ministry of Commerce and Industry, Govt. of India, and Startup India. The startup has received accolades as ‘The Greatest Brand in Education’ in a research-based listing by URS Media, a leading international media house.




By offering vernacular content and interactive learning, NxtWave is breaking the entry barrier for learning tech skills. Learning in their mother tongue helps learners achieve higher comprehension, deeper attention, longer retention, and greater outcomes.




NxtWave now has paid subscribers from 450+ districts across India. In just 2 years, CCBP 4.0 learners have been hired by 1500+ companies including Google, Amazon, Nvidia, Goldman Sachs, Oracle, Deloitte, and more.




The scale at which we operate on the tech level




 * 370 Cr+ learning minutes spent
 * 69 Cr+ Code Runs
 * 4.2 Bn. + API Requests Handled by our servers




Know more about NxtWave: https://www.ccbp.in




Read more about us in the news - Economic Times | CNBC | Yourstory | VCCircle




Responsibilities:

Analytical Skills:

Identify areas for improvement and take proactive measures to enhance the overall hiring process.

Provide regular reports and insights to the leadership team.

Planning and Execution:

Develop daily, weekly, and monthly hiring plans aligned with organizational goals.

Execute the hiring plan efficiently, ensuring the timely closure of open positions.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align hiring efforts with business objectives.

Good to have Power BI , Looker Studio

Proven experience as a Talent Acquisition Manager or in a similar role.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make strategic decisions.

Excellent leadership and team management abilities.

Effective communication skills and a keen eye for detail.

Demonstrated success in achieving recruitment targets.

If you are a dynamic individual with a passion for talent acquisition and a proven track record in leading successful recruitment teams, we invite you to apply.

description:
With a startup spirit and 115,000+ curious and courageous minds, we have the expertise to go deep with the world’s biggest brands—and we have fun doing it! Welcome to the relentless pursuit of better.
