title: HR Generalist
description:
If you've used Disney+, Peacock, or other top streaming platforms, you've already benefited from Conviva's technology. We empower the world’s leading B2C companies, including the biggest names in streaming media, to deliver exceptional digital experiences and optimize the “moments that matter” to their customers and their business. As the global leader in experience-centric operational analytics, Conviva has redefined big data analytics with our paradigm-shifting Time-State Analytics model. Our platform does what legacy observability and monitoring tools can’t: we eliminate the gaps between system performance, user experience, and engagement, enabling issue identification, impact assessment, and root cause resolution in seconds. This isn’t just important, its game-changing! Our platform processes over 5 trillion daily events, providing real-time, cost-effective, stateful computation across diverse data sets. This empowers operations teams for the first time to precisely and directly impact real-world business outcomes, including customer satisfaction and revenue.

Conviva is seeking a People, Place & Culture (PPC) Generalist who will be responsible for providing Top-Notch service, data analysis, project management and technical support in the delivery of global people operations programs.

What You Get To Do


 * Be the on the front line of People, Place & Culture (PPC). Serve as main point of contact for inquiries from the India organization including responding to the PPC email inbox for employment related requests. Have an in-depth understanding of all HR systems, processes and people practices of the organisation. Be the champion of a top-notch onboarding experience from the welcome aboard system process to conducting their day-1 new hire orientation. Assist employees with benefit enrolment, data entry, wellness activities and HRIS system needs.
 * Drive People Data Integrity. Record, track, enter accurate information in various systems and tools, including bonuses and payments, personal data, performance evaluations, benefits and org chart software.
 * Shine as the Workflow Master. Own PPC operations day-to-day administration including but not limited to processing changes on all HR systems, managing purchase orders & invoices from vendors. Ensure compliance with local, state and federal employment laws. You will standardize processes for filing, emailing and scanning HR related documents and ensure confidentiality. Smash deadlines and build continuity between PPC and payroll team to ensure an exemplary Conviva employee experience. Be an integral part of the ISO team to ensure that the India center is 100% compliant on all facets of ISO. Are data driven and can drive story telling through data.
 * Responsible for Creating. Innovation thought leader in making recommendations for continuous improvement, maintaining compliance, and remaining current with HR and company trends, regulations, and best practices. Participate, assist, and add flavor to PPC and company events including, PPC Staff workshops, celebrations, wellness activities, etc.
   
   

What You Bring To The Role


 * Relevant Experience. 5+ years of experience with HR operations including employee onboarding, conducting new hire orientations, employee benefit plans and leaves of absence programs, working day-to-day with HRIS systems, Knowledge of pertinent employment laws, federal and state regulations, filing and compliance requirements. BA/BS degree in related fields is preferred or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
 * Internal/External partner development. You are a master at crafting and maintaining key cross-functional relationships with Recruiting, Workplace, IT, Finance and employees to ensure unified team effort in providing top notch service as the daily standard. You stand out while managing external vendors as an extension of the Conviva team.
 * Global mindset. You have the experience in or ability to develop, prioritize and promote multiple processes/projects simultaneously, spanning multiple audiences globally.
 * Process-practical. You value repeatable practices, but not at the expense of progress. You speak up when best practices prove not to be, encourage others to challenge the status quo, and double-down when you find something that works.
 * Ease with data. You know how to rapidly source the data you need and use it to tell an insightful story that drives change. Leveraging data to make decisions and foster growth is second nature to you, and a skill you have successfully developed. You have a proven track record for being resourceful and you are comfortable with using MS Excel pivot tables, vlookups and other formulas / macros, MS Word mail merge, and MS PowerPoint.
   
   

Underpinning the Conviva platform is a rich history of innovation. More than 60 patents represent award-winning technologies and standards, including first-of-its kind-innovations like Time-State analytics and AI-automated data modeling, that surface actionable insights. By understanding real-world human experiences and having the ability to act within seconds of observation, our customers can solve business-critical issues and focus on growing their business ahead of the competition. Examples of the brands Conviva has helped innovate, adapt, and scale at unprecedented speed include: DAZN, Disney+, HBO, Hulu, NBCUniversal, Paramount+, Peacock, Sky, Sling TV, Univision and Warner Bros Discovery.

Privately held, Conviva is headquartered in Silicon Valley, California with offices and people around the globe. For more information, visit us at www.conviva.com. Join us to help extend our leadership position in big data streaming analytics to new audiences and markets!

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
The purpose of the HR department is to manage the company's workforce and ensure that the organization's human capital is effectively utilized, developed, and aligned with the company's goals and objectives. The purpose of the Administration department is to provide support services that keep the company running smoothly and efficiently. The admin team manages various logistical and operational aspects of the organization.




Role Summary

Recruitment and Selection: HR is responsible for identifying staffing needs, posting job openings, conducting interviews, and hiring the right candidates for various positions within the company.

Employee Onboarding: HR facilitates the process of integrating new employees into the company by providing orientation, training, and support during the initial stages of their employment.

Performance Management: HR helps set performance expectations, conducts performance appraisals, and provides feedback to employees to improve their productivity and contribute to the company's success.

Employee Development: HR plans and organizes training and development programs to enhance employees' skills and knowledge, ensuring they have the tools they need to succeed in their roles.

Compensation and Benefits: HR manages employee compensation, including salaries, bonuses, and benefits like health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off.

Employee Relations: HR handles employee grievances, conflict resolution, and fosters a positive work environment by promoting effective communication and addressing employee concerns.




Compliance: HR ensures that the company follows labor laws, regulations, and industry standards related to employment practices, diversity and inclusion, and workplace safety.




Office Management: Admin oversees the day-to-day operations of the office, including maintaining a clean and organized workspace, managing office supplies, and ensuring equipment is functional.

Facilities Management: Admin manages the company's physical facilities, including office maintenance, security, and safety protocols.

Travel and Logistics: Admin handles travel arrangements, accommodations, and transportation for employees who need to travel for work.

Event Planning: Admin organizes company meetings, workshops, and conferences, ensuring they run smoothly and meet the intended objectives.

Records and Documentation: Admin maintains records, files, and documentation related to the company's operations, finances, and legal matters.

Communication: Admin often assists in internal communication efforts, such as distributing




 * Talent Acquisition and Recruitment:




Job analysis and description creation Candidate sourcing, screening, and interviewing

Assessment and selection techniques Onboarding and orientation processes

Employee Relations and Engagement:




 * Conflict resolution and mediation Employee communication and feedback
 * Employee engagement strategies Performance management and feedback
 * Learning and Development: Training needs assessment




 * Compensation and Benefits:
 * Compensation structure and analysis
 * Benefits administration
 * Job evaluation and salary benchmarking
 * Incentive and bonus programs




 * HR Compliance and Legal Knowledge:
 * Employment laws and regulations
 * Equal employment opportunity practices
 * Privacy and data protection regulations
 * Workplace safety and compliance




 * Technical Competencies for HR Roles:
 * HRIS (Human Resources Information Systems):
 * Data entry and management







 * Performance Management Tools:
 * Setting performance goals and metrics
 * Learning management systems (LMS)
 * E-learning platforms




 * Payroll and Compensation.




 * Functional Competencies for Admin Roles:




 * Office Management:
 * Facilities and space management
 * Vendor management 
 * Logistics and Event Planning:
 * Communication and Correspondence:
 * Internal and external communication management
 * Drafting and editing documents (memos, letters, emails)




 * Record Keeping and Documentation:
 * Organizing and maintaining records
 * Document filing and retrieval systems
 * Data entry and database management




 * Technical Competencies for Admin Roles:
 * Office Software and Tools:
 * Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
 * Document management systems
 * Calendar and scheduling software
 * Event Planning Software:﻿

Minimum Qualifications/education

 * Bachelor’s degree – BA /BCA/ B Com
 * Master's degree – HRM / 

Minimum experience: 4-6  years 

Skills:  Good communication / Multitasking / Data management / Technical savviness /computer proficiency /

title: Senior Human Resource Manager
description:
About efficiently.com

.efficiently is a productivity partner, helping businesses become more efficient. One of our core product offerings is Staffing Placement Services; we recruit and train global team members (primarily in India) and place them remotely with USA-based companies.

We are not a recruitment firm, we partner with our clients, and placement team members remain employees of .efficiently – reducing barriers and costs for global staffing.

Every business in the USA needs help with its staffing needs. We provide vetted and trained offshore specialists in many industry verticals (our core focus is the construction industry). These offshore team members allow companies to supplement their local teams with a cost-effective immediate solution.

We also offer an Enterprise SaaS Solution for the Construction Industry. We are in BETA with our item management system; this allows Architects, Designers, Contractors and Supply Showrooms to work together in managing the selection and specification of building materials.




If you are looking to join a fast growing and innovative company, then please apply.

Shift Timing: 3:00 PM to 12:00 AM

Location: Work from home (WFH)

Note: This is a remote position, a strong internet connection is required (company subsidy available) Further details will be provided in the interview.




Job Summary

We are seeking a highly experienced and strategic-minded Senior Human Resource Manager to lead our organization's Human Resource function and drive the development and implementation of a positive and engaging company culture. As a senior leader, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of human resources, payroll, employee development, and fostering a workplace environment that supports our values, mission, and business objectives. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in HR/People functions, with at least 15 years of relevant experience.




Job Responsibilities

· Develop and execute the overall people and culture strategy in alignment with the company's goals and values.

· Lead and manage all aspects of the global human resource's function, including engagement, career development, performance management, employee relations, compensation and benefits, training and development, and HR operations.

· Create and maintain policies, procedures, and systems that ensure compliance with relevant labor laws, regulations, and best practices predominately in USA and India.

· Provide leadership and guidance to the HR team, fostering a positive and inclusive work

environment and promoting professional development.

· Collaborate with senior leadership to identify and address organizational needs related to employee engagement, retention, and growth.

· Develop and implement employee performance management processes, including performance evaluations, goal setting, and career development plans.

· Implement and manage employee compensation and benefits programs to ensure

competitiveness and alignment with industry standards.

· Oversee employee relations, including conflict resolution, disciplinary actions, and

grievance procedures, ensuring fair and consistent treatment of employees.

· Foster a positive and inclusive company culture through the development and

implementation of initiatives, programs, and events that promote employee engagement, teamwork, and recognition.

· Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in the

field of human resources, and proactively recommend and implement improvements

to existing HR policies and practices.



Job Qualifications

· Bachelor's degree in human resources, business administration, or a related field. A master's degree in HR or a relevant discipline is preferred.

· Minimum of 15 years of progressive experience in human resources, with a focus on HR

functions, employee relations, compensation and benefits, performance

management, and HR operations.

· Strong knowledge of employment laws, regulations, and industry best practices in India

and the USA.

· Proven track record of successfully designing and implementing HR strategies and initiatives that support organizational growth and employee engagement.

· Exceptional leadership and management skills, with the ability to inspire and develop a

high-performing HR team.

· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to effectively

collaborate and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

· Demonstrated ability to analyze complex HR issues, think strategically, and provide

innovative solutions.

· Strong business acumen and the ability to align HR strategies with the organization's

overall goals and objectives.

· High level of integrity and professionalism, with the ability to handle sensitive and confidential information.

· Relevant HR certifications (e.g., PHR, SPHR) are a plus.

If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for building exceptional company culture and have the required HR experience, we encourage you to apply for the position of Director of People

and Culture. Join our dynamic team and make a significant impact on our organization's success and the professional growth of our employees.




If you meet the qualifications and are interested in joining our team, please submit your resume. We are an equal-opportunity employer and welcome all qualified candidates to apply.

title: Human Resources Business Partner
description:

title: HR Manager - Regional APAC
description:
Mavenir is building the future of networks and pioneering advanced technology, focusing on the vision of a single, software-based automated network that runs on any cloud. As the industry's only end-to-end, cloud-native network software provider, Mavenir is transforming the way the world connects, accelerating software network transformation for 250+ Communications Service Providers in over 120 countries, which serve more than 50% of the world’s subscribers.

Role Summary

Responsible for advising on employment legislation, and assisting in compliance with both basic and complex employment law. May also be responsible for the implementation of policies covering terms and conditions of employment, employment counseling, employee assistance programs, and other policies.







Key Responsibilities

 * Responsible for all regional HR processes and operations within APAC
 * General HR Management of employee life cycle including employee onboarding to employee offboarding.
 * Be the HR contact for all HR relations and dealing with employee issues.
 * Responsible for, workforce management, escalation, and issue resolution.
 * Responsible for regional Risk & Compliance (for HR Operations) and liaise with local legal and statutory partners.
 * Partner closely with regional leadership (also various levels of employees, managers), Legal and other corporate functional teams for day-to-day activities,
 * Responsible for validating Payroll and related inputs for APAC & India regions.
 * Deliver exceptional experience, efficiency, quality, and timeliness across all HR service areas.
 * Manage frontline HR operations in multiple countries - APAC & India.
 * Collaborate with HR Global Deliver Center (Shared Services) and COE teams to evaluate employee feedback, developing insights that drive continuous improvement programs.
 * Develop and implement a global audit & mitigation program to ensure compliance with local regulatory requirements.




Job Requirements




 * Education - MBA/PGDBM/MSW in HR & any bachelor’s degree
 * 10+ years’ experience working in a combination of the following areas in APAC region: Core HR; HR Risk, Compliance, or labor law; Operations or Customer Service
 * Good communication skills, ability to work as a team player as well as manage a small team and excellent interpersonal skills, strong customer and stakeholder service orientation.
 * Demonstrated ability to deliver complex services, in a high volume, scaled environment, by documented processes and policies.
 * Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with an eye for detail and accuracy; ability to do root cause analysis, use data, or if neither exists, use judgment and experience, to guide decisions and action plans.
 * Significant project management experience related to the implementation of new, complex programs, systems, and/or processes.
 * Strong willingness to take ownership and deliver the results.
 * Passion, energy, and enthusiasm to drive results.




Accessibility

Mavenir is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you require any assistance, please state in your application or contact your recruiter.

Mavenir is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes qualified applicants from around the world, regardless of their ethnicity, gender, religion, nationality, age, disability, or other legally protected status.

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
Job Description: HR Manager




Experience: 5 years+




Job Summary: Hey there! On2Cook is on the hunt for a top-notch Group HR Manager (On2Cook & InventIndia) to hop on board and help us expand our crew of 100 to 300. We need someone with at least 5 years of experience and a knack for helping startups scale up. You should be able to strike that perfect balance between structure, processes and flexibility to match the energy of our teams.




Responsibilities:




Strategic HR Leadership:

 * Collaborate with leadership to align HR strategies with overall business goals.
 * Develop and implement HR policies and procedures that foster a positive and inclusive workplace culture.

Talent Acquisition and Scaling:

 * Lead the recruitment process, playing a crucial role in scaling the company from 100 to 300 employees.
 * Implement innovative and efficient hiring strategies, leveraging technology to streamline the recruitment process.

Employee Relations:

 * Act as a trusted advisor to employees and management, addressing concerns and fostering a positive working environment.
 * Develop and implement employee engagement initiatives to enhance overall job satisfaction.

HR Technology Integration:

 * Evaluate, implement, and optimize HRIS systems and other technology tools to enhance HR processes.
 * Utilize data analytics to provide insights into HR metrics, contributing to informed decision-making.

Learning and Development:

 * Implement training programs to enhance employee skills and development.
 * Facilitate continuous learning initiatives to keep the workforce updated on industry trends and best practices.

Performance Management:

 * Oversee the performance management process, ensuring fair and transparent evaluations.
 * Implement performance improvement plans when necessary and contribute to employee growth and development.

Compliance and Risk Management:

 * Ensure compliance with labor laws and regulations, staying abreast of changes and implementing necessary updates.
 * Mitigate HR-related risks by establishing and enforcing consistent policies and procedures.

Employee Benefits and Wellness Programs:

 * Manage and optimize employee benefits programs, ensuring competitive offerings.
 * Implement wellness initiatives to promote a healthy work-life balance.




Qualifications:

 * Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field; Master’s degree is a plus.
 * Minimum of 5 years of progressive HR experience, with a focus on scaling companies.
 * Technical proficiency and familiarity with HR technology, including HRIS systems.
 * Strong understanding of labor laws, compliance, and risk management.
 * Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
 * Proven ability to build and maintain positive employee relations.
 * Demonstrated success in implementing and managing employee engagement initiatives.
 * Strategic thinker with the ability to align HR practices with business objectives.




Company Profile

On2cook India Pvt Ltd, is a funded Startup, involved in the business of manufacturing Kitchen products, with a distribution plan in 100 countries over the next 3 years. “On2Cook” is an award-winning FASTEST COOKING DEVICE in the world (Patent granted in US & UK) that uses a Revolutionary Combination Cooking Technology: Microwave lid + flame base/ induction base saving up to 70 percent of cooking time and up to 40 percent cumulative energy in preparing healthier food (retaining color, texture, water soluble nutrients etc.)




Some of the Awards & Recognitions:

·      Showcased in CES 2022, Las Vegas and was the most celebrated Invention

·      Created Waves in SHARK TANK INDIA Season 1

·      Silver Winner at IF Award for On2Cook: The World’s Fastest Cooking Device, 2021

·      Diamond Winner at British Invention Show for On2Cook: The World’s Fastest Cooking Device, 2021

·      Silver Award for On2Cook: World’s Fastest Cooking Device at the 14th International Design Awards (IDA), 2020

·      You can watch some of this in the following video (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5DdI3nZpd-M)

If you are passionate about AI, Kitchen Automation & Cooking Space

If you want to have fun while building a Unicorn

If you are a creative mind & want to make a difference

JOIN US!!

title: Assistant Manager Human Resources
description:
Job Number 24004968

Job Category Human Resources

Location Hyderabad Marriott Hotel & Convention Centre, Tank Bund Road, Opposite Hussain Sagar Lake, Hyderabad, Andhra Pradesh, India VIEW ON MAP

Schedule Full-Time

Located Remotely? N

Relocation? N

Position Type Management

Job Summary

Assists in carrying out the daily activities of the Human Resource Office including recruitment, total compensation, and training and development. Additionally, he/she assists in delivering HR services that meet or exceed the needs of employees and enable business success; as well as ensuring compliance with all applicable laws, regulations and operating procedures.

CANDIDATE PROFILE

Education And Experience


 * High school diploma or GED; 2 years experience in the human resources, management operations, or related professional area.
   
   

OR


 * 2-year degree from an accredited university in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related major; no work experience required.
   
   

CORE WORK ACTIVITIES

Assisting in Managing Recruitment and Hiring Process


 * Assists in the interviewing and hiring of Human Resource employee team members with the appropriate skills, as needed.
 * Assists in establishing and maintains contact with external recruitment sources.
 * Attends job fairs and ensures documentation of outreach efforts in accordance with Human Resource Standard Operating Procedures.
 * Networks with local organizations (e.g., Hotel Association and peers) to source candidates for current or future openings.
 * Assists in monitoring candidate identification and selection process.
 * Performs quality control on candidate identification/selection.
   
   

Assisting In Administering And Educating Employee Benefits


 * Works with the unemployment services provider to respond to unemployment claims; reviews provider reports for accuracy and corrects errors.
 * Assists with unemployment claim activity reports.
 * Attends unemployment hearings and ensures property is properly represented, as needed.
   
   

Assisting in Managing Employee Development


 * Assists with departmental orientation program for employees to receive the appropriate new hire training to successfully perform their job.
 * Ensures employees are cross-trained to support successful daily operations.
 * Assists with coordination and facilitation of new hire orientation program to generate a positive first impression for employees and emphasize the importance of guest service in company culture.
 * Ensures attendance by all new hires and participation of the leadership team in training programs
 * Assists with ensuring departmental orientation processes are in place and employees receive the appropriate new hire training to successfully perform their job.
   
   

Assisting in Maintaining Employee Relations


 * Assists in maintaining effective employee communication channels in the property (e.g., develops daily communications and assists with regularly scheduled property-wide meetings).
 * Reviews progressive discipline documentation for accuracy and consistency, and checks for supportive documentation and is accountable for determining appropriate action.
 * Utilizes an “open door” policy to acknowledge employee problems or concerns in a timely manner
 * Ensures employee issues are referred to the Department Manager for resolution or escalated to the Director of Human Resources/Multi-Property Director of Human Resources.
 * Partners with Loss Prevention to conduct employee accident investigations, as necessary.
 * Communicates performance expectations in accordance with job descriptions for each position.
   
   

Assisting in Managing Legal and Compliance Practices


 * Assists with ensuring employee files contain required employment paperwork, proper performance management and compensation documentation, are properly maintained and secured for the required length of time.
 * Assists with ensuring compliance with procedure for accessing, reviewing, and auditing employee files and ensure compliance with the Privacy Act.
 * Assists with ensuring medical records are maintained in a separate, secure and confidential medical file.
 * Facilitates random, reasonable belief and post accident drug testing process (in properties where applicable).
 * Communicates property rules and regulations via the employee handbook.
 * Assists with ensuring all safety and security policies (e.g., property removal, lost and found items, blood borne pathogens, accident reporting, and hygiene) are communicated to employees on a regular basis through orientation, property meetings, bulletin boards, etc.
 * Assists with periodic claims reviews with Regional Claims office to ensure claims are closed in a timely manner and reserve levels are appropriate for open claims.
 * Assists with managing Workers Compensation claims to ensure appropriate employee care and manage costs.
   
   

Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.

Marriott Hotels strive to elevate the art of hospitality, innovating at every opportunity while keeping the comfort of the oh-so-familiar all around the globe. As a host with Marriott Hotels, you will help keep the promise of “Wonderful Hospitality. Always.” by delivering thoughtful, heartfelt, forward-thinking service that upholds and builds upon this living legacy. With the name that’s synonymous with hospitality the world over, we are proud to welcome you to explore a career with Marriott Hotels. In joining Marriott Hotels, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work, begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global team, and become the best version of you.

JW Marriott is part of Marriott International's luxury portfolio and consists of more than 100 beautiful properties in gateway cities and distinctive resort locations around the world. JW believes our associates come first. Because if you’re happy, our guests will be happy. JW Marriott associates are confident, innovative, genuine, intuitive, and carry on the legacy of the brand’s namesake and company founder, J.Willard Marriott. Our hotels offer a work experience unlike any other, where you’ll be part of a community and enjoy true camaraderie with a diverse group of co-workers. JW creates opportunities for training, development, recognition and most importantly, a place where you can pursue your passions in a luxury environment with a focus on holistic well-being. Treating guests exceptionally starts with the way we take care of our associates. That’s The JW Treatment™. In joining JW Marriott, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work, begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global team, and become the best version of you.

title: Senior Manager - HR Process Excellence
description:
About Navi

Navi is one of the fastest growing financial services companies in India providing Personal & Home Loans, Insurance and Mutual Funds with a digital first approach. At Navi, our mission is to build financial services that are simple, accessible and affordable.

Founders: Sachin Bansal & Ankit Agarwal



Know what makes you a “Navi_ite” :




1.Perseverance, Passion and Commitment

 * Passionate about Navi’s mission and vision
 * Demonstrates dedication, perseverance and high ownership
 * Goes above and beyond by taking on additional responsibilities




2.Obsession with high quality results

 * Consistently creates value for the customers and stakeholders through high quality outcomes
 * Ensuring excellence in all aspects of work
 * Efficiently manages time, prioritizes tasks, and achieves higher standards




3.Resilience and Adaptability

 * Adapts quickly to new roles, responsibilities, and changing circumstances, showing resilience and agility




Responsibilities :




 * Develop a strong understanding of people policies, processes, and systems across Navi group entities.
 * Analyse and investigate data to identify gaps in policies and SOP adherence by employees, people managers, and HR team members. Lead efforts to identify and implement corrective and preventive actions.
 * Coordinate with relevant stakeholders to ensure corrective and preventive actions are taken by the relevant teams within the target date.
 * Timely execution of internal HR audits each quarter in line with the annual audit plan.
 * Make representations to the Audit Committee on audit findings and actions taken.
 * Maintain proper workpaper documentation in the audit management tool.
 * Coordinate with external audit firms for outsourced / co-sourced audits to ensure work delivered by them is of high quality.
 * Keep abreast with latest developments, techniques, methods, tools, and procedures that affect Navi’s audit capabilities and effectiveness.







Key Skills Required :




 * Strong analytical skills and good attention to detail. Should be sound logical thinkers and be comfortable with numbers and statistics.
 * Strong communication skills (oral and written). This is a highly collaborative role involving interaction with multiple stakeholders from diverse backgrounds.
 * Experience with leading teams and being a hands-on people manager.
 * Maturity with conflict resolution and having tough conversations.
 * High integrity.
 * Ability to think outside the box and be comfortable dealing with unstructured problem statements.
 * Any previous qualification or experience with audit or fraud related responsibilities is good to have but entirely optional. We are looking for someone who is self motivated and can work from first principles to be effective in this role.
 * Indicative previous experience in any role with similar skills requirement is between 5-8 years.

title: Human Resources Business Partner
description:
About Applied




Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Actively partner, coach & develop managers and begin to develop executive leadership. (e.g., coaching, counseling, career development, disciplinary actions, performance management).

Effectively leverage and partner with COE & HR Ops in the delivery of initiatives to deliver the HR strategy for BU/Function. Balance enterprise-wide and business unit specific needs with local requirements.

Leverage tools and systems e.g.; Workforce Dashboard, Workday to perform analytics in support of business strategy.

As required, participate in M,A&D diligence and integration(s) from the HR perspective. Partner with M,A&D core team and regional HR on projects, programs, processes and initiatives to integrate the acquisition with the BU/Function.

Applied Materials is committed to diversity in its workforce including Equal Employment Opportunity for Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities.

title: Regional HR Manager, Employee Relations
description:
Site Name: Malaysia - Petaling Jaya, Bengaluru Luxor North Tower

Posted Date: Jan 23 2024

As Employee Relations Manager/Professional you will be responsible to lead HR investigations and appropriate IR/ER activities across the cluster through management of end-to-end HR investigations, including appropriate case reporting, decision making and stakeholder management at cluster or country level. Besides, provide employee relations advisory to HR colleagues across the cluster.

This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career. These responsibilities include some of the following:



 * Investigate HR and Employee Relations issues, including, but not limited to:
    * Conducting investigation related interviews
    * Drafting reports and proposing remedial action based on investigation findings
    * Producing complete investigation documentation
    * Analyzing data from various reporting systems to ensure swift progress on cases
    * Management of stakeholders as related to the case ensuring appropriate closure of the matter.

 * Independently manage assigned casework, bringing investigations to closure rapidly and definitively
 * Mediate and resolve internal ER issues using best practice conflict resolution practices
 * Design, collect, and analyze multiple levels of employee and stakeholder feedback
 * Analyze aggregate casework data to identify issue trends and opportunities for proactive issue mitigation for the assigned cases
 * Consult and collaborate with business partners, Corporate ER teams, Compliance and Legal teams on complex employee investigations
 * Manage critical employee relations issues that are crisis-oriented to ensure successfully completion within limited time and SLAs
 * Partner in analysis and revision of people programs, policies, and practices
 * Provide expert advisory service and support to the managers and local teams
 * Ensure consistent implementation of use of ER policies and procedures across the cluster
 * Support development and delivery of education and training for line leaders and HR professionals on policy, employment law, and employee relations matters
   
   

Why you?

Basic Qualifications:

We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:



 * 5+ years’ experience as a Human Resource Manager in a complex multinational environment
 * Robust ER / IR knowledge & experience in an international environment
 * Experience as HR Manager or HR Generalist in a complex environment
 * Background in commercial and manufacturing environment
 * Exposure to work in a multicountry environment, especially in Asia Pacific or EMEA
 * Bachelor’s degree – business, law, human resources or any other relevant function.
   
   
   

Preferred Qualifications:

If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:



 * HR operation experience and project management skills
 * Experience in policy development and implementation
 * Extensive knowledge of employment legislation
 * Knowledge of negotiation of collective agreements
 * Experience managing third party interventions and mechanisms
 * Experience managing legal cases
 * Excellent written and oral communication skills and strong presentation skills
 * Proven ability to effectively use interpersonal skills and influencing techniques with leaders at all levels of the organization
 * Proven ability to identify and understand issues, problems, and opportunities and make recommendations for solutions
   
   
   

Why GSK?

Why Us?

GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose – to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together – so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns – as an organization where people can thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of 2030.

Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it’s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves – feeling welcome, valued and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: HR Manager
description:
About Us:

One third of the UK working age population are unable to access affordable credit. We at Amplifi want to rectify this issue. We aim to improve the nation’s financial health, using our state-of-the-art FinTech ecosystem, allowing ethical lending via credit unions accessible to everyone in the UK.

Amplifi Capital are one of the top 10 lenders in the UK unsecured personal loans market. Through our innovative work we have grown our new customer volumes by 5 folds in just the last two years alone. Aiming to increase that number even further as we progress.

By the end of 2023 we are on course to be the biggest name in the UK credit union market. We at Amplifi Capital want to go beyond that, aiming to be the biggest player in the UK personal loan market for the near prime segment. Standing out against our competitors, being at the forefront of personal loans market.

We don’t just want to stop there, we have an exciting year ahead, with the anticipated launch of the Reevo Money, our credit card product that will be launching later in the year.

People always come first at Amplifi Capital. From how we engage with our customers to the thorough recruitment process. Our journey is just getting started, the business has attracted amazing talent so far, and we don’t plan on stopping yet!

Requirements

Talent Acquisition:


 * Lead the recruitment process, including sourcing, interviewing, and onboarding new employees
 * Collaborate with department heads to understand staffing needs and develop effective hiring strategies
   
   

Employee Relations:


 * Foster a positive and inclusive work environment by addressing employee concerns and promoting a healthy workplace culture
 * Implement and manage employee engagement initiatives to boost morale and teamwork
   
   

HR Policies and Compliance:


 * Develop and enforce HR policies and procedures in compliance with Indian labour laws
 * Stay up to date with legislative changes and ensure company compliance
   
   

Conflict Resolution:


 * Mediate conflicts between employees and provide guidance on resolving disputes
 * Act as a neutral and trusted resource for conflict resolution
   
   

Training and Development:


 * Identify training needs and coordinate employee development programs
   
   

Legal Compliance:


 * Stay informed about Indian labour laws and ensure the company's HR practices comply with them
 * Handle legal and regulatory matters related to employment issues
   
   

Qualifications:


 * Master’s degree in human resources management, Business Administration, or a related field
 * 8+ years of HR management experience, preferably in the Fintech or IT industry
 * In-depth knowledge of Indian labour laws and regulations
 * Strong communication and interpersonal skills
 * Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities
 * Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion
 * Familiarity with HR software and systems
   
   

Benefits

Benefits:


 * Competitive salary
 * 25 days annual leave
 * Gratuity
 * Medical Insurance
 * Sociable and supportive company
 * Hybrid working (1 day from home)

title: Manager - Human Resources
description:
Build something new with a world-class team.

At Genesys, we allow our employees to make their mark by entrusting them to make decisions and do what they’ve been hired to do: their very best. Your potential is waiting; why are you?

Job Description

Location: Chennai

Summary:

The Manager, HR, India provides both strategic and tactical human resources leadership and support that meets the needs of the business. Reporting directly to the Director - HR, India, the individual shall develop HR strategies and implements HR practices in support of organizational advancement. The Manager, HR shares responsibilities to change the organization in ways that enable it to pursue its mission and vision. In partnership with leadership, the Senior Manager, HR is responsible for creating, developing and executing programs that produce clear results in an efficient, effective, creative and committed team.

Key Responsibilities:


 * Provides leadership, direction and counsel to Senior Leaders and managers in all of the disciplines of Human Resources (e.g., recruitment & selection, compensation, organizational development, learning & development, performance management, employee engagement, coaching and employee relations)
 * Leads HR team in the development of content, policies and training in support of HR processes
 * Develops and recommends communication and change strategies to ensure the business is moving in a desired direction
 * Provides a true hands-on approach as well as the ability to successfully monitor the "pulse" of the employees to ensure a high level of employee engagement
 * Shares in the ultimate responsibility for creating a great place to work. Through organization development, continuous improvement, employee engagement and culture initiatives, helps lead the business to long-term excellence
 * Contributes to the development of the overall direction and people strategy
 * Communicates effectively at all levels of the organization with the ability to influence appropriately
 * Develops, implements, and ensures consistent application of HR strategies, guidelines, and programs
 * Identifies business needs and develop plans for resolution
 * Creates and implements internal standards for continual improvement of the efficiency and effectiveness of the HR function
 * Maintains current knowledge and understanding of regulations, industry trends, current practices, new developments and applicable laws regarding human resources and ensures compliance with all Federal and local statutes involving employment
 * Demonstrates honesty, integrity, responsibility and fulfillment of commitments
 * Build and maintain effective working relationships with global HR Team and cross functional relationships within APAC.
 * Ability to travel both domestic and international
 * Special Projects as required. Identified projects include but not limited to:
 * HR portal
 * Employee Handbooks
 * Workday (HRIS system)
 * Orientation / on boarding programs
 * Training / Talent programs
   
   

Requirements / skills preferred:


 * Bachelors/Master’s degree in related field (preferred)
 * 10+ years’ relevant, broad HR experience with 7+ years at a manager level, OR, equivalent combination of education and experience;
 * Demonstrated success in developing and implementing HR strategies
 * Ability to maintain, understand and respect confidentiality and handle sensitive situations with excellent judgment and discretion
 * Ability to provide vision and leadership
 * Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written; strong interpersonal, collaboration and teamwork skills
 * Effective and positive persuasion and influencing skills
 * Strong written and oral communication skills, analytical and reporting skills (HRIS) and attention to detail
 * Ability to handle stress and stay organized, focused, even-tempered and congenial when faced with multiple deadlines
 * Experience within a matrixed environment
 * Demonstrated ability to understand and promote the linkage between business and operational priorities and human resources activities
 * Ability to deal tactfully and confidently with internal and external customers
 * Strong knowledge of India employment laws and regulations
 * Demonstrated usage of change management techniques in a business setting
 * Strong organizational re-design capabilities
 * Strong bias for action and keen sense of urgency

Every year, Genesys orchestrates billions of remarkable customer experiences for organizations in more than 100 countries. By transforming back-office technology to a modern revenue velocity engine Genesys enables true intimacy at scale to foster customer trust and loyalty. Visit www.genesys.com.

 * Ability to work against tight deadlines

title: Human Resources Business Partner
description:
Your role as a Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP) is to nurture, develop, and grow our greatest asset—our people. Using your human resources experience and knowledge of our business (don’t worry—that will come with time), you’ll help guide department leaders with all people-related matters as they navigate challenges and embrace opportunities. You’ll also be responsible for aligning business objectives with employees and leadership. As an HRBP, you will support the implementation of HR programs and processes including talent, performance and compensation, organization design, assessments, and talent planning. You will play a key role in building a work environment where everyone can thrive.




 * Partnering and supporting business unit leaders on talent management planning, including assessing short and long-term resource needs, identifying critical talent gaps within the division, and developing strategies to address the gaps.
 * Facilitating the strategic planning processes for performance improvement and the development of organizational human resources strategies.
 * Providing conflict resolution and guidance with performance management and employee relations issues, liaising with management and legal counsel, as needed, ensuring fairness and consistency.
 * Providing guidance and strategic HR consultation on talent, performance, and change management as well as succession planning, talent reviews, and driving the annual merit planning cycle.
 * Advising, mentoring and guiding all levels of management to develop positive employee engagement capability and leadership skills.
 * Consulting and advising on organization activities including building a trusted partnership with assigned department leaders through consultative and collaborative efforts to ensure the efficient and effective delivery of HR programs and services that support the development of organizational and talent capabilities.




What we’re looking for... You share our belief that people are our most important asset. You know the value of a great manager—and how inspiring and empowering it can be to work for one. You are driven to help managers be better leaders, and you believe in everyone’s potential to grow. You’re a great listener, so people naturally come to you for help and advice. You’ll enjoy partnering with your clients to solve complex problems and, in the process, make us better every day.

You’ll need to have:




 * MBA degree with four or more years of work experience.
 * 5+years of relevant work experience.
 * Experience in Human Resources.
 * Even better if you have one or more of the following:
 * HR role with a start-up, e- commerce, SaaS

title: Copywriter
description:
Who are we?




Simpl is India’s fastest-growing 1-tap checkout network meant to make payments invisible and money-intelligent. Simpl is on a mission to empower merchants to build trusted relationships with customers, one transaction at a time. With over 20,000 available merchants and 25 million-plus users pan-India, Simpl envisions creating a frictionless and inclusive digital payments experience for India that empowers and fosters trust between merchants and their customers.




Simpl is a consumer experience platform providing a full-stack solution for e-commerce conversion. It enables merchants to give customers 1-tap checkout, buyer protection, and a pay-later facility to feel safe and trusted when shopping online. Through Simpl, merchants can provide consumers with an easy, safe, and intuitive user experience.




As a Copywriter at Simpl, you will be responsible for executing the brand’s content strategy and structure in the form of In-app banners, UX copies, E-mails, Push Notifications, SMSs, scripts for reels, social media posts and more. You will be working closely with varied stakeholders within the category function as well as across the company.






What would you be doing?

 * Write copy for assigned projects that is on strategy in a compelling and distinctive style, and synergistic with art/graphic
 * Write data-driven copy for marketing assets such as In-app, web pages, emails, push notifications, SMS and other consumer-facing touchpoints.
 * Work closely with the marketing, design, and product teams to brainstorm ideas, create concepts, and develop impactful messaging.
 * Write original copy and edit content for a range of corporate marketing and communications materials
 * Understand the brand language and drive brand consistency across all company communication
 * Stay abreast of trends and competitors within the editorial sphere




Preferred Qualifications & Skills:

 * Minimum 3-5 years of professional copywriting experience with a strong body of work
 * Should have experience in writing short and long-form copy for marketing
 * Ability to understand data and translate it into creative customer-centric copy
 * Ability to work independently as well as with a team to meet deadlines
 * Excellent organizational skills and multitasking ability
 * Strong attention to detail

title: Copywriter (Mumbai)
description:
About Dentsu International India:




Awarded the Oscars of the advertising world, The Cannes Global Agency of the Year 2022 (a first for India!) Dentsu international comprises of six leadership brands - Carat, dentsu X, iProspect, Isobar, dentsuMB and Merkle, each supported by its specialist divisions and scaled services. With best-in-class services and solutions in Media, Customer Experience Management (CXM), and Creative, dentsu international operates in over 145 markets worldwide with more than 66,000 dedicated talented employees working together to reach the never before!




Part of dentsu International, dentsu India helps some of the biggest & most interesting brands who are our clients everyday to win, keep and grow their best customers and achieve meaningful progress for their businesses. With best-in-class services and solutions in Media, CXM (Customer Experience Management) and Creative, Dentsu India is the 2nd biggest Advertising agency network in India while the dentsu international is the 5th largest in the world.




In good times and bad, we partner with brands to achieve meaningful progress as we are a force for good & for meaningful growth. Our teams of optimists, entrepreneurs and first-movers coalesce around the needs of our clients, unlocking unique possibilities for sustainable value and lasting change.




Learn more at:




https://www.dentsu.com/

https://www.dentsu.com/careers




Role Summary:




Job title: Copywriter (Mumbai)

Location: Worli, Mumbai, India

Experience: 1 to 3 years




Job Description:



Desired Candidate Profile




· The incumbent should have impeccable writing and cutting edge ideation skills and fluent enough to put across his ideas effortlessly.



· Ideate, conceptualize and write various online advertising campaigns for various clients, meeting tight deadlines.



· Co-ordinate with internal departments of the agency ensuring smooth flow of day-to-day jobs.



· Responsible for handling/ assisting the complete communication process within a give deadline.



· Ensure successful implementation/ execution of campaigns





Other Requirements




· Should be an excellent team player.



· Should be proactive with a passion to excel.



· Last but not the least: The incumbent needs to take a Copy test before being considered for the post




To apply, pls apply here as well as send us your updated cv and folio mentioning the below details to Pratiksha.sharma@dentsu.com (so we are able to process your candidature faster):

We thank you for sending us your profile & details for this role. If your profile gets shortlisted for roles with us, we look forward to a conversation with you to learn about more of what makes you awesome!




Dentsu International is growing exponentially as we help our clients make meaningful progress as champions of good change. Come be a part of this amazing journey, together with some of the best minds in the business that call us home.




Follow us on LinkedIn to stay updated: https://www.linkedin.com/company/dentsuintl/




Working with us (Our Culture & Ethos)




Joining dentsu international, you’ll join a team of 66,000 driven, talented & gifted individuals who work in functions across Media, Creative, Customer experience management & Shared Services. Here, they collaborate every day to write inspiring stories of growth & learning, audacious innovation & dreams that they turn into reality..having a lot of fun as they do that! It is a place of incredible spirit, drive & growth!




Inclusion and Diversity




We’re proud to be different and that starts with our people. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone. We won’t define people by their race, gender, sexual-orientation, age or disability. Individuality is what makes us great, we want everyone to bring their full self to work and create something amazing. That’s what we care about.




So, whether you’re joining us, or looking to move to a different part of the business, we work hard to make sure we create equal opportunities for everyone.

title: Content Writer/Executive Administration H&S
description:
At Arcadis we focus on attracting, retaining and developing people who share our passion and commitment to improve quality of life. In return we offer you the opportunity to transform your world and the world around you, that could be through client work, upskilling yourself, championing equality and inclusion or getting involved in charity work, to name just a few. Our people value different perspectives, they care about the sustainability of our planet and dare to shape the future.

One of our core values is ‘people first’, and supported by our Lovinklaan foundation, we invest in you for the long term, to ensure you reach your full potential. You’ll have the opportunity to own your career and work on industry-defining projects, finding solutions to real challenges that make a difference to people’s lives. You’re encouraged to have a growth mindset and are given the space to develop personally and professionally, building a flexible career that works for you.




We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Admin support executive and content writer with experience to provide comprehensive support to our executive team while ensuring the well-being and safety of our workplace. This role requires a proactive individual with excellent communication skills and strong administrative abilities.



Responsibilities:



1. Admin support

 * Provide high-level administrative support to executives, including calendar management, travel arrangements, and correspondence.
 * Maintaining expense reports, raising POs for project related costs
 * Production and formatting of documentation / reports / bids / Newsletters / internal documents and presentations as needed.
 * Respond to and resolve enquiries and problems, judging when to pass complex queries on to or involve others
 * Liaise with and build strong working relationships with colleagues across the wider business
 * Adhoc Tasks as and when assigned

2.Supporting the H&S team in Australia

 * Build effective relationships with senior leaders and project managers.
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to define, track, and finalize actions and improvement initiatives.
 * Document and distribute communications via digital forums.
 * Proactively schedule and track training and wellbeing events.
 * Develop communications, presentations, and documentation for the function.
 * Facilitate WHS Committee meetings, including coordination, minutes, and liaison with committee members.
 * Enhance and update WHS systems and SharePoint for accurate reflection of Risk control standards.




Qualifications:

 * Content writing experience will be preferred.
 * Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
 * Knowledge of ISO 9001 quality systems standard is preferred
 * Highly proficient in all Microsoft programs including MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook and Adobe Acrobat
 * Strong analytical and communication skills.







Why Become an Arcadian?

Our work with clients has a direct impact on people’s lives and on the planet. We make moving, living and belonging in cities safer, more resilient and more sustainable. By partnering with our clients as responsible custodians of our earth's resources, we can create a sustainable planet.

We continue to think of new ways to make positive impacts and create better experiences for people; data driven and digital solutions have become part of the Arcadis DNA. Working together with clients and using techniques like design thinking, we can get to the heart of our clients’ most pressing challenges and work together to solve them.

As a global business, we have committed to support five of the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals to ensure that our projects contribute to a better and more sustainable future for all. But it’s not just the work that we do on client projects that benefits communities and our planet. As a global business, we are committed to making a positive impact to society by supporting local communities where we operate.

To help protect our planet, we monitor and measure non-financial information to inform business decisions and reduce our own environmental impact as part of our commitment to be net zero carbon as a global company by 2030.

Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging

We want you to be able to bring your best self to work every day, which is why we take equality and inclusion seriously and hold ourselves to account for our actions. Our ambition is to be an employer of choice and provide a great place to work for all our people. At Arcadis, you will have the opportunity to build the career that is right for you. Because each Arcadian has their own motivations, their own career goals. And, as a ‘people ﬁrst’ business, it is why we will take the time to listen, to understand what you want from your time here, and provide the support you need to achieve your ambitions.

Transform Your World
sector: Construction, Civil Engineering, and Design Services

title: Content Strategist
description:
Position Overview:

As a Content Strategist and UX Writer, you are responsible for creating the content strategy, the content design and writing the UX copy for various mediums such as: digital platforms or mobile apps, websites, conversational interfaces like chat assistants, and email campaigns and notifications. You will help establish a unified user experience by designing content that is engaging and efficient, across these mediums. A Content Strategist and UX Writer is expected to have a very good command on the English vocabulary.



Locations

India – Bangalore (preferred), Hyderabad



About the job:

 * Collaborate with designers, business teams, and development teams across the lifecycle of evolving the concept for a user experience project, creating its content strategy, testing the prototype or end-product.
 * Create the content strategy for a user experience project, define content goals, and also create the content copy.
 * Drive the tone of voice for the user experience/product language.
 * Write user interface text that facilitates user navigation, as well onboarding, promotional content such as email campaigns, error messages, and other components of the end-to-end user experience.
 * Participate in user research and user testing, gather insights that inform the content strategy.
 * Create guidelines and style guides for content creators.
 * Create content marketing copy for promotional campaigns, end-user adoption, and change management initiatives within Infosys.
 * Experience with working with CMSes such as Drupal, SharePoint etc. is an added benefit.
 * Experience with chatbots, virtual assistants and AI-driven apps is an added benefit as well.



Requirements:



 * Min 5 years of relevant writing experience for digital and mobile interfaces and websites
 * Excellent command on English vocabulary and the nuances of voice and tone
 * Analytical skills with an ability for problem finding and root cause analysis.
 * Demonstrated ability to apply design thinking.
 * Ability to collaborate and influence (with and without formal authority) business stakeholders, designers and development teams.
 * Focus on collaborating to achieve outcomes.
 * Ability to plan and manage projects with minimal guidance and thrive in ambiguity.
 * Excellent critical thinking, presentation and communication skills



Education:

Min Bachelor’ s Degree in Communications, Journalism, Technical Writing, UX, HCI, or equivalent practical experience. (full time education only)

title: Staff Copywriter
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

Job Title: Copy Writer

Position Summary: As a Copywriter with exper.se in life sciences, you will play a crucial role in developing compelling and scientifically accurate content that communicates complex concepts in a clear and engaging manner for our clients. Working closely with our client’s marke.ng and medical teams, you will create content for a variety of digital platforms to effectively convey the value and impact of their products and services for various campaigns and across various channels.

Responsibilities:


 * Content Creation:
    * Develop clear and concise copy for a range of marke.ng materials across digitalchannels, including IVAs, websites, banners, emails, and social media platforms.
    * Translate technical and scientific information into accessible and compelling content for a diverse audience.
      
      

 * Collaboration:
    * Work closely with the marke.ng team, medical team, and subject matter experts to gather information and ensure accuracy in messaging.
    * Collaborate with designers to integrate copy and visuals seamlessly for impactful communication.
      
      

 * Brand Voice and Consistency:
    * Maintain and uphold the company's brand voice, ensuring consistency across all communication channels.
      
      

 * Editing and Proofreading:
    * Edit and proofread content to ensure accuracy, grammar, and adherence to style guidelines.
    * Collaborate with team members to review and improve each other's work.
      
      

 * Compliance:
    * Ensure that all copy complies with relevant industry regulations and standards, including those related to life sciences promotional marke.ng.
      

Qualifications:


 * Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Life Sciences, Biology, Biochemistry, Biotechnology, or related discipline).
 * Proven experience of 1-3 yrs as a copywriter, preferably within the life sciences or healthcare industry.
 * Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
 * Strong attention to detail and the ability to distill complex information into clear, engaging content.
 * Familiarity with industry regulations and guidelines governing life sciences marke.ng.
 * Proficiency in using content creation tools and platforms.
   
   

Preferred Skills:


 * Understanding of SEO principles and best practices.
 * Ability to work in a collabora.ve team environment.
 * Familiarity with design or content authoring software.
 * Strong time management skills and ability to meet deadlines.
   
   

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Copy Editor
description:

Designation : Copy Editor

Location : Andheri (e), Mumbai

Editing copy to make it publish-worthy, an eye for error, adherence to style guides, fact-checking, a nose for trends and basic social media skills and of course the ability to meet deadlines is what we require.

Know Wordpress? You’ve got the inner track!

Our excellent benefits include everything from great medical and life insurance to catered meals. We have flexible work hours and flexible holidays, which means that teams pick their own work hours. Media.Net has its own concierge desk that doubles up as a travel agency. We are passionate about building the next generation of web products, and we believe that happy employees are the key to achieving this goal. If you like the idea of working in an exciting workspace on cutting-edge internet products that make a truly global impact (and wearing flip-flops to work), then we want to get to know you!
