title: Editor – News, Cleantech Publications
description:
Mercom India is a clean energy communications and research firm in India. We are a subsidiary of US-based Mercom Capital Group, a leading clean energy communication and consulting firm recognized worldwide for its expertise in renewable energy.

 

MercomIndia.com is a news portal covering clean energy news and activity in India.

 

Established in Bangalore, Mercom India has provided communications services nationwide for clean energy organizations since early 2009.






Responsibilities

Mercom India is looking for News editors with experience in news publications (digital and print) to join its growing team. Our publications need an editor to help us ensure that content is clear, accurate, and ready for publication, completing tasks such as writing articles, fact-checking, writing headlines, editing for grammar and spelling, and following a style guide.

 

We are looking for an Editor who wants to be part of a dynamic online and print news organization focused on renewable and clean technologies in India and who is excited to be part of the solution and change in India's energy and environmental future.

 

The ideal candidate will have experience in India's energy and business sector and will be able to analyze data, news, and trends required to develop original content. The candidate will ensure that articles, reports, and other materials are free of errors, easy to read, and conform to the publication's style. The candidate must have a passion for writing, a sharp eye for detail, and the ability to work well under deadline pressure. The candidate can translate technical, policy, and complex ideas into clear text. The editor should be able to multitask and collaborate with the research team. The editor is expected to supervise the reporters and develop contacts in the industry to source stories and quotes.

 

The ideal candidate will have at least 2-3 years of editing experience and is excited to be part of the new and dynamic sector that is India's renewable energy growth story. The candidate will be responsible for:

        ·        Assigning and editing stories based on the interest of Mercom India's research, market intelligence, and online audience

        ·        Manage Mercom India's homepage

        ·        Oversee breaking news coverage

        ·        Use web analytics to monitor reader engagement

        ·        Ensure best practices for web publishing per Mercom guidelines when working with reporters

        ·        Manage the editing process according to the Mercom India style guide.

        ·        Write headlines and subheads for articles and print publication, and create page layouts consisting of article placement, photographs, and advertisements.

        ·        Experience working in an online news environment

        ·        Superior editorial judgment

        ·        Ability to line-edit stories and develop story ideas with reporters

        ·        Skilled in publishing stories that are impactful and compelling online

        ·        Proven ability to write web-friendly headlines

        ·        Ability to leverage multimedia content to enhance stories and user experience, clarifying details with reporters when necessary.

        ·        Writing or adjusting headlines for each article or writing

introductory paragraphs to ensure stories are written in Mercom's style and requirements

        ·        Editors are also expected to write complete news articles during downtime.

        ·        Must have experience using social media to find and promote stories

        ·        Familiarity with content management systems, photo editing

Software and web analytics tools preferred

        ·        Excellent written English, including good spelling and grammar

        ·        Must have an eye for detail and be very accurate in following writing guidelines

        ·        Be able to make decisions, work under pressure, meet deadlines, and have the ability to maintain a high quality of work while meeting tight deadlines

        ·        Be prepared to work long hours as required.

        ·        The candidate should have an eagerness to learn and adapt to new situations and different environments

        ·        Must be able to travel occasionally anywhere in India

        ·        Must be strong in ethical values and social conduct

        ·        Must be an excellent fact checker and should have the ability to verify all the news items from various sources

        ·        Must be proactive and able to work independently

        ·        Must be organized, able to meet deadlines and juggle various tasks while at the same time maintaining a high level of attention to detail and sustaining overall quality

        ·        Must be creative, flexible, and willing to do what it takes to deliver a finished product

        ·        Salary is commensurate with experience. Please submit resume

        ·         This position is based in Bangalore



Qualifications

A bachelor's degree or equivalent experience

Propelled by a substantial 4-million-dollar pre-seed investment from top venture capitalists in Korea, Redrob emerges as McKinley Rice's latest venture, marking a new chapter in our expansion. Proudly introducing Redrob—a groundbreaking AI platform—we're set to redefine professional development.

Going beyond traditional academic measures, Redrob embodies our commitment to nurturing talents and bridging the gap between industry demands and professionals' aspirations. Fueled by our funded growth, we're poised to revolutionize recruitment and assessments, ensuring candidates are not just academically proficient but also industry-ready.

Redrob is the cornerstone of our vision to catalyze the formation of A-grade teams for organizations. Through seamless recruitment processes, we aim to be the indispensable right hand, facilitating the creation of high-caliber teams that surpass industry standards.




Know BluOne (https://bluone.in/)




BluOne is a multinational ecosystem of conscious businesses across healthcare, publishing, research, design, technology, marketing, and talent management. We believe in excellence and exist to help create a positive impact in the world. Every person in our team is an integral part of our system and our vision. We like people to grow with us, and we go the extra mile to provide our teams with an experiential learning, a delightful experience, and all other means necessary for them to grow not just as professionals but as human beings.



They’re a team of ex-Google New York, Zomato, OYO who've worked at high-impact, growth companies and believe that we're on the journey of building one. Backed by investors like Blume Ventures, Sequoia Surge, Beenext, and Rainmatter.




How to become a part of BluOne and enjoy the benefits:

❖ Step 1: Fill in the application form and register via RedRob.

❖ Step 2: Clear the interview process.

❖ Step 3: Be a part of the team BluOne!







EXPERIENCE







Duties you'll be entrusted with:




 * Conduct research on industry-related and US healthcare topics that would best fit marketing requirements and compile researched information, data, and statistics in reports, documents, and case studies.
 * Analyze content marketing metrics to suggest improvisations and help identify topics, techniques, and channels around healthcare that provide the best return on efforts and investments.

Writing, Editing, and Proofreading

 * Be a compelling Story Teller.
 * Deep-dive, learn, comprehend, analyze, write, edit, and proofread about a broad range of healthcare domains for online/offline Marketing Campaigns.
 * Write headlines, copy, and content for digital media and marketing like social media content, product descriptions, blog posts, newsletters, websites, emailers, etc.




Expectations from you:







 * Are have 2+ years of proven working experience as a content writer. ● Have impressive writing skills and experience adapting styles with context. ● Have the ability to communicate and collaborate effectively.
 * Have an understanding of digital marketing tactics, including SEO, email marketing, and web analytics.
 * Have an eye for detail, critical thinking abilities, and a good sense of what makes an interesting angle to a story.
 * Are able to share knowledge and merge ideas with co-writers/editors and other team members.
 * Are able to manage multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment.
 * Have strong empathy for all stakeholders.
 * Are able and interested in being part of a team dedicated to delivering quality work. ● Have a green outlook and care about the environment.
 * Are good at rapidly iterating and producing variations.
 * Are responsible entrepreneurs in their pursuit.
 * Are responsible entrepreneurs in their pursuit.
 * Results-oriented mindset and a commitment to driving revenue growth.
 * Willingness to travel as required.










THRIVE







Why you’ll love Procol:




 * Work on one of the fastest-growing start-ups with the potential to influence an enormous market and positively impact millions of people
 * Collaborate with dynamic and passionate peers across the company, who will challenge and stimulate you every day
 * Build and earn ownership of a key part of our business while working directly with the company's leadership team
 * Learn and grow fast with a growing startup which impacts millions of businesses
 * Work closely with the founding team and become a part of building a successful company
 * Industry competitive salary and benefits
 * Get advance salaries every month
 * Employee health insurance covered by us
 * Flexible working hours

title: Copy Writer
description:
676561BR

Introduction

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities

The Blue Studio is IBM’s internal creative team, responsible for the strategic evolution and expression of the IBM brand across every experience and encounter, internally and externally. The Blue Studio is part of IBM's Marketing function and supports all of IBM, horizontally, across all businesses, and vertically, from the top of the funnel to the bottom. The work crosses nearly every category of output: research and strategy, communications and content development, symbology and systems, digital and physical experiences, and tools and training. Our goal is to maintain modernity, sophistication, and tangibility, and to promote understanding of the IBM brand in the world.

Role

In the Blue Studio, your words matter. Here, you’ll become part of a creative, collaborative team, partnering with world-class strategists, designers, producers and creative directors to tell compelling stories about the technologies changing our world and the people who put them to work. Your primary responsibilities will be to:



 * Distill complex concepts into sharp headlines that capture attention and drive engagement
 * Craft scripted dialogue and voiceover that can inspire, elevate and explain
 * Dive deeper into topics with additional surround materials, including digital ads, blogs, emails, video scripts, white papers and more
 * Act as storyteller and steward of the brand, infusing IBM’s brand voice, style, and messaging into every deliverable
   
   
   

BLRMCC_23,#ISAICHQMCC24QMCC24

IBMDCB

MCCJBID

Required Technical and Professional Expertise



 * 4+ years marketing or advertising writing (agency or in-house)
 * Superior English language writing skills with a keen eye for detail (diction, syntax and grammar)
 * Portfolio of work demonstrating success in primary responsibilities for the role
 * History of pitching ideas and presenting work to creative directors, partners and stakeholders
 * Comfortable with technology and IT wordage
   
   
   

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise



 * Degree in English, creative writing, advertising, journalism or related area of study
 * Advertising or marketing agency experience
 * History of work with international clients
 * Professional social/broadcast media content
 * Collaboration with diverse, distributed teams through tools such as Box, Figma, Mural etc.
   
   
   

About Business Unit

IBM Corporate Headquarters (CHQ) team represents a variety of functions such as marketing, finance, legal, operations, HR, and more, all working together to solve some of the world's most complex problems, help our clients achieve success and build collaborative work environments for IBMers.

This job requires you to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated prior to your start date and proof of vaccination status will be required before your start date. During the Onboarding process you will be asked to confirm your vaccination status, in case you are unable to get vaccinated for any reason, you can let us know at that stage. Please let us know if you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons. IBM will consider such requests on a case by case basis subject to submission of required proof by the candidate before a stipulated date.

Your Life @ IBM

In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.

Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.

Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.

Are you ready to be an IBMer?

About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement

When applying to jobs of your interest, we recommend that you do so for those that match your experience and expertise. Our recruiters advise that you apply to not more than 3 roles in a year for the best candidate experience.

For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

Being You @ IBM

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, caste, genetics, pregnancy, disability, neurodivergence, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Copywriter
description:
Company Description


Creativefuel is a digital marketing agency based in Indore, India, specializing in meme marketing. With a base of over 350M followers on Instagram and 200M followers on Facebook, we have campaigned for major brands such as Priya Gold, MamaEarth, Vision 11, and movies like RRR, Gangubai, Doctor Strange, etc. Our team of social media experts and diverse influencers fuels our influencer marketing wing. We are dedicated to empowering memes with excellent marketing content to make our clients go viral.


Role Description


This is a full-time on-site role for a Copywriter. The Copywriter will be responsible for creating and editing press releases, communication with clients, writing marketing copy, proofreading, and collaborating with the marketing team.


Qualifications

 * Excellent writing skills and attention to detail
 * Experience in creating press releases and marketing copy
 * Proofreading expertise for grammar, punctuation, and spelling
 * Familiarity with digital marketing practices and social media platforms
 * Strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with the marketing team and clients
 * Bachelor's degree in English, Journalism, Communications, Marketing, or related field
 * Previous experience in meme marketing or influencer marketing is a plus
 * Creative mindset and ability to think outside the box

title: Engineer / Senior Engineer - Mechanical
description:
Job Summary

If you are looking for an opportunity in the Mechanical Engineering space then Emerson has a great opportunity for you! Based in India, the Senior Mechanical Engineer will be in-charge of reviewing customer specifications and engineering design.




In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:

 * Review of Customer specifications / inputs and identify scope
 * Follow the departmental and PMO processes
 * Generate project documents and drawings
 * Engineering design, freeze of project basic design (Finalize P&ID, Mechanical equipment, General Arrangement Drawing and bills of materials)
 * Perform Piping & Structural analysis and liaise with Mechanical Designer / Mechanical Engineer for design changes.
 * Customer engagement which includes customer KOM, Customer Queries, resolving deviation to specifications
 * Ensure quality of the project documentation
 * Prepare enquiry Datasheet / Material Requisition (MR) for Long Lead Mechanical items
 * Sub vendor offer review and sub Vendor drawings / documents review
 * Sub vendor handling (follow up, design review meetings, partner concerns)
 * Responsible for maintaining Quality records
 * Monitor mechanical work progress on project
 * Perform Pre-FAT and FAT with Customer
 * As Build Documentation and handover to services
 * Perform Pressure Drop / Head Loss Calculation, Pipe Wall Thickness Calculation, Lifting Lug Calculation, etc.
 * Provide Engineering technical support to E&I, Quality, Purchasing and Project Manager
 * Report project status updates, variations in scope to the Project Manager
 * Participate in internal and external audits and Kick Off meeting when required.




Who You Are:

You move beyond traditional ways of doing things. You are an active learner who uses both success and failure as learning opportunities. You deliver messages in a clear, compelling, and concise manner.




For This Role, You Will Need:

 * Good knowledge of Oil & Gas Industry equipment, Instruments, Piping and structural work
 * Good knowledge in application of various types of meters for Gas & Liquids Measurement, good working knowledge of ASME, ANSI, API, API MPMS, ISO & other industry standards related to Oil and Gas measurement services
 * Familiar with Piping & Structural Welding and Non-destructive testing
 * Good experience of Meter and Prover Sizing
 * Ability to do stress analysis using CAESER-II / STAAD or equivalent packages
 * Excellent analytical skills and results-oriented
 * Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)
 * Excellent drawing skills in AutoCAD / MicroStation
 * Proficient with Microsoft Office
 * Decisive, drive and ability to deliver effective and innovative solutions




Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:




B.E / B. Tech in Mechanical Engineering with 5 - 8 years of proven experience.




Our Offer To You:

By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do.




Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets. We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees.




We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion. We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship.

We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential. We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company.




We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office.




Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities.




Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.




Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion




At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.




This philosophy is fundamental to living our companys values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson.

If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com.

title: Product Quality Engineer
description:
Minimum qualifications:


 * Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Electrical or Industrial Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
 * 5 years of experience in cross-functional management developing consumer electronics.
 * Experience in product quality control systems, quality compliance matrix, quality governance, quality statistical methods, or cosmetic criteria.
   
   

Preferred qualifications:


 * Knowledge of statistical quality control such as Six Sigma.
 * Knowledge of consumer hardware development and manufacturing processes, vendor relations, and working with Contract Manufacturers.
 * Understanding of technology at the system and commodity level as well as software and usability.
 * Familiarity with statistical analysis tools such as JMP, Minitab, and R language.
   
   

About The Job

Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

With your technical expertise, you lead projects in multiple areas of expertise (i.e., engineering domains or systems) within a data center facility, including construction and equipment installation/troubleshooting/debugging with vendors.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. We aim to make people's lives better through technology.

Responsibilities


 * Oversee on site supplier’s for daily quality process and quality system including incoming material management, production quality control, and quality continuous improvement actions.
 * Manage factory quality issue escalation, Failure Analysis issues, Root Cause and Corrective Action from First Article Inspection/Outgoing Quality Control/On-Going Reliability, Yield fallouts, Customer Complaints and Field failures during NPI/Mass Production Phases.
 * Coordinate with on site operation team members and Shenzhen suppliers to resolve emergency issues locally in a timely manner.
 * Define/implement Phone Product Cosmetic Specifications and design FATP Quality Cosmetic Station Inspection Plans, ensuring the specifications are met.
 * Drive Design of Experiment, collect Statistical Process Control data to enable evaluation/qualification/verification of cost effectiveness, meeting overall manufacturing quality goals with cross-functional teams.
   
   
   

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

description:

title: Mechanical Design Engineer
description:
Valeo est une entreprise mondiale de haute technologie qui conçoit des solutions révolutionnaires pour réinventer la mobilité. Nous sommes un équipementier partenaire des constructeurs automobiles et des acteurs de la nouvelle mobilité dans le monde entier. Notre vision ? Inventer une mobilité plus verte et plus sûre, grâce à des solutions axées sur la conduite intuitive et la réduction des émissions de CO2. Nous sommes leaders dans nos domaines d'activité et reconnus comme l'une des plus grandes entreprises innovantes au monde.


 * Analyze specifications in order to define performance criterions to be achieved.
 * Develop innovative and reliable solutions that fulfill specifications.
 * Participate to the Design Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (DFMEA).
 * Design 3D model and prepare definition files for products, prototypes and test means.
 * Leads design activities with internal and external contributors.
 * Share technical topics with prototype workshop and suppliers.
 * Prepare technical file to justify choice of concept and solutions.
 * Build 2D drawing with functional dimensions according to ISO standard.
 * Build tolerance stack-up and optimize dimensioning.
 * Define and identify functional and critical characteristics.
 * Support project planning edition and update.
 * Present product definition status at Design Review and Project Validation Committee.
 * Apply CAD methodologies and deliver CAD data that pass Q-Checker.
 * Manage Product definition file into the PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) database.

Civil Engineering is must with 3+ years of experience

title: Mechanical Engineer (Canada Loc) $500,000/year USD
description:
Job Title: Mechanical Engineer

Position Overview

Are you a talented Mechanical Engineer seeking an exciting career opportunity in Canada? Visa Answer is actively searching for an exceptional individual to join our esteemed overseas client's team in Canada. This position offers a highly competitive compensation package, with an annual salary of $500,000 USD, making it a truly exceptional opportunity for professionals looking to achieve significant financial growth and career advancement.

Job Description

As a Mechanical Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in our client's organization in Canada. You will be responsible for contributing to the design, development, and implementation of innovative mechanical systems, ensuring they meet the highest industry standards and performance requirements. This is a unique opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and make a substantial impact on the field of mechanical engineering.

Key Responsibilities

Design and Development: Collaborate with a team of engineers to design, analyze, and develop mechanical systems and components for various projects.

Engineering Analysis: Conduct thorough engineering analysis and simulations to evaluate the structural integrity, performance, and safety of mechanical systems.

Project Management: Manage project timelines, budgets, and resources effectively to ensure successful completion of assignments.

Research and Innovation: Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies to integrate innovative solutions into projects.

Quality Assurance: Implement and maintain quality control measures to guarantee the reliability and performance of mechanical systems.

Documentation: Prepare and maintain comprehensive engineering documentation, including reports, schematics, and technical drawings.

Compliance: Ensure compliance with all relevant industry codes, standards, and regulations in Canada.

Collaboration: Work closely with interdisciplinary teams, including electrical engineers, designers, and project managers, to achieve project goals.

Problem Solving: Analyze and troubleshoot complex engineering issues, proposing effective solutions.

Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.

Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) designation is highly preferred.

Proven experience in mechanical design, analysis, and project management.

Proficiency in CAD software and other engineering tools.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

Knowledge of local building codes, regulations, and safety standards in Canada.

Innovative mindset with a passion for continuous improvement.

Benefits

Competitive annual salary of $500,000 USD.

Opportunity for career advancement and professional development.

Comprehensive health and dental benefits.

Relocation assistance, if required.

An exciting work environment with access to cutting-edge technology.

A chance to make a significant impact on the field of mechanical engineering.

How To Apply

If you are ready to take your career to new heights and are excited about the prospect of working in Canada on groundbreaking projects, we encourage you to apply today. Please submit your resume, a cover letter detailing your relevant experience, and any additional relevant documentation to [email address].

Visa Answer is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals, including those with diverse backgrounds and experiences.

Note: The mentioned salary is for illustrative purposes and may not reflect current market conditions or visa requirements for foreign nationals working in Canada. Please refer to current labor laws and regulations for accurate details.

title: Supplier Quality Assurance Engineer, India
description:
Job Description

[Quality Assurance and Control]

1.Responsible for overseeing all QA/QC activities in the factory.

2.Ensuring thorough verification of engineering changes, cut-in status, and effectiveness.

3.Conducting regular and random audits for quality system & process and implementing follow-up improvements.




[Collaboration and Coordination]

1.Collaborating with the team to address requirements such as PVT, production improvements, etc.

2.Working alongside suppliers & teams for field issue analysis and tracking improvement plans in the factory.

3.Scheduling weekly or monthly quality review meetings with the factory & teams.

4.Provide technical support to internal and external users, develop technical documents such as technical bulletins, troubleshooting guides, and FAQs.




[Performance Monitoring and Intelligence Gathering]

1.Reviewing the factory yield rate weekly and following up on the top 3 issues.

2.Collecting competitive intelligence information for reference.




Job Requirement

1. A Bachelor's degree or higher in EE, IE, or ME, with at least 3 years of experience in the IFP industry, preferably including monitor or projector experience.

2. Self-starting professional adept at independent work, with strong analytical skills, troubleshooting abilities, a solution-driven mindset, and a readiness for business travel.

3. Applies statistical quality tools to aid supplier improvements and possesses familiarity with ISO9001/14001 audits.

4. Strong cross-functional communication skills with suppliers and colleagues, demonstrating high EQ.

5. Experience with FAE or technical support is a plus.

title: Automobile Engineer
description:
Company Description

LMDmax Corp is a leading provider of comprehensive last-mile delivery solutions, empowering businesses by supporting and enhancing last mile operations. Headquartered in New Jersey, LMDmax offers 360º Solutions to Last Mile Delivery companies. We empower businesses through end-to-end HR solutions for recruitment & payroll, utilizing advanced technology platforms to track, analyze, and improve Last Mile Operators' performance and fleet operations.




Role Description

This is a full-time, on-site role for an Automobile Engineer located in Jaipur seeking a dynamic Entry-Level Automobile Engineer to contribute to the maintenance and efficiency of our fleet of vehicle.




Key Responsibilities:

 1. Conduct regular vehicle inspections and maintenance checks.
 2. Diagnose and address mechanical and electrical issues promptly.
 3. Collaborate with the logistics team for optimal vehicle operation.
 4. Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities and repairs.
 5. Ensure compliance with safety and environmental regulations.




Qualifications:

 1. Bachelor's degree in automobile Engineer or related field.
 2. Previous internship or experience in automotive engineering.
 3. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

title: Manufacturing engineer
description:

Welding.

Process control plans on regular basis based on new projects.

Members.

Of AS9100 and NADCAP.

 * Trouble shooting of process issues internally and for external source.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
Valeo is a tech global company, designing breakthrough solutions to reinvent the mobility. We are an automotive supplier partner to automakers and new mobility actors worldwide. Our vision? Invent a greener and more secured mobility, thanks to solutions focusing on intuitive driving and reducing CO2 emissions. We are leader on our businesses, and recognized as one of the largest global innovative companies.

Mission

 Define, develop and deploy Mechanical design and Field of Vision Simulation for DVS PL.

 Interaction with other divisions or units worldwide and establish a strong and intimate relationship with Valeo Site

Design leaders

 Strong interpersonal competence and acting good team player

 Guarantee the respect of best practice and standards, establish and capitalize new standards when applicable

Responsibilities

 Involvement on P0, P1 and P2 projects (Current engineering, new customer projects and future projects).

 Experience in developing products from concept to production in an automotive environment.

 Problem solving techniques and methodical approaches to same.

 Operating within a high volume manufacturing environment.

 Designing to budget.

 Developing project plans and working within agreed plans and timelines.

 Tooling and moulding experience - ability to identify and suggest part improvements.

 Experience in developing 2D drawings & designing using 3D CAD - Catia V5 R24 onwards, preferred.

 Vehicle Packaging investigations and concept evaluation.

 Tolerance Investigations And Stack Up Analysis Experience Required.

 Detailed Drawings and Drawing Control inc. GD+T.

 Interfacing across a multidisciplinary environment in a clear and effective manner must be demonstrated.

 Experience interfacing with Suppliers and customers.

Preferred Exposure to and experience with:

 Vehicle/Product verification organising, analysis and report writing.

 Broad experience in injection moulding, metal casting, metal forming, adhesives and prototype-manufacturing methods

is a necessity.

 DFMEA techniques, DFM/DFA techniques, PDCA (Plan, Do, Check, Act) type techniques.

 Design Review Procedures,BOM Creation, Presentations.

 Working within quality systems i.e. ISO9001 / TS16949.

 Experienced in MS Project, MS Excel, MS Word, Minitab and MS Power Point.

 Interpretation of the results from Simulation Reports and feeding back on the same.

 Experience in Six Sigma an advantage.

 Experience in passive and active cooling an advantage.

 Qualifications - External

 Relevant Mechanical Engineering Qualifications (Degree).

 Recent relevant experience in Design 3 years +.

 Knowledge of developing automotive cameras and or ECU’s a distinct advantage.

 A high degree of organisation and enthusiasm and the ability to communicate competently across all working levels;

Management activities, interaction with OEM Customers, suppliers, other Departments and branches within the

company.

 Demonstrate innovation and creativity.

 Mindset of continuous improvement and resilience.

People Management: YES  NO 

If People Management, how many employees are

managed?

Number of people :

Budget Management: YES  NO 

Candidate Profile

Education/Training

 BE in Mechanical/ Automobile Engineering from a reputed institute or

university

 Excellent Background in Mechanical Component Design & Development process in Automotive industry or similar

background experience

Professional Experience

 Candidate must have 3- 4 years of significant professional experience in Automotive R&D, Product development

 Verbal and Written skills in German language for Technical communication is desirable but not essential.

 Good knowledge on Fastener selection, Casting/ Injection molding process and GD&T

 Strong exposure in engineering of product integrating mechanical/PCB interface, plastic and Sheet metal components

 Ability to handle multiple projects.

 Experience in automotive industry very much appreciated.

 Knowledge and working skills in Optics/ Optical Lens Design is an added advantage.

title: Mechanical Engineer (Canada) : $500,000/year USD
description:
Job Title: Mechanical Engineer

Position Overview

Are you a talented Mechanical Engineer seeking an exciting career opportunity in Canada? Visa Answer is actively searching for an exceptional individual to join our esteemed overseas client's team in Canada. This position offers a highly competitive compensation package, with an annual salary of $500,000 USD, making it a truly exceptional opportunity for professionals looking to achieve significant financial growth and career advancement.

Job Description

As a Mechanical Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in our client's organization in Canada. You will be responsible for contributing to the design, development, and implementation of innovative mechanical systems, ensuring they meet the highest industry standards and performance requirements. This is a unique opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and make a substantial impact on the field of mechanical engineering.

Key Responsibilities

Design and Development: Collaborate with a team of engineers to design, analyze, and develop mechanical systems and components for various projects.

Engineering Analysis: Conduct thorough engineering analysis and simulations to evaluate the structural integrity, performance, and safety of mechanical systems.

Project Management: Manage project timelines, budgets, and resources effectively to ensure successful completion of assignments.

Research and Innovation: Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies to integrate innovative solutions into projects.

Quality Assurance: Implement and maintain quality control measures to guarantee the reliability and performance of mechanical systems.

Documentation: Prepare and maintain comprehensive engineering documentation, including reports, schematics, and technical drawings.

Compliance: Ensure compliance with all relevant industry codes, standards, and regulations in Canada.

Collaboration: Work closely with interdisciplinary teams, including electrical engineers, designers, and project managers, to achieve project goals.

Problem Solving: Analyze and troubleshoot complex engineering issues, proposing effective solutions.

Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.

Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) designation is highly preferred.

Proven experience in mechanical design, analysis, and project management.

Proficiency in CAD software and other engineering tools.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

Knowledge of local building codes, regulations, and safety standards in Canada.

Innovative mindset with a passion for continuous improvement.

Benefits

Competitive annual salary of $500,000 USD.

Opportunity for career advancement and professional development.

Comprehensive health and dental benefits.

Relocation assistance, if required.

An exciting work environment with access to cutting-edge technology.

A chance to make a significant impact on the field of mechanical engineering.

How To Apply

If you are ready to take your career to new heights and are excited about the prospect of working in Canada on groundbreaking projects, we encourage you to apply today. Please submit your resume, a cover letter detailing your relevant experience, and any additional relevant documentation to [email address].

Visa Answer is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals, including those with diverse backgrounds and experiences.

Note: The mentioned salary is for illustrative purposes and may not reflect current market conditions or visa requirements for foreign nationals working in Canada. Please refer to current labor laws and regulations for accurate details.

title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
YES (Yield Engineering Systems, Inc.) is a leading manufacturer of reliable, high-tech, cost-effective capital equipment that transforms materials and surfaces at the nanoscale. From startups to the Fortune 50, our customers rely on YES to help them unleash products that change lives – from cellphones and IoT devices, to AI and virtual reality, to diagnostic tests for COVID.




As a preferred provider of wet and dry process technology, we look forward to talking with smart, energetic, team-oriented people who can grow with us. We provide competitive salary and benefits, including long term incentives and some of the best co-workers you’ll find anywhere. If this appeals to you, please read on!




Job Title: Manufacturing Engineer

Location: Coimbatore




We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Manufacturing Engineer to join our team. As a manufacturing engineer, you will be responsible for handling the implementation of specialized systems, manage technical support, drive innovation, and optimize processes for enhanced efficiency and quality.




Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

 * Evaluate manufacturing processes based on quality criteria such as efficiency and speed.
 * Represent and fulfil core BU requirements from manufacturing engineering standpoint.
 * Drive ECN/ECR from initiation to implementation
 * Study production and machine requirements
 * Develop and test effective automated and manual systems.
 * Design and install equipment.
 * Organize and manage manufacturing workflows and resources.
 * Integrate disparate systems (e.g., equipment handling, transport)
 * Optimize facility layouts, production lines, machine operations, and network performance.
 * Resolve issues and delays in production.
 * Find ways to reduce costs and maximize quality.
 * Train staff in new and existing processes
 * Collaborate with other engineers, contractors, and suppliers.
 * Ensure that manufacturing procedures follow safety and environmental regulations.
 * Upgrade systems and processes with new technology
 * Provide regular status updates to stakeholders, including senior management, highlighting key achievements, risks, and upcoming milestones.




Desired Characteristics

 * Able to perform duties with minimal supervision.
 * Self-starter, highly motivated, resourceful, creative, results-oriented, and decisive
 * A strong practitioner of Lean systems and a continuous improvement mindset
 * Comfortable with significant autonomy
 * Flexible and resourceful
 * Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.




Requirements

 * Four-year degree and two to five years prior work as Manufacturing engineer in a capital equipment / precision machine tool manufacturing setup
 * Strong technical background from manufacturing engg standpoint with the ability to understand drawings, BOM and effectively communicate technical requirements / concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 * Experience in providing manufacturing solutions for precision machine tools with mechanical , electrical & electronic systems, with the ability to coordinate and prioritize projects.
 * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.
 * Proficient in CAD, SolidWorks, Autocad and Arena experience preferred
 * Results-oriented mindset with a focus on delivering high-quality outcomes.
 * Ability to adapt to changing priorities and thrive in a fast-paced environment.




If you are a self-motivated individual with a passion for technology and a proven track record in providing manufacturing solutions to complex and precision capital equipment, we would love to hear from you. Join our team and play a crucial role in driving the efficiency of the equipment and solutions.




Compensation

 * YES offers a stimulating and fun working environment, competitive salaries and benefits, and long-term incentives.




Additional Information

 * YES is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.




Come find out why YES is such a great place to work. Apply today!

title: Product Engineer – Brake Friction
description:
First Brands Group, LLC is the parent company of many of the automotive industry's most recognizable OEM and Aftermarket brands. First Brands Group is a privately held organization and leader in automotive repair and maintenance products, headquartered in Cleveland, Ohio with operations found around the globe.

We are a team of professionals dedicated to building profitable, enduring growth among all our customers with an unrelenting drive to exceed customer’s expectations.

Designed and engineered with Original Equipment rigor and quality, our products serve vehicle manufacturers, technicians and drivers everywhere.

We are looking for a a skilled content editor/ proof reader that spans digital, catalogue, packaging, website and social content creation.

Ideal candidate is someone with a deep understanding of automotive aftermarket parts, a keen eye for detail, and strong editing skills. The right candidate will be responsible for editing and maintaining product information, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and clarity throughout each content channel




General Purpose:

The Product Engineer - Brake Friction will be responsible for the engineering of brake friction assemblies. This includes the reverse engineering of OE samples; the design and creation of drawings, models, and assemblies; and creation of bills of materials.




Job Duties and Responsibilities:




 * Reverse engineer existing components using physical measurements
 * Utilize Solidworks and other CAD systems for design and creation of product
 * Work closely with other members of the Friction Engineering team on the design and documentation of new product
 * Publish and maintain manufacturing drawings with our global manufacturing centers
 * Convert scanned assemblies into drawings and models for development
 * Provide support to Sales, Customer Service, Quality, Product Marketing, Purchasing, and Distribution Center for issues related to brake friction products
 * Ensure department and organization KPI’s are met
 * Contribute to Continuous Improvement activities focused on both Product and Process




Education and Experience:




 * Experience reverse engineering components for aftermarket development
 * Bachelor of Engineering Degree (preferably in Mechanical Engineering)
 * Solid understanding of automotive braking systems
 * Automotive parts or technical knowledge
 * Experience with CAD systems (Both 2-D and 3-D) - Solidworks is highly preferred
 * Experience with 3-D scanning technology and converting scans to models
 * Experience with GD&T and Metrology
 * Familiarity with ISO 9001/TS16949 Quality Management System requirements
 * Familiarity with AIAG core tools such as PPAP, APQP, FMEA
 * Knowledge of Microsoft products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, etc.)
 * Strong analytical skill sets including problem solving techniques such as Fishbone, 5-Why
 * Ability to work in a cross-functional environment
 * Excellent communication skills
 * Attention to detail and accuracy in data entry

title: Product Engineer (1-2 Years)
description:
• Bachelors in EE or related engineering degree

• 1-2 years of experience with product engineering experience on highly complex products/projects







• Solid understanding of analog and digital circuits their operation and analysis

• Extensive hands on experience working with different lab equipment for taking data and / or performing device debug or failure analysis. For example use of the curve tracers; return loss analyzers, oscilloscopes and spectrum analyzers.

• Experience of bench testing of op-amps, ADCs, mixed –signal circuits and digital circuits

• Experience with bench validation and characterization PCBs

• Experience with integrated circuit and device failure analysis

• Experience with Final Test System or mixed signal ATE

• Programming skills for automation of bench characterization equipment (Labview/Teststand), along with C and or C++ for ATE

• Extensive knowledge of statistics and tools to analyze large amounts of characterization data and determine and set production test limits and predict yield data

• Knowledge of device packaging and wafer fabrication process

• Knowledge of reliability requirements and multi-temp characterization methodology using statistical analysis

• Have working knowledge of what is required to take a product from development stage to production

• Ability to work in a team environment and understand cross-functional team dynamics

• Ability to work with global customers to align project schedules with customers’ key milestones

• Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills

• Strong problem solving, verbal and written communications skills

• Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions

• Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery

• Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships

• Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment

• Ability to take the initiative and drive for results.

• Collaborate and work in a team environment with Design, Applications, Test, Marketing, Manufacturing, Quality and Reliability in all aspects of new product development, production release to accomplish goals and objectives

• Develop and implement Qualification plans

• Design sHTOL, dHTOL, ELFR, BHAST, and PTC boards to qualify Analog products.

• Perform evaluation, debug and characterization of integrated circuits to ensure they meet the product requirement specifications and manufacturing requirements

• Work with failure analysis (FA) to determine root cause of any reliability and qualification failures

• Work with process and package technology development to develop and qualify technologies for new product development

• Work closely with the global manufacturing facilities to address customer specific product quality, yield management and cost reductions issues on mature products. Scope of work could include product spins and derivatives

• Work with planning team to ensure smooth device ramp post release to manufactuing (RTM).

• Qualify second source wafer fab, assembly / test (A/T) facility, and Bill of Materials (BOM) to ensure device continutiy of supply.

• Perform test conversion, test time reduction, and yield improvements to achieve device entitlement operational transfer cost (OTC).

• Lead a cross functional team on the execution of releasing new products and ensuring successful return on investment for every development; the team consists of Design, Marketing, Systems & Applications, Validation, Product & Test Engineering, Firmware/Software Engineering, Manufacturing, Field, and Quality

• Work with wafer fabrication, assembly & test sites to guarantee schedule, cost and quality

• Communicate weekly to management on status of each project

title: Mechanical Engineer (Canada) - $500,000/year USD
description:
Job Title: Mechanical Engineer

Position Overview

Are you a talented Mechanical Engineer seeking an exciting career opportunity in Canada? Visa Answer is actively searching for an exceptional individual to join our esteemed overseas client's team in Canada. This position offers a highly competitive compensation package, with an annual salary of $500,000 USD, making it a truly exceptional opportunity for professionals looking to achieve significant financial growth and career advancement.

Job Description

As a Mechanical Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in our client's organization in Canada. You will be responsible for contributing to the design, development, and implementation of innovative mechanical systems, ensuring they meet the highest industry standards and performance requirements. This is a unique opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and make a substantial impact on the field of mechanical engineering.

Key Responsibilities

Design and Development: Collaborate with a team of engineers to design, analyze, and develop mechanical systems and components for various projects.

Engineering Analysis: Conduct thorough engineering analysis and simulations to evaluate the structural integrity, performance, and safety of mechanical systems.

Project Management: Manage project timelines, budgets, and resources effectively to ensure successful completion of assignments.

Research and Innovation: Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies to integrate innovative solutions into projects.

Quality Assurance: Implement and maintain quality control measures to guarantee the reliability and performance of mechanical systems.

Documentation: Prepare and maintain comprehensive engineering documentation, including reports, schematics, and technical drawings.

Compliance: Ensure compliance with all relevant industry codes, standards, and regulations in Canada.

Collaboration: Work closely with interdisciplinary teams, including electrical engineers, designers, and project managers, to achieve project goals.

Problem Solving: Analyze and troubleshoot complex engineering issues, proposing effective solutions.

Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.

Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) designation is highly preferred.

Proven experience in mechanical design, analysis, and project management.

Proficiency in CAD software and other engineering tools.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

Knowledge of local building codes, regulations, and safety standards in Canada.

Innovative mindset with a passion for continuous improvement.

Benefits

Competitive annual salary of $500,000 USD.

Opportunity for career advancement and professional development.

Comprehensive health and dental benefits.

Relocation assistance, if required.

An exciting work environment with access to cutting-edge technology.

A chance to make a significant impact on the field of mechanical engineering.

How To Apply

If you are ready to take your career to new heights and are excited about the prospect of working in Canada on groundbreaking projects, we encourage you to apply today. Please submit your resume, a cover letter detailing your relevant experience, and any additional relevant documentation to [email address].

Visa Answer is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals, including those with diverse backgrounds and experiences.

Note: The mentioned salary is for illustrative purposes and may not reflect current market conditions or visa requirements for foreign nationals working in Canada. Please refer to current labor laws and regulations for accurate details.

title: Automotive Mechanical Engineer
description:
Company Description

Liger Mobility is a technology company based in Mumbai, focused on transforming the two-wheeler experience with cutting-edge IOT-powered solutions. Our vision is to enable seamless human-machine interaction in the two-wheeler realm by leveraging core sciences and IOT.




Role Description

This is a full-time on-site role for an Automotive Mechanical Engineer, located in Mumbai. As an Automotive Mechanical Engineer, you will be responsible for designing and developing mechanical components for our two-wheeler products, validating and testing prototypes, collaborating with cross-functional teams for design optimization and performance evaluation, and ensuring compliance with safety standards. Additionally, you will work closely with our manufacturing and supply chain partners to ensure quality and timely delivery of products.




Qualifications

 * Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field
 * 3+ years of experience in automotive mechanical design and development, preferably in the two-wheeler realm
 * Proficiency in 3D CAD software such as SolidWorks, CREO, or CATIA
 * Experience with simulation and analysis tools such as ANSYS or Hyperworks
 * Experience with structural parts
 * Experience Plastic parts, CAS, Class A, Class B Surfacing, Engineering, Tooling, Production
 * Knowledge of Standards and best practices. Experience with PPAP.
 * Strong understanding of manufacturing processes and materials, and familiarity with design for manufacturability and assembly
 * Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
 * Strong communication and interpersonal skills, and ability to work in cross-functional teams
 * Experience with electric vehicles or IOT-powered systems is a plus
 * Experience with project management tools such as Jira or Trello is a plus

title: Mechanical Design Engineer
description:
I. Hiring specifications

Job Purpose: Responsible for designing scalable product for autonomous mobile robots. As a Mechanical Design Engineer you will be responsible for designing scalable product for autonomous mobile robots department, you will play a pivotal role in the design and development of state-of-the-art robotic systems. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including electrical engineers, software developers, and project managers, to create robots that push the boundaries of technology and reshape industries. Your creative thinking, technical expertise, and attention to detail will be essential in bringing concepts to life and ensuring the successful implementation of robotic solutions.

Role Expectations

Ø Work mechanical design process for robotic systems, from concept to production, incorporating both functionality and aesthetics.

Ø Utilize CAD software (e.g., SolidWorks, Creo) to create detailed 3D models, assemblies, and technical drawings for various robot components and systems.

Ø Perform structural and thermal analysis to ensure the mechanical integrity and performance of robot designs, making necessary adjustments as needed.

Ø Collaborate with the electrical engineering team to integrate mechanical and electronic components seamlessly, considering factors such as space constraints and wiring management.

Ø Participate in design reviews, providing constructive feedback and addressing design challenges while maintaining alignment with project goals.

Ø Select appropriate materials and manufacturing processes, considering factors such as cost, durability, and production scalability.

Ø Contribute to the development of prototypes and conduct testing and validation to ensure designs meet performance and safety standards.

Ø Stay up-to-date with industry trends, new materials, and emerging technologies to drive innovation and continuous improvement in robotic designs.

Ø Provide mentorship and guidance to junior members of the mechanical design team, fostering knowledge sharing and skill development.

Reporting Structure

ü Role will report into Head of Mechanical Design

Interactions

ü Internal Stakeholders: Electrical Engineers, Software developers, and Project managers in Mobile robots team

ü External Stakeholders: Customers/Clients

II. PEOPLE SPECIFICATIONS

Profile: Ideally ~


 * BE or B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering or Industrial engineering
 * Proven experience (3-5 years) in mechanical design, preferably within the robotics or automation industry.
 * Proficiency in CAD software such as SolidWorks, Creo, or equivalent.
 * Strong understanding of mechanical principles, materials science, and manufacturing processes.
 * Experience with structural analysis tools and methodologies.
 * Familiarity with mechatronics and the integration of mechanical and electrical systems.
 * Effective communication skills to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
 * Demonstrated track record of delivering projects on time and within scope.
 * Creativity and a passion for pushing the boundaries of technology in the field of robotics.
   
   

Requisites: Exposure to mechanical product designing in autonomous mobile robots with manufacturing and automation background. Good Exposure on Solid work amp; AutoCAD.

Preferred currently working with Automation or Engineering solution provider company

Competencies

TECHNICAL:


 * Candidate should have sound knowledge 3D modelling and 2D manufacturing drawing on Solid works Software.
 * Strong working capability in CAD software such as SolidWorks, Creo, or equivalent.
   
   

Behavioural


 * Customer First: Operate with customer success mindset and align all our actions accordingly.
 * Collaborative problem solving: Organization interest supersedes individual interests; working together to solve problems effectively.
 * Ownership amp; Commitment : Going above amp; beyond the call of duty while also keeping up with the promises amp; targets under any circumstances.
 * Data Driven, First Principle : Objective Decision making based on data (Not on Hunches)
 * Expanding-Growth Mindset : Be open to new challenges whilst willing to step out of comfort zone in order to learn and grow.
 * Result amp; commercial orientation : Manage cost and resources to achieve business outcomes amp; commercial success.
 * Speed and Scalable Process Approach : Deploy processes that are flexible, agile and unlocks business value with speed.

title: Product Quality Engineer
description:
The Product Quality Engineer will play a critical role in the engineering department, focusing on planning and developing methods for battery testing, ensuring compliance with safety and design specifications, executing validation tests, analyzing quality results, and maintaining quality records. The successful candidate will leverage their expertise in battery manufacturing processes, quality assurance, and ISO documentation to drive continuous improvement and ensure adherence to quality standards.







Battery Testing Method Development:

 * Plan and develop different methods to test batteries, including performance, safety, and durability testing.
 * Implement testing protocols and procedures to ensure comprehensive evaluation of battery quality.




Compliance with Technical and Legal Specifications:

 * Ensure that all technical and legal specifications for safety and design are met in battery production.
 * Conduct regular reviews and audits to verify compliance with regulatory requirements.




Validation Execution:

 * Execute validation tests according to predefined test cases and protocols.
 * Analyze test results and validate product performance against quality standards.




Quality Result Analysis:

 * Execute tests and analyze quality results to identify deviations or non-conformities.
 * Develop corrective and preventive actions to address quality issues and improve product performance.




Battery Quality Standards and Specifications:

 * Ensure that battery quality meets standards and specifications for the expected lifespan of 3-5 years.
 * Implement quality assurance measures to uphold the reliability and safety of battery products.




LFP Battery Manufacturing Process Knowledge:

Possess knowledge of LFP (Lithium Iron Phosphate) battery manufacturing processes.

Identify and address problems in the manufacturing process to maintain product quality and consistency.




Quality Records Management:

 * Prepare and maintain quality records, management information system (MIS) reports, and documentation for system audits.
 * Document procedures, inspection plans, work instructions, and quality assurance specifications.




MIS Reporting:

 * Prepare monthly and yearly MIS reports on quality performance and key metrics.
 * Analyze trends and deviations to identify opportunities for improvement.
 * Quality Improvement Initiatives:
 * Analyze rejection rates and quality metrics using various quality control (QC) tools.
 * Implement containment and permanent corrective actions in collaboration with cross-functional teams.




ISO Documentation:

 * Ensure compliance with ISO documentation requirements for quality management systems.
 * Maintain day-to-day ISO documentation and support internal and external audits.




Lab Equipment Requirement Analysis:

 * Identify the requirements for lab equipment to support battery testing and quality assurance activities.
 * Collaborate with procurement teams to acquire necessary equipment and resources.




Qualifications:

 * Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Quality Management, or related field. Master's degree preferred.
 * 3+ years of experience in product quality management, preferably in battery manufacturing or related industries.
 * Strong knowledge of battery testing methods, quality standards, and regulatory requirements.
 * Experience with ISO documentation and quality management systems.
 * Proficiency in quality assurance methodologies and tools, such as statistical process control (SPC) and failure mode and effects analysis (FMEA).
 * Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to identify root causes of quality issues and implement effective corrective actions.
 * Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
 * Familiarity with LFP battery manufacturing processes and quality control practices.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer
description:
Job Description

A Mechanical Design Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, and testing

mechanical systems, components, and equipment. They collaborate with

cross-functional teams to create innovative solutions that meet project requirements

and industry standards. The role involves utilizing computer-aided design (CAD)

software, conducting analysis, and ensuring designs are feasible, reliable, and

cost-effective. Additionally, Mechanical Design Engineers may be involved in

prototyping, troubleshooting, and supporting manufacturing processes.

Key Responsibilities


 * Designing and developing mechanical systems, components, and equipment
   
   

according to project specifications.


 * Utilizing CAD software (SolidWorks) to create 2D and 3D models, assemblies, and
   
   

detailed engineering drawings.


 * Conducting analysis and simulations (e.g., finite element analysis, computational
   
   

fluid dynamics) to validate designs and optimize performance.


 * Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including electrical engineers,
   
   

industrial designers, and manufacturing personnel, to ensure design feasibility

and integration.


 * Participating in design reviews, providing technical input, and incorporating
   
   

feedback to improve designs.


 * Creating and maintaining engineering documentation, such as design
   
   

specifications, test plans, and reports.


 * Troubleshooting and resolving design-related issues during development and
   
   

manufacturing stages.


 * Evaluating and selecting appropriate materials, components, and suppliers to
   
   

meet quality, cost, and performance requirements.

Skills And Qualifications


 * Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.
 * Proven experience (min-3 years) in mechanical design engineering.
 * Proficiency in CAD software ( SolidWorks) for 2D and 3D modeling.
 * Strong knowledge of engineering principles (statics, dynamics,
   
   

kinematics,thermals, materials, and manufacturing processes.


 * Experience with simulation and analysis software (basic to medium designer
   
   

level simulation) for design validation.


 * Familiarity with relevant industry standards and regulations.(optional)
 * Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
 * Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment.
 * Effective communication skills to convey technical information and collaborate
   
   

with cross-functional teams.


 * Attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality designs.
 * Strong organizational and time management skills to meet project deadlines.
 * Knowledge of prototyping techniques and hands-on experience with tools and
   
   

equipment is a plus.


 * Familiarity with design for manufacturing (DFM), DFMEA and design for assembly
   
   

(DFA) principles and other robust design tools.


 * Familiarity with project management concepts and tools. (optional)
   
   

Qualifications


 * Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field
 * 4+ years' of industry experience
 * Strong knowledge of mechanical parts and computer-aided design

title: Quality Engineer

title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
About Us




AXISCADES is a technology solutions company focusing on engineering solutions and services. We bring expertise that caters to the engineering, technology, manufacturing and digital needs of fortune 100 clients in aerospace, defense, heavy engineering, automotive, energy & medical equipment sectors. With decades of experience in creating innovative, sustainable and safer products worldwide, AXISCADES delivers business value across the entire engineering lifecycle. AXISCADES is headquartered in Bangalore and has offices across India, North America, Europe, and the Asia Pacific region




About the job




The ideal candidate should have a minimum 3 years of experience in diesel engine assembly. The candidate should possess expertise in various areas, including virtual build validation, time study, torque audit, and build book creation. They will be responsible for implementing modifications to processes, tools, and equipment to accommodate engineering changes and process change requests in engine, battery, chargers, motors, and locomotives assembly.




What You’ll Do




 * Implement process/tool/equipment modifications to support Engineering Changes and Process Change requests at Engine / Battery / chargers / Motors / Locomotives Assembly
 * Create/update manufacturing process documents – PFD, PFMEA, Safety FMEA, Control Plan, Standard Work and Standard Operating Procedures
 * Configure and update Standard Work and Torque tools in the Manufacturing Execution Support system (PINpoint/CAPP+/MESA)
 * Create/update process routing in SAP (CBS)
 * Conduct Engine/Loco Assembly/ Dis Assembly process audit. Work with cross functional team to resolve audit findings within stipulated time
 * Conduct Ergonomic Study for Engine Assembly process, identify gaps and implement suitable solution to eliminate ergonomic risks.
 * Support continuous improvement drive by implementing improvement suggestions received from cross functional team
 * Support cross functional team to validate Engine Assembly issues, identify the root cause using Six Sigma methodology and support for issue resolution
 * Support New Product Introduction programs through procurement of process tools and equipment




What We’re Looking For




 * Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering
 * 4-8 years of relevant work experience
 * Mandatory minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in diesel engine assembly
 * Proficient in Virtual Build validation
 * Experienced in conducting Time studies for process optimization
 * Skilled in performing Torque Audits to ensure precision in assembly processes
 * Capable of creating comprehensive Build Books to document and guide assembly procedures
 * Strong background in Manufacturing Experience
 * Expertise in Virtual Build validation
 * Familiarity with the use of Vismockup tool

 * Design, implement, and optimize manufacturing systems for renewable energy products, ensuring scalability and efficiency.
 * Collaborate with design and R&D teams to incorporate manufacturability considerations into product development.
 * Work closely with the supply chain team to ensure timely and cost-effective sourcing of materials and components.
 * Collaborate with suppliers to improve manufacturing processes and resolve any production-related issues.
 * Drive continuous improvement initiatives using lean manufacturing and Six Sigma methodologies.
 * Analyze production data and implement changes to optimize productivity and reduce defects.
 * Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for manufacturing processes, standard operating procedures, and quality standards.
 * Train production personnel on new processes and procedures.
 * Work closely with cross-functional teams, including design engineers, quality assurance, and production teams, to achieve overall project goals.
 * Foster a collaborative and innovative work environment.

 * Proven experience in manufacturing engineering, preferably in the renewable energy sector.
 * Strong understanding of manufacturing processes, materials, and quality control standards.
 * Proficiency in CAD software and experience with manufacturing simulation tools.
